loans.name: Boinazar

texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following its development MLF “MicroInvest” transformed into a Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. In October 2008 MLF “MicroInvest”, together with LLC “Frontiers”, founded the Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” continues to carry out its mission, which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

A. Boinazar was born in 1964 in the Zafarabad region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. He has had his livestock business for 20 years; it is the family business. Boinazar dreams of having excellent livestock that he will give to his only son. Today he has one cow and 6 rams. He wants to buy a pedigreed bull and applies to KIVA for a loan of 1500 STJ. 
Boinazar thanks KIVA for its support and small business development all over the world.

loans.use: to purchase a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Minda

texts.en: 58-year old widow, Minda F., is a rice grower and store owner in Norala, South Cotabato. She has two children. Minda started her business in 2002 and still manages a farm and a sari-sari (variety) store because these are the things that help her provide all the needs in their family. Minda is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 which she will use to buy additional merchandise for her store. She will also buy fertilizers and chemicals for her farm. She believes that by buying these things, she will be able to surpass her normal sales in her store and harvest on her farm. CEVI helps Minda sustain her livelihood. CEVI clients are given not just loans, but education as well, to help their small business grow.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her store and fertilizers and chemicals for her farm

loans.name: Lilliam

texts.es:
Lilliam A. Veliz es una señora de 62 años de edad, quien vive,  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Cuatro Bocas de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche) y agricultura.

Doña Lilliam es viuda y tiene 5 hijos pero ya todos son mayores de edad por lo tanto no viven con ella pero si la ayudan  con diferentes gastos. Ella  se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de platano. Dice que el mercado para este producto es muy bueno. Comenta que gracias a este proyecto sus condiciones de vida han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento.

En estos momentos doña Lilliam desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢650,000 (seiscientos cincuenta mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su cosecha además comprar fertilizantes entre otros insumos. Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto poder incrementar la producción.
 
Doña Lilliam es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Bansuperafe; la cual está integrada solo por mujeres, ya que se especializa en apoyar a mujeres no profesionales y  jefas de hogar, es una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su sexto  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Lilliam A. Veliz is a 62 year old women who lives in a small rural community in Costa Rica called Cuatro Bocas de Upala, located in the province of Alajuela. There, they have business activities such as storekeeping, double purpose cattle farming (meat and dairy), and agriculture.

Lilliam is a widow and has 5 children, but all of them are older so they do not live with her. However, they do help her with different expenses. She is involved in agriculture, specifically to the cultivation of bananas. She says that the market for this product is very good. She comments that thanks for this project her quality of life has improved considerably and she has also grown as a person and has acquired a great deal of knowledge.

Right now, Lilliam would like a loan of 650,000 CRC for the maintenance of her crops and also to purchase fertilizers, among other supplies. With this loan, she hopes to have a good harvest with a product with appropriate characteristics to have a good sales price to increase production.

Lilliam is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Bansuperafe, which consists of only women. It specializes in supporting women who are not professionals or the head of household. It is one of EDESA’s 100 partner organizations in Costa Rica. This will be Lilliam’s sixth loan and with it, she hopes to continue growing on a personal and economic level, in addition to actively participating in the loan organization in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to maintain her banana plants

loans.name: Androa Alfred

texts.en:
B. Androa Alfred is 32 years old, married and blessed with one child. He is also looking after two dependents who are in school. He owns a rental shop, which is known as Chemical Tech, located along the main road in Koboko town. He has been operating his business since 2002, seven years so far. 

He is using the loan to purchase phone accessories to sell phones, phone housings and batteries and to repair phones for his customers and so forth. B. is a hardworking businessman whose dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories for selling phones, phone housings and batteries and to repair phones

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 23 años, es una joven muy alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos del hogar, puesto que no desea ser una carga en la familia. Tiene una fábrica de helados, la cual funciona en su casa, sus helados los distribuidos ella misma a todas las tiendas de su barrio, donde son vendidos rápidamente debido al sabor tan agradable que tienen, la mayoría de clientes ya saben que es Edith la que hace los helados y muchas veces le compran directamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede comerse los helados que desee mientras los prepara, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el frió que le hace mientras prepara los helados. Para el futuro anhela tener una heladería grande donde pueda vender sus propios helados.
Este es el sexto préstamo de Edith con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. Ella se siente muy cómoda en su banco comunal y siempre recibe consejos de sus compañeras mayores. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos helados y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Edith is 23 years old. She is a cheerful young woman who lives at home with her parents. Edith wants to help with the household expenses because she does not want to be a burden to her family. She makes ice cream out of her house and distributes her product to all the stores in the neighborhood, where it sells quickly because of its delicious flavor. Most of her customers know that she make ice cream and many times will buy directly from her. What she likes most about her job is that she can eat ice cream anytime while she is preparing it. She has been in business for 4 years and the most difficult part is having to endure the cold when making the ice cream. In the future, she hopes to open a large ice cream shop where she can sell her products.

This is Edith’s sixth loan with MFP. She has always been punctual with her payments and hopes to continue in the same manner. Edith feels very comfortable with her Communal Bank and always receives advice from the older members. With the loan of 2500 soles that she requested, she plans to buy more ingredients for making her delicious ice cream so that she can improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making ice cream

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La señora Brigida H. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños ofreciéndola en su tramo en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua donde oferta el producto a su clientela.

Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para la compra de la ropa y de esta manera continuar mejorando su condición en el negocio y llegar a ser una excelente comerciante de ropa en el mercado.
texts.en:
Señora Brigida H. runs a business selling clothes for women, men and children in a stall in the wholesale market of the city of Managua where she offers her products to her customers. She has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase clothing so that she can continue to improve her business and become a great trader of clothing in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is 25 years old and married with a child. He lives in Edo State, Nigeria, and has been a farmer for over four years. Lawrence is requesting the loan amount of 30,000 NGN to purchase more seedlings to plant and cultivate on his farmland. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma E. is from the village of Calacaan. She is 48 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Norma owns and operates a manufacturing business, manufacturing and selling products to local businesses and community members. Norma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Norma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Mork

texts.en:
Mork C. is a hard working woman who resides in the province of Kampong Chhnang, Cambodia.

Here she earns a living by selling vegetables and raising pig as well. She and her husband also cultivate a rice crop during the farming season.

The couple was married years ago and doesn’t have a child, but they plan to give birth next year.

Mork C. seeks capital to purchase piglets to raise as well as to accumulate various vegetables to fulfill the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and vegetables.

loans.name: Ochir

texts.en:
Ochir B. is 26 years old and lives with his wife in Uvurkhangai province, Mongolia. They live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, called a “ger.”

Ochir operates a small pet shop as well as a taxi service in his town with the help of his wife. His wife is mainly responsible for managing the pet shop where they sell many animals including dogs, cats, and fish, as well as a variety of animal products.

Ochir uses the family car to operate his taxi service. He started operating as a taxi driver in 2005 by transporting people to and from his province and the surrounding provinces. After growing his business, he used his savings to open the pet shop.

Ochir and his wife have many plans for their businesses in the future. They hope to soon expand the rented space in which they now operate the pet shop. Ochir is a very hardworking businessman and is known for his good character.

He says, "I want to have a large pet store in the future." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase animals and expand his pet shop.

About XacBank

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team:
http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase animals and expand his pet shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for her hair salon.

loans.name: Dulam

texts.en: B. is 33 years old and lives his wife and six-year-old son in Zavhan, one of western provinces of Mongolia. He and his family live in a "ger", a traditional Mongolian tent. His son attends a local secondary school. B. operates a livestock-related raw materials trading business in his province with the help of his wife. He usually purchases animal skin, unprocessed goat cashmere, etc. He has been conducting his business for many years and has had much success over the years. B. hopes to continue to expand his business in the future. He says, "With continued growth, I hope to improve my quality of life." He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase raw materials to sell for his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Saint Rhode

texts.en:
Saint Rhode is from Happy Valley Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 27 years old and married with two children. To make a living, Saint Rhode operates a computer and photocopying center. His business earns approximately 9000 PHP a month. In 2009, Saint Rhode joined PMPC to improve their living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He successfully repaid his previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. Now he has applied for a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase school and office supplies. This will be the second loan Saint Rhode has taken out from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase school and office supplies

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad Q. is a 37-year-old man who works as a car repair specialist. He is married and has three children who are the meaning of his life.

Mahammad started his business when he was 18 and since that time he has become very experienced in his job and has gained respect among local people. His garage is never empty.

The tools Mahammad uses are old and he needs to purchase new and more modern tools. For this purpose he applied for 1,600 AZN. Mahammad counts on your help.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for car repair

loans.name: Karamatou

texts.fr: N. Karamatou est née le 15 juin 1972 à Zinvié au Bénin.  Depuis trois ans, Karamatou vit avec son mari, SIKIROU Affissou, un vendeur de pièces détachées, et ses deux enfants au quartier Sènadé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Karamatou n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Il y a sept ans, Karamatou s’est mise dans la vente des pâtes dentifrices et des produits divers de façon ambulante.  Karamatou s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Karamatou est à son deuxième crédit à ALIDé.  Karamatou a bien remboursé le premier crédit qu’elle a obtenu.  Karamatou voudrait renforcer le stock de ses produits.  Mais compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose, Karamatou sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
N. Karamatou was born on June 15, 1972 in Zinvié, in Benin.  For three years, she has been living with her husband, SIKIROU Affissou, who is a seller of replacement parts, and with her two children, in the Sènadé district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  The couple jointly ensure that family expenses are covered.  Karamatou never attended school.  Seven years ago, she started selling toothpaste and a variety of products door-to-door.  She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She is on her second ALIDé loan having repaid the first loan she obtained.  She would like to bolster her stock of goods.  But given the few financial means she has at her disposal, Karamatou is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying toothpaste

loans.name: Zibora

texts.en:
Zibora, a 62-year-old widow with seven children and four grandchildren, is seeking this loan so that she can continue to grow her business enough to provide an education for her grandchildren.  Zibora's farm is near Kitale in Kenya's Rift Valley, where she began mixed farming about ten years ago after many years of just dairy farming. Her main income comes from selling milk to local vendors, and she says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of greater financing.

Zibora has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 11,000 to buy more chickens to expand her poultry business.  In the future, she'd like to continue to expand by increasing her maize production and adding fruit crops.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Soaphorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Soaphorn E. is 46 years old and is a villager who lives in Tuol Krasang village in Kandal province. She currently stays at home and cooks and also cares for her children. Her husband, Mr. Sarvuth Oeun, is a soldier for which he receives a small salary to support his family. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

In order to increase income to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Soaphorn E. wants to start a new business as a motorcycle taxi driver. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for this purpose. This couple has five children, three of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, another one is a laborer in a private company while the youngest one is three years old.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Cony Maria

texts.es:
La señora Cony Maria A. S., tiene 34 años de edad es casado y su marido se dedica a la agricultura, brindando un apoyo a al economía del hogar, ellos son una familia de 3 hijos de los cuales dependen económicamente de ellos, la Familia habita en el populosos Barrio 31 de Diciembre, conocido por la falta de necesidades básicas que agobian a los que ahí habitan.

Ella se dedica a la venta de leña, tortillas y tiene una pequeña venta de abarrotes y productos para el hogar, dentro de las necesidades, que mas la agobian, es el reemplazo inmediato del techo de zinc, que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, es por esta razon que ella solicita del prestamo para comprar los materiales de construcción para la nstalación del techo de concreto, asi les brinde mayor seguridad y la tranquilidad de realizar reparaciones que szean optimas a la infraestructura del hogar. En los últimos meses ha observado una baja en los ingresos de las ventas, es por esta razón que ella solicita del credito por que no tiene los recursos necesarios para invertir en este proyecto ha futuro solicitara de otros credito para reinvertir en su negocio en la compra de un mayor inventario, que le surta su pulpería y con esto mejore las condiciones de vida de la familia.
Ellos son una familia muy responsable y unida que gozan por el respeto y cariño de su comunidad pro el ejemplo de vida que han brindado a los demas.
texts.en:
Cony Maria A. S., 34, is married; her husband is a farmer and contributes to family support. They have three dependent children. The family lives in the crowded 31 de Diciembre neighborhood the residents of which are notorious for living there without their basic needs met. She sells firewood and tortillas and has a small grocery store where she stocks basic needs items. Among her reasons for distress is the need to immediately replace the zinc metal roof which is in very poor condition. She is asking for funds to buy building materials and supplies to install a concrete roof that will provide better security and tranquility because it would mean optimal home infrastructure. Income from sales has decreased the last few months so she is asking for a loan because she lacks the necessary funds to invest in this project. She plans to ask for future loans to invest in her business, buying more inventory to stock her store thereby improving her family’s living conditions. They are a responsible and close-knit family that is respected and well-liked by their community because of the good living example they set.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Mrs. Channy Loek Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty two people, who are part of this village bank loan, live in Kaoh Prah village in Kandal province. Mrs. Channy L. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members, who will use their part of the loan for different purposes. She is a Chinese noodle seller in the local village, and earns some income to support her family. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it, but does not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Channy L. decided to ask for a loan to buy ingredients. Her husband is a policeman and she has two children who attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.es:
Paulita es una madre de familia de 55 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el sector Vallehermoso del distrito de Monsefú, un distrito conocido a nivel regional por la producción de artesanía en cerámica y madera y también por sus ferias turístico – religiosas, el lugar se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la ganadería desde hace mas de diez años, ella cría vacas en un terreno cercano a su vivienda y aprovecha la leche que éstas producen, vendiéndola a un acopiador de la zona. Los ingresos que le brinda el negocio los utiliza en apoyar a su esposo, que es agricultor, en el mantenimiento de su familia, durante todos estos años estas actividades les han permitido salir adelante y solventar sus gastos familiares.

Paulita desea mejorar la producción de su ganado para así poder percibir mayores ganancias, por eso desea alimentar a sus vacas con alimento balanceado. Para lograr este objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Paulita es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y convertirse en acopiadora, para sí percibir mas ganancias y sacar adelante a su familia, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una persona honesta y responsable.
texts.en:
Paulita is a 55 year old mother who lives along with her family in the Vallehermoso sector of the Monsefú district. The district is well known at the regional level for its production of ceramic and wooden crafts, as well as for its religious and tourist festivals. It is located forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Paulita has worked in livestock farming for more than ten years. She raises cattle on land close to her home and makes the most of the milk that they produce by selling it to a local middleman. She uses her earnings to help her husband, who is also a farmer, support their family. Throughout all these years, these activities have allowed them to thrive and pay their family expenses. Paulita would like to improve the milk production of her cattle in order to increase her income. For this to happen, she must give her cows a balanced feed. To achieve this goal, she requires her first loan from Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 1000 Nuevos soles. Paulita is a hardworking woman who is devoted to her family. Her biggest dream is to continue to grow her business and become a middleman herself. In this way, she would earn more money and improve her family’s life. In the area where she lives, she is well respected by neighbors and acquaintances for being an honest and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy balanced feed in order to improve the mild production of her cows.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda M. is from the village of Salay Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Rosalinda is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosalinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. R. P. Juan Carlos, vive en la venta baja  perteneciente al distrito de Santiago. Tiene a cargo a su esposa y a sus dos hijos. Trabaja como obrero de campo en la parcela  de la Sra. Lilia Huamani desde hace 2 años. Vive en casa de sus padres a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para apoyar con la realización de los acabados de la vivienda de sus padres. Su sueño es poder terminar de construir su vivienda a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El Sr. R. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos R. P. lives in the district of Santiago. He provides for his wife and their two children. He has worked as a farm laborer on the land of Mrs. Lilia Huamani for the past 2 years. He lives in his parents' home, which is currently being remodeled. He is asking for a loan to help with the remodeling projects of his parents' house. His dream is to be able to finish building his house to be able to provide a better quality of life for his family. Mr. R. is grateful for the support that we can provide him through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia A. is from the village of Capellan. She is 33 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fourteen years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Delia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anilyn

texts.en:
Anilyn B. is from the village of Villa Corazon. She is 48 years old. Anilyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Anilyn owns & operates a weaving business selling sedge mats & mattresses to tourists and local community members. Anilyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Anilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Anilyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Anilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Marbelly Dayana

texts.es:
Marbelly es una joven dedicada al trabajo y comercio pues ambas han sido su fuente de entrada, trabaja como secretaria desde hace nueve años, y vende cosméticos, productos Avon el cual nace la idea para lograr  pagar sus gastos ya que todo ah aumentado, su esposo trabaja como tipógrafo.
A través del financiamiento ha logrado comprar más productos, y una variedad de ropa, lo que ha venido a aumentar sus ganancias y mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.
Su casa es pequeña, y ha ido poco a poco construyendo.
Con este préstamo comprara: cremas para piel, vanidades, maquillaje, perfumes de dama y varón y  unos encargos de ropa.
Su objetivo es lograr la captación de clientes nuevos, colocar todos sus productos, para seguir creciendo en su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Marbelly is a young woman who is dedicated to both her job and her business since they both give her a source of empowerment. She has been working as a secretary for nine years and then came up with the idea of selling Avon cosmetics and products in order to pay for her expenses which have increased. Her husband works as a typographer.

With the help of financing, she has been able to buy more products and a variety of clothing. As a result, her earnings have increased and her household conditions have improved. Her house is small and she has been able to build a little bit at a time.

This loan will be used to by skin crèmes, compacts, make-up, men’s and women’s colognes, and clothing she has on order. Her goal is to attract new customers and be stocked with all of her products so that she can continue growing her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase skin crèmes, compacts, make-up, men’s and women’s colognes, and clothing

loans.name: Darling Amparo

texts.es:
La  Sra. Darling C. H., Ella trabaja como  Conserje en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Es madre de familia de dos niños  y estos se en encuentra en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: piso, cemento, arena para poner el piso a su casa de habitación.
Darling dice que gracias a  los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel  ha podido mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Darling C. H. works as a custodian at the Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería. She is the mother of two school-aged children.

The loan requested is for the purchase of construction materials such as: flooring, cement, and sand to install a floor in the house where she lives.

Darling says that thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL, she has been able to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to her house by repairing the floor in her home

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan W. is 27 years old. She is single and has one child, age eight years old. Her business is located in Juja, a busy area in Thika. Thika is the region in Kenya known for the production of pineapples. Susan sells fruits and vegetables to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and her only major challenge is slow business in some seasons. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Susan is using her loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more fruits and vegetables to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to become a supplier of fruits and vegetables and also buy a plot of land to build her own house. She describes herself as a very hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
N. Lê Thị (20209010008), a 47-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh, is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cụm Đông 1 - nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).

N., who is married and has three school-aged children, owns and operates a service-based business providing general services to local community members. Engaged in this business for over one year, she earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month.

In 2008, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase equipment to improve the business, she is now requesting a new loan of 6.944.000 VND to invest in expanding the business. The will be Nhan's fourth loan from SEDA, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Đỗ V. T. (0) is a 33-year-old male who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support his business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. Lê Thị Y. (0) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

3. Nguyễn Thị C. (0) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

N. Lê Thị (20209010008) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.. N. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cụm Đông 1 - nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND. Vào 2008, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. N. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.048.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thiết bị để cải thiện công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.944.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Đỗ V. T. (0) là 33 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Lê Thị Y. (0) là 23 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 3. Nguyễn Thị C. (0) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được T. báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục T. báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp T. tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Chhuon C. is a 45-year-old farmer who lives in province of Kompong Chhnang. Chhuon C. is married to Mr. Vanna, age 43, who works with her in the farming business. She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From this business they can generate an income of around US$ 4 per day. This humble couple has two single children who are students. This rainy season, the family planted more vegetables and some fruit on their own farmland two months ago but their crops are not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. Because of this condition, Chhuon C. needs a loan from Kiva in order to buy fertilizers to improve her vegetable and fruit yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve her vegetable and fruit yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a shop.

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad lives in Khanewal, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She lives there with her family in a two-room brick house in an area called Railway landy. She moved there 15 years ago. She is a housewife and spends most of her time at home doing her housework. She is a mother of three sons and two daughters. All of them are getting their education except the eldest, who works in a factory.

She is married to S. M. who works for Pakistan Railways. He also runs an animal sales business. He buys animals at cheap rates from the animal markets, raises them, and sells them to customers. 

Shamshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan he will buy some goats, raise them, and then sell them to his customers for a good profit. He has been involved in this business for the past 10 years and Shamshad is very confident that her husband will make good money from his business after the loan investment. She is a regular user of the Asasah loan service and this is her fifth loan application.  

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamshad.

loans.use: To buy goats for animal sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a machine to cut soapstone.

loans.name: Santos Coronado

texts.es:
Santos  de 31 años de edad, vive con su esposa doña Felipa del Carmen Sevilla en Colonia Villa Alvarez, del Municipio de El Almendro, desde su niñes se dedica a la ganaderia, sus padres le dieron como herencia su finca y ganado, por lo que el Sr. A. esta todo el tiempo cuidando su ganado de modo que éste se mantenga en buen estado sanitarios y nutricionales, recibe ingreso de la venta de quezo, leche y la comercializacion del Ganado, en la comunidad tiene buenas referencia, siendo un hombre trabajador, responsable y con muchos deseos de superarse en el ambito Ganadero.

y agradece el apyo de Kiva ya que gracias a este Finaciamiento podra obtener mejores resultados en su inversion,  

Su mayor sueño es que su Familia goce de buenas condiciones de vida y mantenerse unidos para poder realizar actividades cotidianas en Conjunto.
texts.en:
Santos is 31 years old and lives with his wife, Felipa del Carmen Sevilla, in Colonia Villa Alvarez in the town of El Almendro.  

Since he was a child, he has worked in cattle farming.  His parents gave him the family farm and livestock. He spends his time caring for his cattle so that they stay in good health and have good nutrition.  He earns income from the sale of cheese, milk, and livestock. 

He is well respected in the community and is a hard-working, responsible man who wants to succeed with his livestock business.  He is thankful for Kiva's support since this loan will allow him to have better results in his business.

His dream is that his family enjoys good living conditions and that they stay united to do everyday activities together.

loans.use: Purchase calves to raise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married man and the father of two young children. He has helped his brother who works as a blacksmith over the past eight years. In 2008, he started working independently from his brother’s shop. In addition to his private work, he still helps him from time to time.  

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an iron welding machine to be able to take more orders. He is optimistic about his business prospects and he is certain that with the help of the loan, his business income will grow. In the future, he hopes to put aside the needed savings to be able to open his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase an iron welding motor

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela es una cliente de 29 años de edad,  que vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia, la cual ha construido con mucho esfuerzo y abnegación.  Su casita está ubicada en Catacaos, en la región Piura, a mas o menos 4 horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, los cuales los ofrece en una pequeña bodega.  Esta bodega la tiene desde hace 8 años aproximadamente, y gracias a la buena atención que brinda tiene mucha clientela, quienes la estiman y la apoyan.

Carmela quiere comprar más productos para poder ofrecerlos en su bodega y así satisfacer la demanda que tiene en la actualidad.  Para lograr su objetivo ha creido conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Carmela is 29 years old and lives with her children in their own house, which she built with a lot of hard work and self-control. Her home is located in Catacaos, in Piura region, more or less 4 hours from Chiclayo city, capital of Lambayeque region.

Carmela sells basic goods in her small grocery store. Her store is about 8 years old and has a number of loyal customers who support and think highly of Carmela, thanks to her good customer service.

She hopes to stock her store with new items to meet the current demand from her customers. To meet this goal, Carmela is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase of more items for grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for home mortgage

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 34 years old and married with three children.  She supplies newspapers so as to earn a living.  She has engaged in the business for six years.  In her business, she has employed one person.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to improve her business.  She hopes to supply the newspapers wholesale in the future.  She has requested 80,000 Kes to add to her stock of newspapers.

loans.use: To buy newspapers

loans.name: Gabi Maria

texts.es:
Gabi C. tiene varios años con su tienda ya que comenzó alquilando un local por su casa y ahora se cambio a su casa y modifico la sala  y  ahorra el costo de alquiler. Gabi con la tienda que vende arroz, azúcar, legumbres ayuda a su hermana y a su mama pero ella es la que atiende todo el día el local.

Unos de sus obstáculos es que las calles aun no han sido terminadas y esto es un problema ya que esto dificultad muchas veces el acceso a los proveedores y a los clientes. Es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian en escuela particular. El préstamo es para la educación de su hija. Unas de sus metas es que su hija se realice como profesional y que su negocio crezca y tenga mas ventas con el arreglo de las calles.
texts.en:
Gabi C. has had her store for several years; she started out leasing a locale near her house and now she’s relocated and set up her store in her living room thus saving the rental cost.  Gabi sells rice, sugar and vegetables in her store.  Her sister and mother help her but she is the one tending to the store all day.

One of her obstacles is that the streets aren’t finished yet and that’s a problem because both suppliers and customers often have difficult access.

She is a single mother of two children who are going to private school.  The loan is for her daughter’s education.  One of her goals is that her daughter becomes a professional, that her business grows and that once the streets are fixed her sales increase.

loans.use: For her daughter's education.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
La Sra. Shirley pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Decididas II” del Distrito de Tarapoto,  Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 58 años y es madre 02 hijos, el mayor está en la universidad.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, por idea de una amiga y su esposo , inició su negoico de trabajos de Tapicería, el taller lo instaló en su propia casa y con la ayuda de su maquina de coser confecciona los pedidos.  Su espeoso la ayuda en este negocio.

A la fecha sigue realizndo esta actividad, siendo su principal clientela Empresas Estatales, hospitales y otros que realizan pedidos. 

Este préstamo de S/2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la ampliación de su negocio comprando tela en rollos, grapas en cajas e Hilos para coser los tapizados que van desde muebles, asientos de motos, motokars y juegos de sala y comedor, está orgullosa por su trabajo y día a día continua con su trabajo persiguiendo el sueño de hacer crecer el negocio con la instalación de un taller de soldadura, esto con la ayuda y apoyo de su esposo.

Se siente una mujer realizada  por lo que agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido para desarrollarse como mujer y empresaria.
texts.en:
Señora Shirley belongs to the communal bank "Las Decididas II" in the Tarapoto district in the department of San Martín.  She is 58 years old, married and the mother of 2 children.  Her oldest is in college.  

Based on a suggestion by a friend and her husband she borrowed S/.300.00 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] and started her own upholstery business.  She set up her shop in her house and with the help of her sewing machine and her husband she prepares her orders.  She is still working in this profession and her main customers are state firms, hospitals and others that request her services.  

She will use the current loan of S/2,000.00 nuevos soles to expand her business and to purchase rolls of fabric, boxes of staples and thread to cover furniture, motorcycle seats, motokars and living room and dining room furniture.  She takes pride in her work and everyday,with the help and support of her husband, she works pursuing the dream of growing her business by setting up a welding shop.  She is an accomplished woman and is grateful to the Manuela Rosa Movement for the opportunities they have given her to grow as a woman and a business owner.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of fabric, boxes of staples and thread.

loans.name: Heoung

texts.en: Heoung S., 23, lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia – an area known for Angkorean temples. S. is a massager, earning $8 US per day. Her husband is employed with a Korean company, earning $4 US per day. Each month, the family has to spend $40 US on food and $25 US on other expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Marlene Isabel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Marlene, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, dos de ellos mayores de edad y tres de  15, 14 y 7 años, uno de los mayores estudian en Universidad y los menores en colegio y escuela. El marido de dedica a la pesca.

Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual además de dedicarse a la pesca también se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, el trabaja todos los días de la semana, dos días sale de pesca y los otros se dedica a comprar el pescado a otros  pescadores. El entrega a comerciantes que venden en otros cantones, a veces el mismo transporta el pescado y lo lleva a entregar a Manta. Lleva 20 años dedicado al comercio  de pescado y a la pesca desde pequeño.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres años y le gusta porque en las reuniones se distrae.
 
Su sueño es tener un trabajo para ganar sus propios recursos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Nueva Generación community bank meet in Crucita parish, in Portoviejo canton, in a place called Los Arenales.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches, its rich cuisine and the warmth of its people.

Here we meet 44 year-old Marlene who lives with her partner and has five children.  Two of her children are grown up and the others are 15, 14 and 7.  One of her older children studies at university and the younger ones are in high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a fisherman.

Marlene is requesting a loan for her husband's business.  In addition to fishing, he also buys and sells fish.  He works every day of the week.  Two days a week he goes out fishing himself and on the other days he buys fish from other fishermen.  He delivers his products to salespeople who then sell them in other cantons.  Sometimes he transports the fish himself and delivers it to Manta.  He has been fishing, and buying and selling fish, for 20 years, since he was young.

This loan will be used to buy fish.  Marlene has been a member of her community bank for three years and she likes it because she enjoys herself at the meetings.

Marlene's dream is to work herself so that she can earn her own money.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Elva Gloria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY D. WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia D. Urubamba y  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elva; es casada; la socia tiene 71 años D. edad; la socia tiene 5 hijos, sus hijos ya son independientes y todos casados viven fuera D. su casa; la socia se dedica a la ganadería, ella tiene vacas lecheras, la socia venD. a las escuelas D. preferencia; ella es esposa del socio Augusto; la socia tiene este negocio desD. hace años pero vendiendo la leche a los colegios y al prona desD. hace 3 años, la socia desea comprar caballos, ella requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra D. caballos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. caballos.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho préstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Ollantay D. Wayracpuncu". This bank is located in the Urumbamba province and the department of Cusco.
The member is Elva. She is married and 71 years old. She has 5 children, and her children are already independent and all are married and live in their own homes. The member works in the livestock traD.. She has dairy cows and she sells her produce to the schools. She is married to Augusto, who is also a member of the bank. She has had this business for many years, but has been selling milk to the schools and to PRONA (a government program that provides milk to school children) for three years. The member wants to buy horses and she needs the money to be able to invest in buying them. She is requesting the money to buy horses.
The member is very grateful for the loan and promises to complete the repayments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de caballos.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 49 years old and is married with 2 children.

She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase of additional items for her business.

Nelly has previously borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF. She has been running the ready-to-wear business for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Nelly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her ready-to-wear clothes business

loans.name: Mpiriggwa Twezimbe Group

texts.en: Most successful businesses in Uganda are built out of unwavering diligence, persistence and a sheer determination to succeed. Many people see running a business as a means to an end in their quest to extricate themselves out of poverty.  34-year-old enterprising  Sarah is one such person. This happily married mother of 4 has been plying her charcoal sales business in Mityana for the past 2 years. She ekes out further profits from selling bananas. She also has a farm.  Before she ventured into this business she was engaged in a tailoring business.  She says her weekly sales profits are 30,000 shillings.  With this loan, Sarah says she is going to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to resell

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 50 años, está casada, con Ervin, de 55 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con uno de ellos: Lisbet, de 4 años, a la que educan y crían en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Hace tan solo dos años, que Norma sufrió la pérdida de su casa; producto de un Huaico (crecida del río, que contiene lodo y agua abundante), y gracias a la labor humanitaria de los miembros de su banco comunal, pudo salir adelante. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la venta de gaseosa y cerveza en un pequeño negocio que acondicionó en su casa, según cuenta, los días donde tiene mayores ingresos son los días sábados y domingos. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Norma; ya que gracias a su buena sazón en la cocina, los profesores de la única escuela de su localidad, la contratan para que les prepare los alimentos del día, pues la mayoría son de otra ciudad y viven en casas alquiladas. Por otro lado, cuando tiene tiempo libre trabaja a lado de su esposo, en la agricultura, sembrando y cosechando café una vez al año, para luego  venderlo a los acopiadores de la ciudad de La Merced.  A ella, le va muy bien en su negocio y en sus demás actividades paralelas, por ello más adelante está pensando ampliar su negocio no solo con bebidas, sino también abrir un restaurante, donde pueda vender comida que solo ella sabe preparar. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del Futuro” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera un pequeño préstamo de ustedes para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Norma, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de golosinas, cerveza para surtir su tienda de comestibles; asimismo en la compra de mesas y sillas para la pensión que ofrece.
texts.en:
Norma, 50, is married to Ervin, who is 55.  They have 3 children, but live only with one of them: Lisbet, 4, who they are educating and raising in their own home in the town of Puente Paucartambo (in the central Peruvian jungle.)  Two years ago Norma lost her house to a flood (resulting from an overflow of water and mud from an adjacent river.)  Thanks to the humanitarian work of members of her communal bank, she was able to get through this.  She has a business selling soft drinks and beer in a small store that she set up in her house.  According to Norma, the days when her earnings are highest are Saturdays and Sundays.  But this is not Norma's only business.  Since she is a good cook, the teachers at the only school in her town hired her to prepare food for them on a daily basis, because most of them live in rented homes in another town.  Also, when Norma has free time she works with her husband on the farm, planting and harvesting coffee at one point in the year, to later sell to the wholesalers in the city of La Merced.  

Norma's businesses and other activities are going very well, so in the future she is planning to convert her business selling drinks into a restaurant where she could sell the food that she knows how to prepare.  Norma belongs to the communal bank "Luz del Futuro" and this is her 9th loan with MFP; she expects that this small loan from you will help her to achieve these goals.  She promises again to make her payments as scheduled, as she did with her previous loans.  In addition, she is grateful to be a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and cooperative people.  Norma will invest the proceeds of this loan in the purchase of candy and beer to stock her food store, and she will also be buying tables and chairs for her meal service business.

loans.use: to buy sweets and beer for her store, and also to buy tables and chairs for her catering business

loans.name: 2.6.51Thieu Nguyen.thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong works in agriculture farming food. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Phuong is 22 years old and she is married and has 1 child.

Phuong is the group leader of the 51 Thieu N. solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

In 2008, Phuong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phuong has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phuong has been involved in this business for 3 years. The main hardship that Phuong faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phuong hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle-feet.

loans.name: Carmen Consuelo

texts.es: Carmen Consuelo de 50 años de edad, reside en casa propia con su hija Rocío de 21 años, la cual posee un pequeño empleo para colaborar con los gastos de su hogar. Carmen ha hecho de su casa un negocio ya que desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como: desodorantes, variedad de cremas, maquillaje, champo, etc. Este negocio es el que le ha permitido sobrevivir durante muchos años  ya que ha sido su principal fuente  de ingresos. Es por esta razón que desea mantenerlo activo por muchos años más y seguir recibiendo los frutos del mismo. Ella es una mujer arriesgada y sobre todo responsable se pone muchas metas y una de ellas es ampliar su negocio ya que su sueño es verlo florecer y poder obtener mayores ganancias para aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en el mismo y poder comprar variedad de productos de belleza como: cremas para el cabello, cremas para el cuerpo y para manos, champo, lociones, cosméticos, desodorantes, etc. Y poder así mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen Consuelo is 50 years old and lives in her own home together with her 21 year-old daughter Rocío who has a small job in order to contribute towards covering their household expenses.

Carmen has turned her house into a business.  For several years she has been selling beauty products such as deodorants, a range of creams, makeup, shampoo, etc.  This business has enabled her to survive for many years since it has been her main source of income.  For this reason, she would like to keep it running for many more years and continue reaping rewards from it.

Carmen is a brave and responsible woman who has many goals.  One of her goals is to expand her business since her dream is to see it flourish and to make more profits from it so that she can aspire to a better quality of life.  This motivated her to request a loan from Integral so that she could invest in her business and buy a variety of beauty products such as hair creams, body creams, hand creams, shampoo, lotions, cosmetics, deodorants, etc.  This will enable her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beauty products such as hair creams, body creams, hand creams, shampoo, lotions, cosmetics, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Terfel

texts.en:
Terfel is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. Terfel has a retail shop that sells beverages, canned goods and snacks. He has had this business for one year. 

He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods and beverages. Terfel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en: Batbold is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His older daughter is a student and his younger two attend secondary school. He manages a Mongolian traditional clothing and shoe making business with the help of his wife. He was born in Zavhan province in 1972. Since childhood, he learned to make clothes and shoes, as it was his family's business. Now he is one of the experienced and skillful tailors in his town. He started his own business in 2000 after his movement to Murun sum. He produces a variety of clothes and shoes for all ages. Moreover, he has been honored as the best shoemaker of 2010. His customers respect him well. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says, "I want to increase my working capital and make my products as brand product in my province."  He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make clothes and shoes

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim is a married man with one child who attends school. He owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, he has operated a grocery business, selling by retail to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KES 15,000 loan, he wants to purchase a sack of onions, tomatoes and green vegetables. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of onions, tomatoes and green vegetables.

loans.name: Narandelger

texts.en: Narandelger is 41 years old and lives with her three children and husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver. He transports goods in the countryside. Her oldest son used to study at the Mongolian Agriculture University but left because he disliked the major study subject. This year, he is a college freshman at the Darhan Mining University. He says he is interested in the mining industry. Narandelger started to rent commercial space at Baldanzasag market and sell clothes in 2002. Her total assets are about 3,000,000 MNT. She gained much business experience in her field having worked as a salesperson for a decade. She has taken loans from Xac Bank 9 times previously. Her middle daughter assists her in the business while Narandelger goes to China to buy products. She is a diligent woman who says "I want to provide a good education for my son because his future depends on education." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to pay the tuition fees of her son and to buy more clothes from China for the new school year.

loans.use: To pay for her son's tuition fees and to buy more clothes

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is married with 5 grown children. She is 56 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

Wilma is planting coconut trees and bananas for sale. She has traded the said crops for over 20 years and made favorable returns. Her spouse works as a carpenter but his work is impermanent in nature.

At the end of every month, Wilma earns an approximate total of 5,680 PHP considering all these sources. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers to enhance the growth of crops and for a high potential of return on investment.

Wilma is a GDMPC member, joining this year. This is her first loan transaction made in the cooperative. In the future, Wilma hopes to expand the cultivated area and raise more of these plants to gain more. She also plans to repair some portions of her house to live comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Juanito

texts.es: El Sr. Juanito esta casado con la señora  Martha tiene dos hijos que están en la universidad estudiando juntos, la familia  viven en la ciudad de La Paz, el sr. Juanito se dedica a la venta de   distintos artículos  como ser cables, enchufes, DVD, cargadores de celular, etc.  y  el préstamo  lo invertirá en la compra de una computadora para sus hijos que lo necesitan  para realizar sus trabajos  de investigación de la universidad, El cliente se siente muy feliz por ser beneficiado por el crédito Kiva ya que le será de mucha utilidad para el y para sus hijos ya que esto ayudara a la educación de sus hijos, el deseo del Sr. Juanito es el de poder ver a sus hijos profesionales .
texts.en:
Juanito is married to Martha and has two children who are studying in the university together.  The family lives in the city of La Paz.  Juanito sells various items such as cables, plugs, DVDs, cell chargers, etc.

Juanito will invest the loan in a computer for his children, who need it to do their research papers for school.  He is very happy to benefit from the Kiva loan, which will be very useful for him and his children, since it will help his children's education.

Juanito's desire is to be able to see his children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Analin

texts.en: Analin is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Analin has operated a retail shop for 10 years, selling canned goods, snacks and coconut wine per liter. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and coconut wine to sell. Analin is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Analin hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and coconut wine

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo, 52 years old, is married. They were blessed with three children. Alfredo has been engaged in growing corn for almost 40 years. Last growing season, his net income was 40,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). 

He's asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. Future loans from Kiva would be invaluable to him as he sees the loans as the only opportunity for progression of his business and financial security.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman is a 27-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is the mother of three children. Due to culturA. issues, the man in the picture is Eman's husband. Eman is sewing clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 499 Jordanian dinars to purchase a new sewing machine. Eman is looking to purchasing her own car and to expanding her business by purchasing more sewing machines.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Juan Tomas

texts.es:
Juan de 27 años, comenzó el negocio de ventas de productos naturales, ya que su hija estaba enferma y estos productos se hicieron bien para su recuperación.

Realizo este trabajo con la ayuda de su esposo todos los días sin horarios fijos. Gracias a Dios no ha tenido ningún problema de salud ni de delincuencia. 

Está casado y tiene una hermosa niña de 2 años de edad. Con el prestamo quiere comprar productos naturales como vitaminas, dirigidos para el sistema digestivo, problemas del corazon etc. Su meta a alcanzar es poder tener un lugar  fijo para poder trabajar sin dificultades.
texts.en:
Juan, 27, started a business selling natural products because his daughter was ill and these products worked well for her recuperation.  He carries out the work with help from his wife every day with no fixed work schedule.  Thanks to God he’s had neither health problems nor problems with crime.

He is married and has a beautiful, 2-year-old daughter.  He wants to use the loan to buy natural products like vitamins that are designed for the digestive system, for heart problems, etc.  His goal is to manage to have a fixed locale to work in problem-free.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and natural medicinal products.

loans.name: Sapah Group

texts.en:
Mabinty is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Freetown in 1976. Mabinty is married to a security officer and the couple has seven children – five in secondary school and two in primary school. 

For 10 years now, Mabinty has been selling rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), cabbages, etc. This is the first loan that Mabinty and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mabinty will use her share of the loan (700,000 SLL) to expand her business, she will buy three 50kg bags of rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy three 50kg bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Fe Y Alegria Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Dora tiene 40 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; tiene 6 años con Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos el cual tiene 5 años en este negocio y que comenzó a raíz D. la recomendación D. una D. sus amigas con el objetivo D. poder obtener ingresos y así construir su casa.

También se dedica a la preparación D. comida para un colegio con el cual lleva 5 años, hasta ahora ha logrado construir su vivienda, piensa usar el reciente préstamo en la remodelación D. su hogar; actualmente Dora es la que cubre los gastos D. alimentación y educación D. sus hijos mientras que su esposo cubre los gastos D. agua y luz. Ella pertenece al grupo “Fe y Alegría” en el cual lleva 4 años y que esta conformado por 6 personas, actualmente Dora lleva un año como presidenta del grupo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dora is 40 years old and lives with her common-law husband and three children. She has been with Edaprospo for 6 years and has worked selling cosmetics for 5 years. She began this business based upon the recommendation of one of her friends. Her goal in starting was to earn an income and be able to build her house.

She also has worked for 5 years preparing food at a high school. She has been able to build her home, and plans to use this loan to remodel her home. Currently, Dora is providing for the expense of feeding and educating her children while her husband pays for the electrical and light bills. She has belonged to the Fe y Alegría (Faith and Happiness) Group for 4 years. This group is comprised of 6 people. Dora has been the president of the group for a year.

loans.use: remodel her home

loans.name: Sivorn

texts.en:
Sivorn, age 31, is a widow with two children -- one son and one daughter. One is in school and another one is still young. She also has one niece and one nephew who are living with her. They live in a suburb about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sivorn is a garment worker. Additionally, she is also a rice farmer. 

Sivorn is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500 in order to purchase a motorcycle for her niece, who is a garment worker, so she can drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her niece, who is a garment worker, so she can drive to work.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old, married and has three children. To earn a living, Joseph does a motorbike transport business. He has been in the business for three years. He also does farming to earn extra income. Previously, he owned a kiosk.

Through Faulu Kenya, Joseph has been able to buy a motorbike for his business. He hopes to go into a taxi business in the future. Joseph has requested a loan for 10,900 Kenya shillings to buy a solar lamp.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Enhtuul

texts.en: Enhtuul is 37-years-old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is a gold smith and her daughter is a kindergarten student. Enhtuul operates a shoes making business. She started her buriad (Mongolian boots) shoe business in 2004 by selling in the market. She now makes the buriad shoes for children at home. Over the years she became a trusted supplier of many retailers. Now that it's holiday season, her product demand is increasing therefore, she's requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy materials.

loans.use: To buy materials to make Buriad (Mongolian) boots.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 46 years old, married to Dominic, and they are blessed with three children. She has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes 25,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan of Kes 47,748 with KADET Ltd after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Lucy will use the loan to buy a piece of land. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to build rental houses which will increase her income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Danaya 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Danaya 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 6 enfants et vivant dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies  à  Pourè, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil avec AMINATA, debout au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group Danaya 3 are married women who average 43 years of age and six children each. They live in extended traditional families in Pourè, a village in San, the fourth administrative region of Mali. 

This is their second collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. The previous loan was correctly repaid.

Aminata sells millet. She is the one standing in the center of the photo. She will use her loan to purchase inputs, seeds and small farming tools, and to pay for the cost of plowing one hectare of land. After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village and at the market of San to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to earn an average profit of 150,000 CFAF per season. This will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with the household expenses.
