loans.use: to purchase inputs, seeds and small farming tools, and to pay for the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Ave-Maria Group

texts.fr: AVE-MARIA est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Charlotte (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 36 ans. Charlotte est mariée à un certain Charles. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et un à leur charge. Charlotte vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Charlotte et son mari. Pour cette raison, Charlotte vend des produits cosmétiques par la technique de distribution depuis huit ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Charlotte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Charlotte sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe AVE-MARIA, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Hiam

texts.en:
Hiam is 57 years old; she is married and a mother of two sons who attend schools. She lives in Beit-Liqia village near Ramallah city.
For 10 years, Hiam has run a small bakery store near her house. The store was open from 7:00am until 10:00 pm.
Hiam needs a loan to increase her standard of living by purchasing more products that can attract more consumers and then achieve more earnings.

loans.use: To buy staple goods such as oil, flour, sugar, dairy products and sweets.

loans.name: Elana

texts.en:
No one likes cold feet, in Balti there is a simple solution, visit Elana Frcaution’s clothing stand outside the central market. She greets customers with a warm smile and asks them what they need; a warm pair of socks, long-underwear or a thermal shirt, gloves, hats?  Last year was an extremely cold winter in Moldova reaching as low as -30 degrees Celsius and Elena saw higher sales than expected. Elana would like to be prepared for this winter.  Most people don’t like the cold, but when its cold outside it means money for Elana.

In order to save money Elana purchases her clothing in bulk twice a year, once for winter and again for summer from the Ukraine.  Within the last year it has been more difficult to buy cloths from Ukraine due to the importers having to travel further distances around an area of Moldova called Transnistria.  Transnistria is a breakaway state from Moldova, it was unofficially formed after a civil war within Moldova in 1992 after the Soviet Union collapsed. This area is not recognized by the United Nations or the United States and last year, Ukraine and Moldova’s Governments induced a blockade on this region requiring heavy restrictions for goods leaving this area. Elana would like a loan to make a larger purchase this year to have a larger inventory for this reason and to meet demand and help keep her customers warm!

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Musuai

texts.en: “Flower means happy,” that’s why a mother from Letogo named Musuai decided to have a Flowering Garden business. Her husband died six years ago, and he was the only financial provider of the family. After his death, Musuai thought very hard about how she was going to take care of her family, especially her children attending school. She joined the SPBD Programme in 2005, and used her last loan of $1550.00 to buy more accessories for the business and to purchase materials for her home improvement. Musuai is now gladly counting her blessings for how the program has helped her in her time of need.

loans.use: To buy flower roots.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mr. Ly is 44 years old and his wife is one year younger. Both Ly and his wife are farmers. They have 4 daughters between 14 and 21. Three daughters are workers at the factory; the other daughter is a student at high school. They have 2000 square meters of land for growing rice. Additionally, they also raise pigs. Their income is $12 per person/month. They hope to receive a loan of $75 to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for their field. They are going to repay monthly.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for the field.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.en:
Sebastiana O. P. makes and sells tortillas from her home. She has been making tortillas for four years; before that she used to weave handicraft items. She will use the proceeds of her loan to buy 300 pounds of corn which she requires every week, the firewood to fire the stove, and plastic bags in which to sell the tortillas. She’s a member of the group of women called “Caterina".

As a single 52-year-old woman, she has learned to be resourceful in her life. In 2005, the rains from Hurricane Stan caused her house and everything else she owned to be washed away. Her house slid down the mountainside along with everything she owned except for two of the traditional indigenous huipiles, or local blouses. She decided to sell the shirt off her back in order to start over, and sold one of her two huipiles. Since then she has built a new house, which shares a patio with her son’s house. As she tells the story of her experience with the hurricane, tears come to her eyes. She says that her health is good, but that since the hurricane she is more nervous and afraid, and that life has not been the same. Although she’s recuperated somewhat from the hurricane, she still doesn’t have much in the way of clothes, and often wears a t-shirt around the home, although she puts on her huipil to go to the market or into the village.

She has 7 children. Two of her children and her sister help her with her growing business.

Like so many indigenous people, Sebastiana is enormously resourceful. She is a local midwife, delivering babies in her village. Some of the parents can pay and some cannot. Those who can, will pay up to 150 quetzals or about US$20 for her services. In her medical bag are lubricant, prenatal vitamins, metal pans, and a few bandages. Currently, she is in need of gloves to wear during the delivery. When asked where she learned the art of midwifery, she replied in Cakchiquel, that although she has never gone to school and never learned to read or write, she has just always known how to do this.

loans.use: She will use the proceeds of her loan to buy the 300 pounds of corn she requires every week, the firewood to fire the stove, and plastic bags to sell the tortillas in.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde learned the craft of weaving as a small girl. With the help of her family she mounted a small workshop in her home where she makes sweaters, ponchos, and caps. She and her husband sell the work on Sundays and Mondays at a small stand at the Laguna Temporal market in Juliaca and with the income provide for their two small children ages 8 and 12. The children even lend a hand with the family business on top of attending school every day. The family is proud to report that five other people are employed in the shop, this in a country facing problems of unemployment. The hours are long and the work sometimes tedious but the workers are upbeat and grateful for the opportunity to provide for their families. Matilde's dream is to raise the quality of her work such that she can export her garments and make the shop a prominent employer in her city. She is asking for a loan of $650 and promises to repay the sum within 6 months. Matilde and her family are counting on your generosity to help this dream become a reality.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Matilde, gracias al oficio que aprendió desde muy niña y con ayuda de su familia; construyó en el interior de su vivienda una pequeña fábrica de artesanía dónde confecciona chompas, ponchos, chalinas y gorras; con el ingreso que obtiene por la venta de estos productos, que los ofrece en compañía de su esposo los días domingos y lunes en un pequeño puesto del mercado “Laguna Temporal”de Juliaca; mantiene su hogar y cubre las necesidades de sus dos pequeños niños de 8 y 12 años quienes también ayudan con el trabajo diario de sus padres además de asistir diariamente a la escuela. A través de esta actividad también les otorga trabajo a 5 personas y de esta manera contribuye a disminuir la tasa de desempleo en nuestro país. Hay días que el trabajo es arduo y cansado pero su espíritu optimista y deseos de progreso la impulsan a luchar día a día por el bienestar de los suyos. El anhelo de Matilde es mejorar la calidad de sus productos para poder exportarlos a otros países y convertirse en un foco de empleo dentro de su ciudad. Debido a ello solicita un préstamo de 650 dólares que se compromete a pagarlos en 6 meses. Por esta razón recurre a sus corazones generosos a fin de reunir la cantidad solicitada y poner en marcha su sueño

loans.use: To expand a home weaving shop employing 5 people.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: My name is Nasreen J., and I am married and have five children. My husband trades used clothes. He buys these clothes from a used clothes wholesale market and sells them at various shops in the city. We find it very hard to make ends meet. We need to increase our income by investing in our current business. My husband will buy in bulk and therefore sell more, which will eventually lead to higher profits. Please lend us US$500.

loans.use: Buy used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Jamilah

texts.en: Jamilah S. is married to a Tanker driver. She has three children ages 18, 10 and 8. Jamilah is supporting with the family finances by owning a mini super market. She also does distribution as people come and buy from her and also sell to other customers. She also sells shoes and cosmetics.  Jamilah is not able to buy the provisions in large quantities because of she does not have enough working capital.  She is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to buy more provisions, bags, shoes and clothing for her store.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more provisions, bags, shoes and clothing for her store.

loans.name: Jeni

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Jeni K. from Mbeya, Tanzania. She is married with three children, aged 2,7, and 10. In 2006 Jeni established a grocery store, and now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Nurjanah

texts.en: Nurjanah, 32, has four children and is married to A., who is unemployed. To support the family, she sells coconut rice, cooked meals, noodles, fried snacks, and other dishes from her food stall. She earns $20 a day. She is asking for a loan of $100 to expand her business. As a member of MBK, she has agreed to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her food stand

loans.name: Hach

texts.en: Mrs. Hach S., 25, is married with one child. She works selling a variety of groceries in the market and earns about $2 a day of profit. Her husband works as a construction worker building houses and normally earns around $5 a day. She plans to use this loan to purchase more grocery products to sell in large quantity. This will increase her family’s income and allow her to save for the future.

loans.use: She plans to use this loan to purchase more grocery products to sell in large quantity.

loans.name: Marcelina's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Marcelina is 33 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 9 and 11 years old. Marcelina is a fish seller, and she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $275 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in used clothes sales and soft drink sales.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela Josefina F. (36) is the single mother of a thirteen-year-old daughter. Both live together and Angela is very concerned with the education of her daughter. She sends her to school and is very strict with academic performance.

Six years ago Angela decided open a restaurant near one of the most important ports in the country, ”port Feniz”. She says: “ I am very proud of my achievements during these six years”.

When the port’s construction began, Angela used to cook and then bring the dishes from her house to the construction site to her relatives who were working there. There, the demand for her food increased and everyone working there became Angela’s customers. When the construction finished, one of the owners of the port offered Angela a restaurant where she could cook and sell her food for employers and drivers of the zone. Angela was more than happy and she accepted the proposal.

Angela says: “ I know I am a very lucky person. I am extremely grateful. Thanks to this income I generate here, I can give my daughter a good level of education. In addition, I can help my mother.”

The money provided by the loan will be invested in the purchase of chicken, meat, flour, oil, pasta, rice and drinks.

loans.use: Purchase of chicken, meat, flour, oil, pasta, rice and drinks

loans.name: Sophoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoeun C., 37, and her husband, Mr. Chhorn Phan, 40, who live about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. All of their children are in school. 

Mrs. Sophoeun has been selling corn and sweet potatoes for three years, buying them from the market to sell in the village.  Mr. Chhorn has been a motor remoque (a motorbike with a trailer at the back) taxi driver for five years, carrying garment factory workers from his village to Phnom Penh and back. Now his trailer is broken and Mrs. Sophoeum  is requesting a loan of $250 to repair it so her husband can continue operating the taxi.

loans.use: To repair the motor trailer used in running the motor taxi.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou G. is a married woman and mother of three. She has been selling things for almost 8 years, and her clientele is made up of women from her neighborhood. Her business consists of buying fabric that she sews in order to resell them in the local market, with a portion of it sold in Mali. When she goes to Mali, she is also able to stock up on “thioup” fabric and other different products with the goal of diversifying her business and increasing her income.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

fatou G. est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants .elle fait du commerce depuis presque 8 ans et sa clientèle est composée des femmes de son quartier.son activité consiste à acheter des tissus qu'elle fait coudre pour les revendre sur le marché local et une partie est vendue au mali .en plus si elle se rend au mali elle en profite pour s'approvisionner en tissus "thioup" et produits divers dans le but de diversifier ses activités et améliorer ses revenus.

loans.use: the purchase of fabrics with which to make women's clothes

loans.name: Nyiramuhanda

texts.en: Greetings from G. in Rwanda! G. is a 44-year-old businesswoman, married with seven children and three orphans adopted after the 1994 Genocide. In 2004, G. joined a credit association to access micro loan to start her business of selling drinks and beverages as a whole seller. She is renting a store where she sells beverages in large quantities to retailers in the area and far in the rural areas. She earns about $145 every month. She is applying for a loan worth 613,575 Frws to increase her stock.

loans.use: Gorette would like to increase the stock of her small beverage store.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba R. 47 years old. She is married and uses all the money she makes to care for her four children and provide for their education. Mahbuba has an experience of 13 years preparing and selling dried apricots. Mahbuba always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her.

Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Mahbuba has been an active and strongly motivated client of IMON since 2005. Her credit history makes her eligible to receive new and larger loans. Today Mahbuba is requesting 1200 USD for a term of 3 months. She is going to spend the loan purchasing dried apricots with the purpose of processing them in order increase the range of her merchandise. With your help this will be possible. Mahbuba expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing dried apricots for processing and re-sale

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia A. sells baby items like baby creams, clothes, powder, etc. Cicilia is 35 years old, married with 4 children, and lives in Issashi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs a loan to buy more baby items to sell. She expresses her profound gratitude to LAPO MICROFINANCE and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more baby items like baby cream and powder to sell

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma has had a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 6 years. She has taken out 1 prior loan from BRAC Tanzania, which she paid successfully and on time. It helped her increase her profit to approximately $85 each month. She is hoping that this second loan further increases her profit.

Mwajuma is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 3 and 7. She also cares for an additional 13-year-old dependent.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos J. Rodríguez de 42 años, siendo su estado civil casado, con 4 hijos el mayor con 18 años cursa el 1 año de ingeniería en sistema, la segunda es una mujer con 16 años de edad que actualmente cursa el 4 año de electricidad, el tercero un niño de 11 años cursa el 6 grado de primaria y el ultimo de sus hijos tiene la edad de 5 años que cursa el 5 grado de primaria, su esposa no labora posee un negocio el cual administrado por ella misma, el propósito de Carlos es salir adelante con su negocio y brindarles a cada uno de sus hijos la oportunidad de llegar a ser unos grandes profesionales y poder ser buenas  personas  ante la sociedad.


La actividad económica a la cual se dedica actualmente es a la venta de pollo que esta ubicada en el mercado central, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 5 años, el inicia este negocio con un frezeer lo cual empezó en el mercado central   pero tuvieron que trasladarse en su casa de habitación por motivos de que el impuesto en el mercado central era demasiado alto y no podían costearlo es por eso que su negocio es trasladado a su vivienda, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que el necesita realizar la compra de sus productos para ofertar a sus clientes una mejor calidad de venta ya en su mayoría lo que mas vende es la pechuga del pollo.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos J. Rodríguez is a 42-year-old married father of 4 children. The eldest is an 18-year-old who is in his first year of computer systems engineering. The second one, a 16-year-old female, is currently in her fourth year of electrical studies. The third one, an 11-year-old son, is in the 6th grade, while the youngest, a 5-year-old, is in first grade. His wife does not work because she has a business that she manages for herself. Carlos’ goal is to get ahead in his business and give each of his children the opportunity to be great professionals and good people in society.

Carlos sells chicken for a living. He has had this business for 5 years, starting out with a freezer in the central market, but they had to relocate the business to their home because they could no longer afford the high taxes charged in the market. He is requesting this loan as work capital; he needs to purchase products to offer in order to offer to his customers a higher quality of chicken. What he sells most are chicken breasts.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Bulaga B- Evelyne Group

texts.en:
33-year-old Sarah N. is married with 3 school-going children between the ages of 6 and 13. When she acquired dressmaking skills from her husband two years ago, she opened a unisex boutique in Bulaga. She makes both ladies and gents clothes from local fabrics, like bitenge, tie-dye, and batik. 

She is using the loan to expand her business by purchasing both new and second-hand ready-made clothes to meet the needs of customers from all consumer segments. 

Sarah earns an average profit of UGX 50,000 each week, from which she pays monthly rent of UGX 60,000. She is a very hard-working and committed woman who aspires to venture into the importation of fine clothes from overseas markets like Dubai, U.K, and the U.S.A. Her goal is to see her children go through the best schools and attain quality education at all levels.

loans.use: To purchasing new and second-hand ready-made clothes

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Quế, 46 tuổi, ở Thanh Hoá. Hiện gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã lớn, trong đó có 2 con đã lập gia đình. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2007, với số vốn vay đượcgia đình hcị đã đầu tư để chăn nuôi lợn. Hiện tại ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương làm thợ xây của chồng với thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới, chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000 để mua thêm lợn gà và mở rộng quy mô chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Quế, 46 years old, lives in Thanh Hoá province. She has three grown children, two of whom are married. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2007, using her loans to invest in raising pigs. Currently, the income her family earns from raising pigs is supplemented with wages her husband earns as a construction worker, making a total of about 2,500,000 VND (146 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 6,000,000 VND (350 USD) to buy pigs and chickens and expand the size of her operation raising animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs and chickens

loans.name: Rehema H.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania. This is 30-year-old Rehema K. from Mbeya. She is married with 2 children, 3 and 12. Rehema has been running a business selling potatoes since 2004. She buys potatoes from the farmers and sells them in town.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Rehema currently earns about 96 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 250 USD in order to purchase 50 bags of potatoes in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase her capital by increasing the number from 50 bags to 100. Rehema thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase 50 bags of potatoes in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Buena Vista esta integrado por tres miembros, todos vecinos de esta cominidad, ellos se conocen muy bien. las actividades que realizan ellos son las siguientes:
La Sra. Vicenta I. tiene 60 años de edad y tiene a su cargo 3 hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela de la comunidad, ella sostiene a su familia y su hogar de la venta de leche que realiza desde hace varios años, 3 para ser exactos.
El Sr. R. tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos y se dedica a la venta de leña, la cual realiza desde hace 8 años, el vive con sus padres, es muy trabajador y les ayuda con los gastos.
EL joven Carlos N. es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres, a los cuales les apoya economicamente con su negocio de venta de agua y leña, esta actividad tiene 13 años de hacerla y le va muy bien, el es muy humilde y quiere ampliar su negocio con el prestamos que esta solicitando.
texts.en:
The Buena Vista group is made up of three members, all of them neighbors in this community and they know each other very well. The activities that they carry out are the following: Mrs. Vicenta I. is 60 years old and is responsible for three children who study in the school in the community. She supports her family and her home through the sale of milk, which she has done for various years, 3 to be exact. Mr. R. is 25 years old, is single, does not have any children and works selling firewood, which he has done for the past 8 years. He lives with his parents, is very hard working and he helps them with their expenses. . The young man Carlos N. is single, has no children and lives with his parents, who he supports economically with his business selling water and firewood. He has done this activity for 13 years and it is going well for him. He is very humble and wants to expand his business with the loan that he is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of milk, firewood and water

loans.name: Séraphine

texts.fr:
A. Séraphine est née dans les années 1972 et est mères de sept enfants tous scolarisés. A. Séraphine est mariée à AÏHA Raymond. A. Séraphine vend les divers(les produits concentrés, les pâtes alimentaires, les détergents, le sucre)ainsi que les produits vivriers tels que le maïs, le haricot,le mil. A. Séraphine vend dans l’un des marchés locaux de Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. A. Séraphine s’approvisionne en divers à Tokpa, marché international du Bénin. Mais en ce qui concerne les produits vivriers, A. Séraphine s’approvisionne à glazoué-le grand marché des produits céréaliers. A. Séraphine a déjà eu deux crédits à ALIDé. Pour mieux développer son activité A. Séraphine sollicite un troisième prêt.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Séraphine A. was born in 1972 and is the mother of seven, all of whom are in school. Séraphine A. is married to Raymond Aïha. Séraphine A. sells sundries (concentrated products, pastas, detergents, sugar), as well as food-producing products like corn, beans, and millet. Séraphine A. sells in one of the local markets in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Séraphine A. stocks up on sundries in Tokpa, the international market in Benin. But when it comes to the food-producing products, Séraphine A. stocks up at Glazoué, the large grains market. Séraphine A. has already had two loans at Alidé. To increase her business, Séraphine A. seeks a third loan. The signification of Alidé in the local language of Benin, the Fon, is that: “There is always a way for the poorest.” Benin is a country in West Africa next to Nigeria where the GDP per inhabitant is $1,500. Alidé offers special loans at 0% interest to those who are vulnerable. She is also part of a group who will soon launch a micro-health insurance program for those receiving microcredit loans.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, detergent, sugar, soap and grains: rice, corn, millet, sorghum, bean, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is s 50 year old man who lives with his wife in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Mohammad has been selling thread and tablecloths for thirty-two years. He has requested a loan of 1,200 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Mohammad has requested a loan.

Mohammad is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When, he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Mohammad chose his business because of his experience in sales and he wanted to improve his family’s financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Jeane

texts.en: Mrs. Jeane O. is hardworking and determined.  She is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental, and is 36 years old.  She is married and blessed with three children, two of which are in secondary school and one is in elementary school.  Her husband is a farmer. In order to cope with the abject poverty that is inevitable to the family, she started selling snacks to neighbors, relatives, and friends. Because she did not have enough capital to start a sari-sari store, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative last April to access loan credit for additional capital to be used in the construction of a small stall. Her and her husband’s heart and desire is to send their children to college and witness them successful in their lives in the future.

loans.use: additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos.
Pedro es conviviente, tiene 55 años y 3 hijos, Pedro junto a su esposa tienen una panadería llamada Sótano que esta ubicado en un local alquilado, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de 1 personal, sus ventas los realizan en la tienda y también lo reparten a las tiendas.
Pedro necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Los sueños de Pedro son ampliar su negocio e implementar con todas las maquinas su panadería.
texts.en:
Pedro is a member of the community bank “Empecemos” (“We begin”). Pedro lives with his partner. He is 55 years old and has 3 children. Pedro and his wife have a bakery called Sótano (Basement) which is located in a rented spot. For this he has the help of 1 employee. Sales are done in his shop and also in other stores. Pedro needs a loan of 800 soles, money that he would invest in the purchase of flour. Pedro’s dreams are to grow his business and implement machines for use in his bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Kojo

texts.en:
Kojo J. makes a living selling beer, and has applied for this loan to buy more beer in bulk to sell to her customers.  She is 30 years old and married. Her husband is employed as a driver and they have three children, all of whom are in school. With the additional income made possible by this loan, she hopes to open a bar. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ronald's Group

texts.en: N. Ronald is the leader of his lending group in Kisoga. He has been a businessman, selling produce, for over 10 years. He is a farmer and also buys other produce (like beans, cabbages, onions and tomatoes) to supplement the vegetable stock from his farm. As a result of making some profits, Ronald has been able to buy 2 cows and a bicycle. This helps to transport the produce from the villages, for sale. His market area is mainly in Kayunga, Jinja and Lugazi and he is happy about the trend since he is able to supply his customers. Ronald needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for sale.

loans.use: To buying more produce for sale.

loans.name: Ciumwari

texts.en: Ciumwari B. is a 39-year-old married mother of five children. She lives with her family in Runyenjes. She is a dedicated entrepreneur who runs a cereal store in Runyenjes.She started this business in 2000 with her own small savings. She sells grains, such as maize and beans, to retail customers and, at times, she supplies schools. Ciumwari is applying for a loan for the first time/ She has requested her loan in order to help her purchase additional supplies to improve her current level of stock.

loans.use: Purchase stock of grains

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack runs a firm by the name of Smartline Creations. The firm dealt with designing and printing communication materials. Last year, he lost his entire business as result of a tragic fire in the neighborhood. He has now changed focus and opened a décor and managing events business. He is married and has 2 children.

Shadrack's major challenge is lack of flower stands and enough fabric. He now wants a loan of Kshs. 50,000 to enable him to buy fabric and flower stands.

loans.use: Buy fabric and flower stands

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 55 años, es una mujer luchadora que vive con sus 2 hijos en la casa de un familiar. Hace más de 3 años decidió asociarse con una de sus hijas para emprender un negocio de venta de comida en una avenida céntrica y comercial de su localidad. Ambas se encargan de la preparación de los platos y de la atención a los comensales. Para ello, se esmeran mucho en cocinar variados guisos a gusto de sus clientes, así como de utilizar ingredientes de muy buena calidad. Gracias a este negocio, Susana ha podido incrementar sus ingresos económicos, por lo que está muy animada de continuar con su pequeño restaurante, mejorando cada día más la calidad y variedad de sus comidas. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está dispuesta a seguir realizando un trabajo solidario en su banco comunal, aportando para el bienestar común. El dinero que viene solicitando estará destinado a la compra de productos alimenticios de primera necesidad, al por mayor, para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Susana is a fighter. She is 55 years old and lives with her 2 children in a relative’s house. For more than 3 years, she has been working with one of her daughters in their business of selling food on one of the central avenues and from a commercial eatery. They are both in charge of preparing the meals and attending to their customers. Thanks to her business, Susana has been able to increase her income and is encouraged to continue improving the quality and variety of her meals.

This is the second time she has requested a loan from MFP. She is prepared to continue working with her communal bank and supporting her fellow members for the wellbeing of the entire group. Susana will use her loan to purchase ingredients wholesale for the preparation of her meals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam J., 40 years old and married to an accountant. has four children, all attending school. Currently in the business of selling onions and cooking oil, she is requesting a loan to purchase tomatoes and Irish patatoes to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Salam hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes and Irish patatoes to sell

loans.name: Ojos Del Cielo Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “Ojos D. Cielo” esta conformado por 15 socios y representado por  la señora Ruth, todas las socias van cursando su cuarto ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican al comercio D. productos como la señora Ruth que se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en su tienda y también algunos productos mas, el resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. ropa, cosméticos, chamarras D. cuero, café, camas, mochilas medias y a la confección D. prendas D. vestir. La competencia dentro D. su rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya cuentan con experiencia ya que van cursando su cuarto ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. sacar adelante sus negocios, agradecen el apoyo económico que les brinda la institución porque gracias a su confianza su familia gozara D. una mejor calidad D. vida y D. una mejor educación.
texts.en:
The “Ojos D. Cielo” Community Bank, represented by Ruth, has 15 members, all in their fourth cycle having proved themselves to be responsible and punctual re-payers. Most of the members are in the retail traD., including Ruth herself, who has a grocery store also selling some other items. The remaining members sell clothing, cosmetics, leather jackets, coffee, beds, rucksacks and socks, or make clothing. Despite the high level of competition in their respective fields, they have each successfully developed their enterprises. The loan will be used to expand their businesses, buying goods, supplies and equipment to increase their revenue, allowing them to offer their families a higher standard of living. In terms of the members' credit history, they enjoy the experience of fourth-cycle borrowers, having demonstrated their responsibility, honesty and desire to develop their businesses. They are thankful for the financial support provided by the institution, which offers them the trust they need to proviD. their families with a more comfortable life and a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Clapham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing a motorcycle for her work

loans.name: Bengadee Group

texts.en:
Bengadee Group is a group of two borrowers led by Fatu K..

Fatu is 42 years old and is married with two children aged 15 and 23 years old, with educational levels of 5th grade and 12th grade. She also cares for four orphans. Fatu is illiterate due to poverty. She and her family live in the Sheriff Quarter, a large Muslim community in Voinjama, the capital of Lofa County, northern Liberia.

Fatu’s business is selling clothing. She buys clothes wholesale and sells retail in the Voinjama main market. She has been running this business for five years and hopes to expand to a bigger shop. She talks to her customers with a good manner in order encourage them to continue buying from her.

Fatu and her family depend on her business for their daily needs. Therefore, she needs this loan in order to purchase more clothing wholesale to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education and building a house of their own.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing wholesale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. sells grocery items, such as soap, washing powder, canned beef and tomatoes, at Elmina near Mpoben station. Elizabeth has a senior high education. She is single and cares for five dependents. Elizabeth has been selling groceries since 1987. She is responsible for paying school fees, utility bills and general upkeep of the home. 

Her loan will be used to buy more groceries for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia G. is from the town of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Hermenia is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Hermenia owns and runs a "sari-sari" (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products to the community. Hermenia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Hermenia joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hermenia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Hermenia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve and expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: investing in expanding her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose P. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste at home and is requesting a loan to buy more groundnuts for making paste to sell.  Rose is 40 years old and is married to a policeman. She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a new house for her children and pay their school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy groundnuts for making paste to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Bathangai

texts.en: Bathangai is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two-year-old infant in Arhangai Province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a "ger", a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Bathangai operates a shoe making business in his town. He specializes in making a variety of traditional Mongolian shoes such as the "Buriad" and the "Mongol". His business is especially busy during national holidays, celebrations and the wedding season in Mongolia. Bathangai started his business in 2004 with a working capital of 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD). He has worked hard to grow his business over the last five years, but it has been difficult at times to lead a normal life. As his business is the only source of income for his family, he is focused on improving his skills as a shoemaker and growing his business. The most important thing to him is being able to provide for his children's education. Now that his working capital has reached 700,000 tugrugs (~490 USD) with his years of saving he has been able to buy a car for his family needs. Bathangai is requesting a 600,000 tugrug loan to purchase leather, glue, thread and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase leather, glue, thread and other necessary raw materials

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Mrs. Digna P. is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 41 years old and married with 5 children. Mrs Digna and her husband have owned a motorcycle repair shop for more than 2 years. She earn approximately 5000 PHP a month. She was encouraged to join PMPC to gain access to financial support, improve her living situation and enhance her business abilities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to expand her business. She has a new loan of 15000 PHP also from PMPC, so this will be the 3rd cycle of loans from PMPC. This loan will be used as additional capital to purchase tools for the shop. The business helps to improve the general living conditions of the P. family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional tools for the shop

loans.name: Magaly Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Magaly del Socorro V., trabaja para la Alcaldía de Chinandega, es operaria de limpieza ubicada en el mercado el bisnes casada, su esposo también trabaja para la Alcaldía de Chinandega, tiene tres hijos todos en edad escolar.
La señora Magaly se ha ayudado enormemente con los créditos en Ceprodel porque  ha podido levantar poco a poco su casa, para brindarle a sus hijos un hogar digno.
texts.en:
Mrs. Magaly del Socorro V. works for the Chinandega mayor's office as a custodian. The office is located in the marketplace of El Bisne. Magaly is married, and her husband also works for the mayor's office. They have three children, all of school age. With loans from Ceprodel, Magaly has helped herself enormously, because little by little she has been able to construct her house, providing her children with a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheets of zinc, cement, iron, and two wooden doors

loans.name: Channary

texts.en: T. Channary is 26 years old and resides with her husband and one young child in the Takeo province.  She stays at home looking after her young child and cooking food for her husband.  Her husband is a taxi driver who is able to make $6 per day. To earn more income to help support the family, T. Channary is asking for a loan of $1200 to open a fruit store.

loans.use: Open a fruit store.

loans.name: Seyi

texts.en:
Seyi is 30 years old and married with two children. She is a Yoruba by tribe, and lives and works in Delta State, Nigeria. Her husband is a carpenter and also supports their home.
Seyi sells groceries and drinks at wholesale and retail prices. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She hopes to expand her grocery and drinks business in order to meet the demands of her customers. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Nayani

texts.en:
Nayani is 29 years old and lives with her husband, two daughters and two sons. Her husband is a driver and he helps her in her business. She works hard and places her priority on operating her business.

Nayani's business involves preparing lunch packets containing rice and curry, which she has been doing for more than ten years. Currently, she prepares thirty lunch packets per day. There is strong competition in her area for selling lunch packets, but Nayani's husband helps her by delivering and selling them to customers at his place of work, which greatly helps the business.

Nayani is seeking a 35,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka which she will use to purchase new kitchen items. She hopes to expand her food delivery area and use the additional income to open her own food cafeteria.

loans.use: To purchase new kitchen items

loans.name: Melania Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Melania  es una mujer trabajadora, de edad de 43 años. Desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, el cual comenzó con ahorro de su hechuras de costuras, pues se dedicaba a la costura, con ayuda de su esposo económica logra invertir en cosmético con poca cantidad. Su esposo es albañil y se beneficia con las mejoras de su casa ya que no paga mano de obra. Ella trabaja con catálogos con los cosméticos de la Avon, las ventas están bajas, y desea invertir más para lograr mejores ventas. Lo que quiere mejorar en su casa es el piso que esta ya en mal estado el cual cambiara con cerámica que comprara a si como lo que necesite en material para comenzar la obra. Contenta por los beneficios alcanzados con las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Melania is 43 years old. She is a hard-working woman, and for several years she has been selling cosmetics and clothing. Melania started this business with the savings from her previous work as a seamstress. Combining these funds with some help from her husband, she managed to invest into a small amount of cosmetics inventory. She sells cosmetics from Avon catalogs, but her sales volume is low, so she wants to invest more in order to increase her sales. Melania would like to improve the flooring in her house because it is in poor condition. She wants to install a ceramic floor and thus she needs to purchase the necessary materials in order to start the work. Her husband is a bricklayer, which is a advantage, since they don't have to pay the labor costs. Melania is happy about the improvements she has been making to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ceramics and other materials for improving the floor which is in poor condition

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel A. is 32 years old. Russel is married and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Russel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting coconuts for sale. She is also engaged in buying copra from the neighboring villages. Russel has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Russel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Russel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to pay for services to increase crop yield. Russel is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Russel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarorn O. (shown in the photo), 32, and her husband Mr. YO. Kan, 35, have been married since 1996 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Three of them are in school. They are living across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sarorn has been selling fish for 10 years. Her husband has been driving a horse cart for five years. Besides these businesses, the couple also farms.

Sarorn is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase a water-pumping machine to spray her farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water-pumping machine to spray her farm

loans.name: Alfonce

texts.en: Alfonce is a 48-year-old married man with three children in school. He has been running a retail shop to earn a living. He also farms to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya as part of a group called "Kitooni", he has managed to invest in his business through his savings. Alfonce is the breadwinner in his family and he works hard to provide for the family. He has requested a loan of KES 40,000 to add to his stock of maize flour, cooking fat, sugar, and salt. He hopes to own a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, cooking fat, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.es:
El Sr. Silvestre V. S. de 64 años de edad vive con su cónyuge. Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en la Coop. Sta. Dominguita del distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como chofer en su propio vehiculo generándole un ingreso diario. El Sr Silvestre tiene una familia muy emprendedora que ha salido adelante, siempre con la ayuda de su esposa quien trabaja como obrera de campo. El señor Silvestre solicita el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda. Su sueño nos manifiesta es terminar de construir su vivienda y dedicarse mas adelante a la agricultura en su propia parcela. 
Agradece  por anticipado el apoyo brindado del presente financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Silvestre V. S. is 64 years old and lives with his common-law wife. He has his own house in Santa Dominguita, in Santiago. He works as a taxi operator driving his own vehicle to earn his daily income. Mr. Silvestre's family is very enterprising and has gotten ahead in life--always with the help of his wife, who works as a farm laborer. Mr. Silvestre is asking for a loan to finish constructing his house. His dream is to finish building his house and in the future to work in agriculture on his own plot of land. He is thankful in advance for the support given him by the current loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: El señor Rolando José tiene un negocio que es un taller de soldadura ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace 9 años. Rolando realiza trabajos fuera de su casa cuando algún cliente lo solicita, realiza la compra de sus materiales de contado y sus ventas son de contado y al crédito. Por lo que ha demostrado que es una persona muy responsable y además siempre paga sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento a su negocio y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Rolando recibe ayuda de su esposa la cual trabaja como directora de un colegio, el señor vive de manera moderada y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Rolando José has been running a soldering workshop in a room in his house for 9 years. He works out of home at his clients’ request and purchases materials in cash and sells for cash or credit. He has demonstrated that he is a very responsible person and always makes his repayments on time and in full. With this loan he would like to maintain his business adequately and obtain the most income possible, and he is very happy with the loan terms he has been offered. Rolando is supported by his wife who works as the director of a college. He lives moderately and has all the basic services he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hop

texts.en: Hop T. D. is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and one child in Luc Canh village. She has a shop in the market, where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years and has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2006. In the last cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and has completely repaid this amount punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to expand her shop (buy more clothes to sell).

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell in her shop

loans.name: Regine

texts.en: Regine S. is from the village of Villaverde, Iligan City. She is 20 years old and is single. Regine owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling personal products like ready to wear kind of clothes in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Regine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villaverde, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Narcisa Beatriz

texts.en:
Narcisa Beatriz G. C. is 42 years old. She lives with her children in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province. She has four children, who are ages 25, 23, 16, and 8. 

Narcisa is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Narcisa works in agriculture and has been raising animals for the past 12 years. She does the buying and selling of her products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther.

Narcisa plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for agriculture. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and keep working in agriculture. 

She likes to play sports and enjoys the festivals for the patron saint San Jose.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed for her crops

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Mrs. Thon S. is a villager in Trapeang Phlu village in Takeo province, who was born in 1985. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chorn Chan, is a construction worker and he also sells sand. Her problem is that is time to plow her field, but she does not have enough oxen to plow it. So, to improve her production Mrs. Thon S. is applying for a loan to buy an ox, and will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in school, while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy an ox for plowing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more food for the store

loans.name: Amartuvshin

texts.en:
Amartuvshin N. lives with his wife and children in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Amartuvshin supports his family by operating a successful taxi service in his town, an enterprise he started in 2007 after moving to his current province. For the future, he and his wife are planning to start a grocery business by renting small space where they will sell a variety of foodstuffs. His hope is to soon expand the business.

A very modest and polite man, Amartuvshin is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase groceries such as bread, pastries, flour, rice and candies from wholesale stores in the capital city of the province for his future grocery shop.

loans.use: To purchase groceries such as bread, pasties, flour, and rice for a new business

loans.name: Jannaqt Liaqat Ali's Group

texts.en:
Jannat Liaquat A. lives in Pakpattan, a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its sugar production. She lives in the area named 20SP in a three-room brick house with her family. She is a housewife, stays at home and helps her husband in his dairy business.
 
Her husband has some buffalo at home from which he gets milk. Jannat supports her husband by taking care of his buffalo and giving them food and water on time. She is a very supportive and active lady who is always ready to support her family.
  
Her husband has a good reputation among his customers. He has obtained a good customers base in a three-year period. He sells them good quality milk and earns a good profit. He sells 1 kg of milk for 45 PKR. His sales allow him to manage the financial expenses of his family.  

Jannat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo, which will increase the production of milk and help him to serve more customers and make more income.
 
Jannat is hopeful that an additional buffalo will increase her husband's profits. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Jannat.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Muira

texts.en:
Muira has been selling timber in Ndunyu Njeru town since 1984.  He is 45 years old, married to Milkah Wanjiru and they have six children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his 3rd loan.  He repaid his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more timber for sale as his stock is running low.

In future, Muira hopes to be a big supplier of timber in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy more timber for sale

loans.name: Kalsoom Younas Farooq Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom lives in a small city of Punjab province of Pakistan called Khanewal that is famous for its agriculture industry. She lives in a two-room brick house in an area named Railway Landy, with her husband and their 17-year-old son. Kalsoom moved to her house after her marriage to Y. F., who has a barber shop business. Kalsoom’s son left school after fifth grade. Now he stays at home, and Kalsoom prays that he will find suitable work soon and start contributing financially to the family. 

Kalsoom is a housewife who works in the home. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband expand his barber shop business. With the loan, he will buy necessary items such as scissors, hair shampoo, and hair gels to offer better services to his customers. Kalsoom is hopeful that her husband, who started this business 5 years ago, will be able to improve his business with the help of this loan.  

Kalsoom is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. She has maintained a good credit repayment history and never misses meetings. In this photo, Kalsoom is seen holding her passbook, the Asasah Passbook.

loans.use: to buy items for barber shop business

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem V. is a long-time businessman and a low-income person.  He is a gasoline seller   in retail to his neighbor other people in and around Kompong Tom Province, and earning an income of approximately $5.60 per day for supporting his family’s expenses. He has a life partner in his wife who is a seller of different products such as fast food, and Khmer cake. The couple is blessed with three children, all three of whom are single and living on their own. Hem V.’s house has already been built, but now his saving account is not enough to pay for the construction fee. This is why he has decided to look for lenders on Kiva. Hem V. was not available at that day, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To pay the construction fee.

loans.name: Victor Alfredo

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén. 

Aquí encontramos a Víctor, tiene 37 años de edad, está soltero y vive en la casa de una hermana la cual alquilan a medias. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que les dan los créditos para su negocio y porque los intereses son bajos en relación a otras instituciones financieras.

Se dedica a la venta de periódicos y revistas, tiene un puesto en el mercado # 1 de la ciudad de Portoviejo, trabaja todos los días desde 04h30 hasta las 13h30. Nos cuenta que lleva varios años que se dedica a esta actividad y que ha ido creciendo poco a poco, ahora espera invertir este crédito y aumentar su negocio con la venta de boletos de rifas y lotería lo que le dará mejores ganancias.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar boletos de lotería para la venta, además de revistas, Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Víctor, 37, can be found in Manabí’s capital Portoviejo’s Nueva California neighborhood.  Portoviejo has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.  The members of the Nueva Jerusalén (The New Jerusalem) communal bank meet here every two weeks.

He is single and shares a house with his sister; they split the rental cost fifty-fifty.  This is his third cycle in the communal bank.  He likes it because of the benefits the loans provide for his business and because the interest rates are low compared to other financial institution.

He sells newspapers and magazines in a stand in Puertoviejo’s #1 Market.  He works every day from 4:30am until 1:30pm.  He tells us that he’s been in this business for several years and it has been growing gradually.  He hopes to use this new loan to increase business selling lottery and raffle tickets which will produce better profits.

He will use this loan to buy lottery tickets to sell as well as magazines.  His dream is to have a bigger business.

loans.use: To buy magazines and lottery tickets.

loans.name: Concorde Plus Group

texts.en:
Derlin is the chairman of a community bank named “Concorde Plus,” which is composed of 10 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans through IMF HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Derlin is 42 years old and married with five children between the ages of one and 18. Four of his children attend school. Derlin runs a telephone booth and sells eggs. He started his business in 2003 with 200 USD and it has prospered since then with hard work. Derlin’s business is located in the city of Kinshasa. He has a good credit history with Hope DRCongo and has successfully repaid six loans.

Derlin is requesting a loan to purchase prepaid telephone cards and increase his inventory of eggs. He makes a weekly profit of 65 USD and wants to increase his working capital. In the future, Derlin’s ambition is to become the sole telephone card and egg provider in his area.

loans.use: to purchase telephone cards and eggs

loans.name: Inaam

texts.en:
Inaam, 36 years old, is married and the mother of one daughter and two sons. Inaam and her family came back to Palestine recently. She and her husband own a house in the city where they live, and they want to furnish it. Inaam came to FATEN to get a loan to purchase basic home furniture such as beds and couches. Inaam's husband has retired recently.

Inaam's husband, Muhammad, appears in the photo since Inaam is a conservative woman who is not comfortable with her picture being on the web.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Esterllita

texts.en:
Esterllita is a married woman who lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu city. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Romeo B., who is 42 years old, works as a trisikad (pedicab) driver to earn his living. They have four children who are between the ages of 5 and 20. Esterllita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Esterllita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 22,400 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth cycle loan, she is borrowing 12,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more inventory to sell. Her goal is to continue to save up for the future expansion of  their house and to have an additional business. Esterllita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 
 
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Jenifa

texts.en:
Jenifa is a happy, 32-year-old single woman. She sells shoes and bags in her spacious store which she has been running for 13 years. Currently, she employs one other person to help her in the store.

Jenifa plans to use her loan to purchase a large stock of shoes and bags. If she is successful in earning profits from the use of this loan, Jenifa will continue to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For rice, oil and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jose Bartolo

texts.es:
el sr. Jose A. tiene 60 años de edad, vive en la aldea El Juanco en la ciudad de Nacaome, Jose se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, se nota que a administrado muy bien su negocio ya que este luce bien limpio, ordenado y con variedad de productos.
tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por sus bajos precios y por la calidad de los mismos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria y asi tener mas inventario y mas surtida su pulperia, desea comprar los productos al por mayor para asi poder obtener mejores ganancias, las cuales las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo y su meta es poder remodelar su casa y asi atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose A. is 60 years old and lives in the neighborhood of El Juanco in the city of Nacaome. He sells everyday consumer products from a store located in his home. It should be noted that his business is managed very well since it is clean, organized, and stocked with a variety of products. He has many customers who prefer the low prices and quality of his merchandise.

This loan will be used to buy groceries so that he will have more inventory to stock his store. He wants to buy products in bulk so that he can generate better earnings which he needs to move his family forward. Jose says he is very happy with his growing business. His goal is to remodel his house so that he can improve service to his customers.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Ranie

texts.en:
Ranie T. is from the village of North Poblacion, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old and single. To make a living, Ranie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling junk foods, candies and snacks, such as suman and rice cakes, in the local community. She also sells green bananas and coconuts for copras. Ranie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Ranie joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Ranie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional green bananas and coconuts. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase green bananas and coconuts

loans.name: Mirna Daniela

texts.es: La Srita. Mirna P.  es una profesionista que esta iniciando a desarrollarse en su área , ella vive con sus padres  ya que es soltera  y con sus ingresos ella adquirió su propio automóvil para trasladarse a  su trabajo y ha decidió cooperar en su vivienda,  solicita  el crédito ya que  últimamente  debido a las ocasiones en que ha caído lluvia y  granizo se preocupa mucho de que se le vaya a dañar su auto que con esfuerzos ha comprado, por este motivo, decidió ayudar a sus padres construyendo la cochera para guardar el auto, y así evita se le dañe su vehiculo cuando llegue a granizar ya que el costo para reparar ese tipo de daños es muy elevado , ahora la Srita. Mirna se siente mas satisfecha porque ha empezado la construcción de su cochera y así se quedara mas tranquila por la seguridad de su auto y de sus bienes.
texts.en:
Ms. Mirna P. is a professional starting out in her area.  She is single living with her parents and she bought a car with her own income to be able to get to work.  She has decided to cooperate with housing expenses and is asking for a loan because she’s afraid the recent heavy rainfall and hail storms will damage her car which she got with so much effort and sacrifice.  

She wants to help her parents to build a car port to safeguard the car and avoid it being damaged when it hails because repair costs for that kind of damage are very high.  She feels more satisfied now because she’s started construction of the car port and she’ll be more at ease now about the security of her car and her goods.

loans.use: to build a car port.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to increase her business.

loans.name: Argentina

texts.es: Argentina vive con su compañero D.  vida Rodolfo y su hijo. Ella posee un comedor en el cual venD. ricos desayunos y almuerzos; es muy conocida en el lugar pues ella prepara los platillos más exquisitos y los venD. a precios accesibles a sus clientes; para ella la comida se anuncia a la nariz del cliente desD. su cocina. El rico sabor D. sus comidas ha llamado mas clientela últimamente y Argentina quiere estar preparada es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima como granos básicos, carnes, embutidos, lácteos, verduras, pan, bebidas entre otros, así no defraudara a sus clientes y les permitirá seguir degustando D. las ricas comidas que prepara. Argentina tiene la confianza D. que su negocio le dará la oportunidad D. darle a su familia una vida plena llena D. alegrías.
texts.en: Argentina lives with her life partner Rodolfo and her son.  She owns an eatery where she sells delicious breakfasts and lunches.  She is very well known in her area because she makes the most delicious meals and sells them to her customers at affordable prices.  Her food greets her customers from her kitchen.  The delicious flavor of her meals has recently attracted more customers and Argentina would like to be prepared.  For this reason, she has requested a loan from INTEGRAL which will enable her to buy more supplies such as basic grains, meat, cold cuts, dairy products, vegetables, bread, drinks, etc.  In this way, she will be able to keep her customers happy and allow them to continue enjoying the delicious meals that she prepares.  Argentina is confident that, through her business, she will be able to proviD. her family with a life full of happiness.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, cold cuts, dairy products, vegetables, bread and drinks

loans.name: Mwanamimi

texts.en:
Mwanamimi is a married woman with seven children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past 14 years, Mwanamimi has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumption items retail and wholesale to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells coconut, her other source of income. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and coconuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en: Carlita, 53 years old, is a teacher. She is married to a farmer. They have been blessed with 2 children. She's into the livestock business, particularly hog-raising. She's been in this business for almost 5 years. Her net income for 3 months is 3,000 PHP per hog. She's asking a loan amounting to 35,000 PHP to purchase some hogs to raise.
