She would like to continue availing loans from Kiva lenders. She hopes that they will extend their assistance to her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase some hogs to raise.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander tiene 33 años, su actividad es la venta de semilla de jicaro. Tiene más de 9 años en este negocio. Inicio este negocio por su padre quien le enseño a trabajar de manera muy humilde, Alexander tiene 3 hijos a los cuales les brinda los ingresos necesarios. El financiamiento es para la compra de bolsas, semilla entre otros.
texts.en:
Alexander, age 33, sells “semilla de jícaro” (a drink that is very thick and sweet).  He has had this business for over nine years.  He started this business because his father taught him to work in a very humble way.  

Alexander has three children, and he provides the income for the necessities.

The loan is to buy bags and seeds.

loans.use: to buy bags and seeds.

loans.name: Junezza

texts.en:
Junezza is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 1 child. 

Junezza has a retail shop that sells candies, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy candies, beverages and snacks.

Junezza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Junezza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy candies, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 58 years-old and married with one child.

Luciana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional items to sell.

Luciana has borrowed and paid for 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 37 years and also earns an income from selling purified drinking water.

Luciana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: La señora Ruth tiene una tienda donD. se dedica a al venta D. víveres y artefactos domésticos. El crédito lo requiere para cancelar una operación D. varices que ella tiene que someterse lo más antes posible pues el dolor es insoportable y a veces no le deja atender su negocio. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona D. Sopocachi en la ciudad D. La Paz; es  divorciada tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que la cliente trabaja con IMPRO y se canaliza a través D. Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Ruth has a shop where she sells food and household products.  The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for an operation to treat her varicose veins.  She needs this procedure as soon as possible because the pain is unbearable and sometimes she is not able to attend to her business.  Ruth lives in her own home in the District of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz.  She is divorced and has one child.  

This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO, so she is being referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to pay for an operation.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a hardworking and committed 26-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with a two year old child. For the past 3 years she has been offering beauty salon services to meet the needs of her family. She makes an extra shilling from her rental houses. She wants, in the next 5 years, to have expanded her business and increased profitability by 50%. Her dream is to own a supermarket. She is requesting a loan of 20000 Kenya shillings to buy weaves, wigs, treatments and conditioners. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to be competitive in the beauty industry.

loans.use: to buy weaves, wigs, treatments and conditioners

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has eight children with six of them currently in school. 

For the past five years, Ali has been working hard to manage his poultry business, which sells chickens in the local market. 

To help expand his business, Ali has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more birds and will help Ali to generate greater profits and improve the standard of living for his family. 

Ali hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another poultry business. 

Ali is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ali who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more poultry.

loans.name: Gardelias Del Sur Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Lidia cuenta 37 años es casada tiene cuatro hijos los cuales aun estudian 3: Luis está cursando la prepa, Gerardo esta estudiando la primaria, Angelín está cursando el preescolar.

Ella se dedica al comercio tiene la venta de comida establecida en su casa, los invirtió su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para elaborar la comida como son: carne, chile, jitomate, cebolla, condimentos, etc. A la Sra. Lidia Le gustaría que su negocio fuera más grande, le ha beneficiado mucho ya que lo ha sabido  administrar.

Ella pertenece al grupo Gardelias del sur que está integrado por 11 miembros las cuales realizan diferentes actividades.

La Sra. Elvia se dedica al comercio vende pollo y pescado, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de pescado y mas pollo.

La Sra. Marta se dedica al comercio vende cenas por las tardes, lo cual invirtió su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para elaborar la comida como son: aceite, verdura y carne, etc.

La Sra. Guadalupe se dedica al comercio de venta de material de mercería, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de material como son: hilo, aguja, estambre, etc.

La Sra. Elizabeth se dedica al comercio de pescadería ella vende pescado en los pueblos, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas pescado y camarones.

La Sra. Benita es comerciante vende maíz, invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas maíz para revenderlo.
 
La Sra. María es comerciante ella  su préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de mas pan para revenderlo.

La Sra. Josefina se dedica al comercio ella tiene un puesto de dulces, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de más dulces y sobritas y jugos.

La Sra. Epifanía se dedica al comercio de pescado, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de más pescado y mariscos.

La Sra. Hortensia se dedica a vender frijol y maíz, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de frijol y maíz para revenderlo.

La Sra. Paula se dedica a vender pescado, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de más pescado.
texts.en:
Lidia is 37 years old, married with 3 children who still study. Luis is in high school, Gerardo is in elementary, and Angelín is in preschool. She has a business selling food from her home. Her loan was for the purchase of supplies used for preparing meals such as meat, chilies, tomatoes, onions, condiments, and other items. Lidia would like to have a larger store, and she has benefited a great deal since she learned about management.

She belongs to the Gardelias del Sur group, which has 11 members involved in different activities.

Elvia works selling chicken and fish. Her loan was for the purchase of fish and more chicken.

Marta works selling the evening meal. Her loan was to buy supplies used making the food such as oil, vegetables, and meat among other items.

Guadalupe sells notions and she used her loan to buy thread, needles, and yarn and other items.

Elizabeth works selling fish in the villages and she used her loan to buy more fish and shrimp.

Benita works selling corn, and she used her loan to buy more corn for resale.

María is a shopkeeper and she used her loan to buy bread for resale.

Josefina works selling sweets and her loan was used to buy more sweets, bags of chips, and juices.

Epifanía sells fish. She used her loan in the purchase of fish and other seafood.

Hortensia sells beans and corn and she used her loan to buy beans and corn in order to resale it.

Paula sells fish. She invested her loan to buy more fish.

loans.use: to buy supplies used for preparing meals such as meat, chilies, tomatoes, onions, condiments, and other items

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines, mackerel and milk fish. She has had this business for 8 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fish to sell. Merlyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru: Толиб занимается поварским делом. Он женат, имеет двоих детей. Общее питание востребовано везде. Толиб на заказ готовит национальные блюда. Поэтому он для расширения своего бизнеса  и для получения больше прибыли хочет открыть собственную столовую. Но для этого нужны средства. Поэтому он решил обратиться к нам и получить займ. Полученный займ поможет ему для открытия и оформления собственной столовой.
texts.en: Tolib is a cook. He's married and has two children. Good cooking is always in demand and Tolib makes ethnic dishes on a by-order basis. In order to expand his business and increase profits, he wants to open a cafe. But for this he requires capital. Therefore, he decided to consult us and request a loan. He would use that loan to open and perfect his cafe.

loans.use: To open a cafe

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past five years, Samuel has been working hard to manage his service shop, in which he does repairs on motorcycles, sells spare parts and charges batteries. 

To help expand his business, Samuel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts and power inverters to help with charging batteries. The loan will help Samuel to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Samuel hopes that in the future he will be able to begin preparing for old age and to finish paying the tuition for his child's school fees. 

Samuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves entrepreneurs like Samuel with small business who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts and power inverters to help with charging batteries.

loans.name: Lesbia Elena

texts.es: Lesbia Elena se encuentra muy contenta de realizar este negocio. Ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de costura. Desde hace más de  15 años, tiene 6 hijos a su cargo de 20, 19, 17, 14,13 y 11 años respectivamente que con arduo esfuerzo y dedicación ha sacado adelante. Ella es una mujer luchadora y ha demostrado que con su perseverancia logra muchas cosas. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de telas, agujas, tijeras, hilos, cintas, bordados entre otros. Puede obtener muchas cosas gracias a los préstamos, está muy agradecida porque le enseñaron muchas cosas.
texts.en: Lesbia Elena is very happy to be in this business.  She has been a seamstress for over 15 years.  She has six children in her care who are 20, 19, 17, 14, 13 and 11 years old who she has raised with much effort and dedication.  She is a tenacious mother who has demonstrated that she can attain many things with tenacity.  The reason for the loan is to buy fabric, needles, scissors, thread, ribbon and embroidery, among others.  She can acquire many things thanks to the loans and she is very grateful because they taught her many things.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, scissors, ribbon and embroidery, among others.

loans.name: Foi Plus Group

texts.en:
Foi Plus is a community bank made up of 24 micro-entrepreneurs whose chairman is Yannick. These members are united for the same goal- to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Yannick sells soft drinks in his area located in the eastern area of Kinshasa. He has been in the business world since 2010, selling the same product. After hard work and good management, he succeeded in making it thrive thanks to the accumulated profits. He is happy to be one of MFI HOPE’s clients. He intends to reinforce the capital with the next loan by adding some more crates of soft drinks. The business gives him a profit of 20 USD every day. 

Yannick’s ambition is to open a soft drink facility in his environment. He is 26 years old and single.

loans.use: to purchase 10 crates of soft drinks for resale at a profit

loans.name: Pedro Fidel

texts.es:
Pedro Fidel tiene 53 años D. edad es casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y con L. hijos D. 12, 10, 8 y 6 años D. edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia D. L. Ríos.

La VRC. SAN JOSE Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El Rosario, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas D. ciclo corto siembra D. maíz, arroz.

Pedro se dedica a la Agricultura desD. hace 15 años a la siembra D. maíz, cacao, arroz, cría D. chanchos, gallinas. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz comprar abonos agricolas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá salir adelante con L. hijos.
El sueño es tener un carro en L. tiempos libres le gusta estudiar y leer la biblia.
texts.en:
Pedro Fidel is 53 years old, married, and has four children. He lives with his wife and children (ages 12, 10, 8, and 6) in the canton of Ventanas in L. Ríos Province.

The San Jose Communal Bank is located in neighborhood of El Rosario, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Pedro has been a farmer for 15 years. He grows corn, cacao, and rice. Pedro also raises pigs and chickens. He purchases his supplies and sells his products in Ventanas. The loan he is requesting will be used for growing corn. He plans to buy compost. With the help of this loan, his children will be able to move forward.

His dream is to have a car. In his free time, Pedro enjoys studying and reading the Bible.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Gazelle

texts.en:
Gazelle is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Gazelle has a shop that sells clothing like shirts, blouses and bed sheets. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Gazelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gazelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with seven children living in Trinidad, Bohol with her family. Josephine buys and resells fruit and vegetables like bananas and sweet potatoes. Josephine earns about 4000 PHP per month with her business.

Josephine is requesting a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell. Josephine hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes for her family's living situation to improve.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married to a farmer and has three children. Efua is a fishmonger and also sells kenkey (traditional Ghanian dish) at Kwahinkrom. Efua uses her income to support her hushand in providing for their family. She will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale, as well as maize to prepare her kenkey. With the new profit, Efua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish and maize

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: Lucio de sesenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a sus hijos; él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y a la crianza de ganado; tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de mucha incidencia agrícola  muy cercano a la zona donde reside, comercia en todos los lugares aledaños y ya tiene mucha clientela pues todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Lucio es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que se le presentan, en la última cosecha tuvo pérdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizante, insecticida, herramienta, etc. Lucio tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable por eso asegura que pagara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: semilla de maíz, fertilizante, insecticida, herramienta

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en: Sabitri is a 30-year-old differently able woman living with her two children in a village of Odisha, India. She has a small vegetable shop at her house from which she earns 2,000 INR per month. Her children are studying. Her shop is the only shop for the 50 to 60 families living near her house in the village. She says that she feels good about making some daily household needs accessible to her customers without them having to travel far. She plans to start a grocery shop where she will sell grains, lentils, rice, wheat etc. for which she has requested a loan of 35,000 INR. She wants to utilize 40% of the loan to buy more rice and stock up for the monsoon season. There is a lot of demand for rice during this season as there is not enough stock available in the market. Sabitri's dream is to see her children continue school and give them a quality life.

loans.use: to buy grains, lentils, rice, wheat, and vegetables for her grocery store.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.en:
Magaly sells clothes in her local community. This type of activity allows her the flexibility to bring in a stable source of income while also giving her time to spend with her children. While she is out selling, her mother takes care of her youngest one while the others are at school. She began in this line of work with only $15 in investment capital.

Magaly needs a loan in order to make investments in her business. She wants to buy a larger amount of clothing at cheaper prices so she may be able to keep more profits. She works very hard, often traveling to downtown Guayaquil in search of potential customers for her goods.

Magaly is 29 years old and has 4 small children. She feels proud to be able to help her family with the extra money she makes. She is very grateful of the help her mother provides, without her she would not be able to run this business and care for her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in new clothing to sell

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome started her business in the year 2000 with capital of $300, which she was given by the husband. She is married and has two children. She is educated to level 8 when she dropped out of school due to lack of school fees. She has been trained in business skills by Rafode.

Given the loan, she want to expand her business by buying an additional sewing machine which will enable her to employ an additional person to help her in the business.

She wants to use the profit to save for the education of her children, medical care and daily family use.

loans.use: Purchase an additional sewing machine

loans.name: Genoveba

texts.en:
In a place called García, Nuevo León, lives Genoveba. She is married and has four children, ages 5, 8, and 10. With desires to improve her life and in order to be able to help a little with the household expenses, four years ago she started her own business selling shoes. She started out selling to relatives and friends. Thanks to her character and her way with words, she has succeeded in getting many more customers and making her business prosper.

Presently, Genoveba needs a loan for $925, which she will use to buy merchandise in order to fulfill the requests of her customers. She promises to repay it over a period of 6 to 12 months. You can be an important part of the growth of this business and the lives of Genoveba and her family. They are sincerely grateful for your help.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

En la localidad de García, Nuevo León vive Genoveba, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, de 5, 8 y 10 años de edad, con deseos de superación y para poder ayudar un poco con el gasto, ella empezó su propio negocio con las ventas de zapatos inició con sus familiares y amigos, gracias a su carácter y la facilidad de palabra que tiene, ha logrado tener muchos más clientes y hacer prosperar su negocio que inició hace cuatro años.

En estos momentos, Genoveba requiere de un préstamo por $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, ella se compromete a retornar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de Genoveba y su familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy feed for his animals

loans.name: Seiaute

texts.en:
Seiaute T. is a married woman with six children. Her husband who works as a cleaner at a nearby hotel used to run a village shop but the income was not enough to put their children through school and put food on the table for their family.

The first loan Seiaute took out only covered her for a few months and now she has made a request for US$ 900 to add more stock of different varieties to suit the consumers' needs which can only result in profit that will allow her to better provide for her family.

Seiaute explains that her business is improving slowly due to competition in her village; she tries her best to offer the best price to her village and good service so that her business will grow for the future.

loans.use: Restock her shop

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en: Abbass is a 39 year old single man. He sells clothes, shoes and even mobile phones in the region of Borj Barajneh. Abbass has some samples at home of the products he sells. He presents them to the neighboring shops and once he gets an order, he buys the required quantity from the wholesaler and gives it directly to the retailer. You can see him in this picture at home with a couple of clothing samples. Abbass needs a loan to buy the merchandise of the orders. This is the second time Abbass has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua. He is constantly investing in his business and trying to improve it.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Please

texts.es: Client posted twice

loans.use: Comprar mas mercaderia y atender mas clientes

loans.name: Rasool's Group

texts.en:
I live in a small town Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. I live here with my husband and kids in a four-room brick house. I am a mother of five girls and two boys. My husband operates a grocery store. All of my kids are done with their studies and three are married.

Currently, we require a loan to expand our grocery store. My husband has been operating this store for the last six years and he makes decent profits.

My group members are: Hajra B., who needs a loan for their used items trading; Anwer B., who needs a loan to expand their milk business; Kalsoom B., who requires a loan for their grocery items wholesale business; Majeedan B., who will invest their loan in their grocery store.

I am the group leader of these women because I want to help them so that their families can also prosper and consequently our community.

loans.use: Expand grocery store

loans.name: I Ketut Sudika

texts.id:
I Ketut Sudika lives in Manistutu village, in addition to his routine job as a farmer, I Ketut Sudika also sells fertilizer. A wide range of fertilizer is available for sale at his house. He entered to this business as he sees that most of his neighbors are farmers, so they will need fertilizer. The farmers in the neighborhood prefer to buy fertilizer from I Ketut Sudika as Ketut provides delivery service and credit facility where his customers can pay for the fertilizer after the harvest. That's why I Ketut Sudika needs additional capital to improve his business. In addition the price of fertilizer has gone up lately. With additional capital from Dinari, I Ketut Sadika can serve more farmers. His family's welfare will also improving and his children can pursue a higher level of education.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

I Ketut Sudika tinggal di desa Manistutu, dalam kesehariannya selain sebagai petani I Ketut Sudika juga menekuni usaha sebagai penjual pupuk. Berbagai macam pupuk tersedia dirumahnya. Usaha ini ditekuni melihat masyarakat disekitar tempat tinggalnya sebagian besar berprofesi sebagai petani ,yang pasti membutuhkan pupuk untuk pertumbuhan padinya. Para petani cenderung membeli pupuk pada I Ketut Sudika karena keistimewaan pelayanan yang diberikan yaitu layanan antar dan juga membayar setelah panen. Oleh sebab itu I Ketut Sudika memerlukan tambahan modal untuk usahanya ini,juga mengingat harga pupuk akhir-akhir ini meningkat drastis. Dengan adanya tambahan modal dari Dinari ,maka I Ketut Sudika dapat tetap menjalankan usahanya dan melayani petani lebih banyak lagi. Sehingga perekonomian keluarganya dapat terbantu dan anak-anaknya dapat melanjutkan sekolah ke jenjang yang lebih tinggi. Ia sangat berterimakasih kepada Dinari atas pinjaman yang telah diberikan.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer (Membeli pupuk)

loans.name: Mohammad Khan

texts.en: Mohammad Khan lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated and married. He was in Iran for about 6 years. When he came back 2 years ago, he decided to start a business. He opened a retail shop. Since then, he has attracted more clients in Kabul. Now he wants to enlarge his shop, so he requested an individual loan to complete his stock. He wants to make a good monthly income to help his family and make a good life in Afghanistan. He is happy with all parts of his family.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mr. Sok M., 48, and his wife, Ong Sophat, both earn $10 per day selling chickens. They live with their four children in Steng Sen Village, Kampong Thom Province. They request an $800 loan to make their chicken-selling business more efficient. With their increased profits, they hope to help pay their children’s school fees as well as improve their financial stability.

loans.use: To make their chicken-selling business more efficient

loans.name: Soonaalofa

texts.en:
Soonaalofa is 40 years old, married, with 3 children. She comes from a poor family background. Through the years they used to live on their family plantation, but when Samoa was hit by taro blight, it destroyed most of the plantations on the island. Her husband used to do carpentry work, but he was recently laid off due to company bankruptcy. Soonaalofa heard of SPBD through women of her village and she decided to join. This is her first loan She’s very thankful for such a great opportunity where she is able to improve her family's living.

Her loan will be used to purchase baking materials for pancakes (deep-fried dough) and ice cakes (ice cream) to be sold to the local villagers and school children.

loans.use: To purchase baking powder, sugar, flour, plastic, etc.

loans.name: Taleb Jan

texts.en:
Taleb Jan, son of S. N., is 33 years old. He returned to his home country of Afghanistan two years ago. During the war in Afghanistan, he was not able to continue his education in Pakistan because he encountered numerous financial problems while he was living there.

Fortunately, however, now he is the owner of a small shop near his house in the Shewa district. He wants to improve this small business and to generate a nice income from the shop, so he is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,100 (50,000 Afghanis) to buy many things for his shop and to thereby increase his income.

loans.use: To generate greater income by purchasing necessary goods for his shop

loans.name: Thi Chinh's Group

texts.vi:
• Mrs. N. Thi Chinh (ID number: 060028), 31 years old, wants to borrow 120 USD to buy more products for her general store. Her husband sells eggs, earning stable income. She has 2 children who are still going to school. She likes to borrow money from this program because she can repay gradually. Her average income is 8-9 USD/day.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Dan (ID number: 060029), wants to borrow 120 USD to buy more hats and books to sell.
  • Mrs. M. Thi Lam (ID number: 060031), wants to borrow 120 USD to have more fund for business in waste metals.
  • Mrs. N. Thi M. (ID number: 060032), wants to borrow 120 USD to buy more products for her general store.
  • Mrs. T. Thi Hoa (ID number: 060033), wants to borrow 120 USD to do business in waste materials.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

    Chị Nguyễn Thị Chỉnh (MS: 060028), năm nay 31 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để bổ sung vốn bán hàng tạp hóa. Chồng chị đi bán trứng có thu nhập thường xuyên. Chị có hai con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Chị rất thích tham gia vay vốn của chương trình vì được trả dần. Mức thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 120.000 VND/ngày.

  • Trong nhóm còn có :
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Dân (MS: 060029), vay 2.006.000 VND mua thêm mũ và sách vở bán.
  • Chị Mẫn Thị Lâm (MS: 060031), vay 2.006.000 VND bổ sung vốn buôn bán sắt vụn.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Mẫn (MS: 060032), vay 2.006.000 VND mua hàng tiêu dùng về bán.
  • Chị Trương Thị Hoa (MS: 060033), vay 2.006.000 VND để đi buôn bán phế liệu.

loans.use: general store, small businesses

loans.name: Brenda Leticia

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Brenda M..  I work selling products that are commonly consumed every day.  I have had my business for several years and, together with my husband, have worked to make it successful.  I have two children and we have managed to help them get ahead in their studies.

At this time I need help in order to increase my inventory because the demands of my clients are great and they are insisting that I buy other products and offer a larger variety.  The truth is, this business is the only thing that generates income to sustain my family and for that reason we have decided to grow it in order to support both my business and my family.  The good thing is that in the evenings I have the help of my two children who tend to my business and, thanks to God, everything is going well for us.  Thank you very much.Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.



hola mi nombre es Brenda M. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace varios años, junto con mi esposo hemos luchado para sacar adelante nuestro negocio, tengo dos hijos los cuales hemos logrado sacarlos adelante en sus estudios, en estos momentos nesecito una ayuda para poder incrementar mi inventario ya que la demanda de mis clientes es grande, y ellos me estan exigiendo que compre otros productos y que tenga mayor variedad, la verdad esta actividad es la unica que me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, por lo que hemos decido hacerla mas grande y asi poder sacar adelante mi negocio y mi familia.

lo bueno es que por las noches tengo la ayuda de mis dos hijos para la atencion de mi negocio, y gracias a Dios todo nos esta saliendo muy bien

muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, basic grains, eggs, beans, lard, salt, sugar, jellies, gelatins, churros, crackers, bread, candies, coffee, razors, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Sanura

texts.en:
Sanura is 35-years-old. She is married with 3 children between 13 and 3 years of age. She has been a clothes seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Sanura now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Julia Ramirez

texts.en:
Julia Ramierez G. D. M. is 36 years old and lives in Ayacucho, Perú with her husband and six children. As a result of an accident that her husband had several years ago which rendered him unable to work, Julia started her own grocery business. Julia follows the festivals in the area and sells fruits and vegetables. She has been selling groceries for 15 years. Julia takes care of her six children when she is not working.

The loan of 2,200 soles (US$750) will be invested into her business to purchase various fruits and vegetables including bananas, peaches, mandarins, onions, carrots, and eggplant. With the income she receives from her grocery business she hopes to buy a car so it is easier for her to transport her goods.

loans.use: To purchase various fruits and vegetables including bananas, peaches, mandarins, onions, carrots, and eggplant.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Dame P. Antoinette est née le 27/10/1959 à Agoué au Sud Est du Benin. Elle est veuve depuis 06 ans et a deux orphelins à sa charge. Après deux échecs au baccalauréat, elle s'est mise à revendre des pagnes avec sa maman. Aujourd'hui, outre la distribution de pagnes qu'elle fait habituellement, elle commercialise divers articles tels que les conserves, les pâtes alimentaires, l'huile d'arachide et la farine de manioc dans une petite boutique à son domicile. En vue d'accroître le niveau de son activité, elle sollicite ce troisième prêt de 160000fcfa pour s'approvisionner essentiellement en huile végétale, savons et conserves.
texts.en:
Ms. Antoinette P. was born on October 27, 1959 in Agoué in the southeast of Benin. She has been a widow for six years and has two orphans in her care. After two failed attempts at earning her high school diploma, she got started selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) with her mom. Today, besides distributing pagnes as she usually does, she markets various items, such as canned foods, pasta, peanut oil, and cassava flour out of a small shop in her home. Given the growth in her business, she is requesting this third loan of 160,000 francs CFA to acquire supplies essentially in vegetable oil, soap, and canned foods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 25 liters of oil, 4 boxes of soap, 2 boxes of milk, and 3 boxes of canned tomatoes

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo, tuvo 11 hijos, de los cuales viven con ella 5. Es agricultora desde su niñez, se levanta a las 4:00 am para que preparar el desayuno y del mismo modo el almuerzo, así dejarlo listo e irse a la chacra llevando el almuerzo para su esposo y quedarse allí trabajando. Esta actividad le es muy rentable, ya que todo el tiempo ha vivido de su siembra de diversos productos; pero en mayor cantidad de la papa, ahora tiene pensado de sembrar más y para ello necesita contar con insecticidas, que juntamente con la semilla se hecha al momento de sembrar, porque de no poner este, el gusano acabaría con la papa y no cosecharía nada. Juana ingresa por vez primera a MFP. Con el préstamo va comprar el insecticida llamado Temex para que pueda sembrar la papa en su chacra temporal.
texts.en:
Juana is 47 years old and lives with her husband. She had 11 children, five of whom live with her. Juana has been a farmer since childhood. She wakes up at 4:00am to prepare breakfast and lunch. She leaves for the fields and brings the lunch for her husband, staying with him to work. This activity is very profitable, and she's always planted a variety of products, including a large quantity of potatoes. Now she hopes to plant more, but she needs to depend on insecticides. If she doesn't use insecticides at the moment that she plants the seed, worms will kill the potatoes and nothing will grow. This is the first time that Juana has worked with MFP. With the loan she'll buy Temex brand insecticide so that she can plant potatoes in her seasonal field.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy insecticide for her fields.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es: La Sr. Maria tiene 25 años de edad, habitante de barrio Healeah, en la capital de Managua,  estado civil soltera, tiene un niño de 2 años de edad. Sus planes para con su familia es brindarle seguridad, protección Doña María se desempeña como vendedora de ropas, zapatos, cosméticos y platería desde hace cinco años vende,  inicio con bienes propios. Sus metas  en el aria del negocio es incrementar el volumen de venta y así a la misma vez aumentara sus utilidades. Gracias a los  préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción para construir un porche y así tener más espacio y seguridad para su familia
texts.en:
Maria is 25 years old and lives in Healeah neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. She is single and has a 2 year old son. Her plans are to provide security for her family, and she does this by selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics and silver. She has been selling for 5 years, and began with her own funds. Her goals for her business are to increase the volume of sales and at the same time increase her usefulness. Thanks to Afodenic’s loans she will be able to buy building materials to build a porch and subsequently have more space and security for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a porch

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị N., 22 tuổi ở Quảng Xương Thanh Hóa. Chị N. tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2008. Hiện tại nguồn thu nhập  của gia đình chủ yếu là tư chăn nuôi và làm máy súc với  thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000  để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và làm máy súc
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị N., 22 years old, lives in Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hóa province. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2008. Currently, the main sources of income for her family are raising animals and making excavating machines, with a total income of about 3,000,000 VND (175 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to invest in both raising animals and making excavators.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising animals

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es: Aidee tiene 36 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos de 10,7 y 6 años, posee su casa propia donde vive con su pareja desde hace 12 años. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y comida en un kiosco que tiene muy cerca de su casa, desde que comenzó a tratado siempre de mantenerlo surtido y de dar una buena atención a sus clientes. Empieza a trabajar a las 6 de la mañana con la venta de pan hasta las 9, luego inicia las preparaciones del menú que ofrecerá durante el medio día. A pesar que el lugar donde cocina es muy incómodo, Aidee continúa porque le gusta mucho su trabajo, termina de atender por la noche y si aun tiene clientes se queda hasta las 10 pm. Su anhelo es construir su casa en la  misma ubicación de su kiosco, porque es un lugar estratégico para la venta, porque circula mucha gente, de ese modo, ya no se quedarían despiertos sus hijos hasta muy tarde y estaría más cómoda en el momento de cocinar. Aidee es una socia muy activa en su banco comunal, el ciclo pasado tenía el cargo de fiscal, asegurándose que no existiera ninguna anomalía con los integrantes. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar su mercaderías para su kiosco, y ese modo captar  más ingresos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Aidee is 36 years old and mother of three children, aged 10, 7 and 6. She owns her own home, where she lives with her partner of 12 years. Aidee works selling groceries and food in a kiosk near her house, and she always tries to keep it well stocked and to provide good service to her clients. She begins work at 6 in the morning, selling bread until 9, when she begins to prepare the menu she will offer at lunchtime. Although the space in which she cooks is very uncomfortable, Aidee continues because she really enjoys her work. She serves clients into the night, even staying until 10 pm if customers continue coming. She would like to build her home in the same location as her kiosk, because it is a great location for sales, with many people passing by. This would mean her children wouldn't need to stay up late and she would be more comfortable while preparing food. Aidee is a very active member of her village bank, in the last cycle she was in charge of the fiscal department, ensuring there were no problems with members. This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and in this time she has shown that she is able to pay her quotas very responsibly. The money she is requesting is to increase the merchandise available in her kiosk, in order to earn more money for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing amount of merchandise

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es: la Joven Xiomara C. cuenta con una pequeña tienda de venta denominada VARIEDADES IVETH, tiene mas de 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y segun ella comenta le ha ido muy bien aunque en algunas veces ha tenido ciertas limitantes por falta de capital de trabajo, ya que a veces ella no puede invertir y tener un negocio en el que pueda tener mas productos y mayor variedad y asi poder vender un poco mas, ella necesita el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio, ella vive con sus padres a los cuales les ayuda monetariamente para salir adelante con su hogar.
texts.en:
Miss Xiomara C. has a small shop called VARIEDADES IVETH, which has been in business for 3 years. She states that her business has been prosperous. However, at times, she has experienced certain limitations due to a lack of business capital when she cannot invest in her business and offer a variety of products. She needs this loan in order to re-stock her business more inventory. She lives with her parents, whom she helps financially so that the entire household can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lotion, facial cream, shampoo, hair gel, poweder, medicine and nail polish

loans.name: Léma Yérima

texts.fr:
Cette dame est une résidente du quartier de hedzranawoé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé, elle est mariée à un monsieur qui fait la mécanique automobile, elle a eu 02 enfants.
Yoyo léma exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de produits d’alimentation générale, elle a associée à cette activité la vente de cartes de recharges. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 1996 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé.  Elle désire agrandir son activité pour mieux faire face à la clientèle, raison pour laquelle elle demande à WAGES son premier prêt pour acheter 02 cartons d’huile, 01 bidons d’huile, 02 sacs de riz et divers produits.
texts.en:
Léma Yoyo is a resident of the Hedzranawoé neighborhood on the outskirts of Lomé. She is married to a car mechanic and has two children. To generate income, Mrs.Yoyo runs a business selling general foodstuffs. She has added to this the sale of rechargeable cell phone cards. She began the business in 1996 and buys her supplies from the main market in Lomé. She wants to grow the business in order to be of better service to her customers, hence the reason she is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy two boxes of oil, one drum of oil, two bags of rice and miscellaneous items.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general foodstuffs

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mrs. Channa T., 56, is a widow with six children: three sons and three daughters. One of her sons is a motor taxi driver while another works in a Phnom Penh restaurant, and the third one is in school. She lives along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Having learned the skill from her parents, Channa has been a farmer for 15 years.  She is now requesting a loan of $300 to build a shelter for her daughter to continue her business of selling grocery items, sugar cane juice and soft drinks.

loans.use: To build a shelter for her daughter to sell sugar cane juice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Shanna

texts.en: Shanna A. F., 21, is married and has 1 child.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village community & to the general public 3 days per week. She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Samoan Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Shanna’s only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase gramoxones, pesticides, a wheelbarrow and weed killer for farming.

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es: La Señora. Maria C. tiene 54 años de edad, habitante de barrio Walter Ferreti en la capital de Managua, su esposo se desempeña como supervisor de la Alcaldía, tiene tres hijos dos los tiene estudiando y la mayor es independiente. Como madre su objetivo es que sus hijos mejoren su nivel de vida y seguirle apoyándolos. Doña Maria C. tiene su propio negocio ella comercializa productos naturales y lotería ambulantemente  desde hace catorce años vende los trocito de lotería y 3 años vendiendo productos omnilife. Iniciándolo con fondos propios, siendo una mujer trabajadora  y capaz de cumplir sus metas y objetivos ha salido delante de toda dificultad que se le ha presentado. Gracias a los prestamos en Afodenic a logrado aumentar las cantidades de productos. Con este siguiente préstamo quiere seguir fomentando el desarrollo de su negocio con las comprar de: nutricionales de aloe, ego 10  y otros productos. Los cuales generan mayores utilidades y beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria C. is 54 years old and lives in the Walter Ferreti neighbourhood in Managua. Her husband works as a city supervisor. She has two children who attend school and one who is grown-up. As a mother, she strives to support her children and improve their quality of life.
Maria C. runs her own business selling natural products and lottery tickets as a street vendor. She has sold lottery tickets for 14 years and Omnilife products for 3. She set up the business with her own funds and has overcome all obstacles through hard work and her ability to accomplish her goals.
Thanks to the loans she received through Afodenic, she has increased her product quantities. She would like to continue to expand her business by purchasing aloe-based supplements, Ego 10 (an energy drink) and other products. These will generate better profits that will benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Omnilife products

loans.name: Hila

texts.en:
Hila R. selling beer in her bar and is requesting a loan to purchase more crates of beer to sell. Hila is 40 years old and married to a peasant husband. They have two children who go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and pay school fees for her children.

---------------------------------------- BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more beer to sell.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La señora Cirila  G. vive en una casa prestada junto con su esposo y su hijo.
Como desea tener su propia vivienda es por eso que está tramitando una casa por medio de Infonavit (Crédito Gubernamental), pero el valor de la vivienda es superior al crédito que ella pueda recibir ya que su sueldo es bajo.
   Ella trabaja como empleada en una fábrica y su esposo el señor Benigno Salvador, como ayudante de construcción estos son los Ingres de la familia. Por tal motivo está solicitando un préstamo para completar el crédito Gubernamental ya así adquirir su casa. Ya que desea tener un patrimonio seguro para su familia.
(La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposo el  señor Benigno Salvador ya que la señora Cirila G. se encontraba en su trabajo)
texts.en:
Ms. Cirila G., her husband, and son live in a rented house. Because she wishes to have her own house, she is in the process of obtaining one through Infonavit (a federal housing loan program in Mexico). However, the value of the house supersedes the amount of the loan that she qualifies for because of her low income status.

She works in a factory, and her husband, Mr. Benigno Salvador, is a construction assistant; these are the family’s two sources of income. For this reason, she is requesting this loan so that she can cover what the government loan will not, thus she can purchase the house. She would like to have a house to leave as an inheritance for her family.

(The person appearing in the photo is her husband, Mr. Benigno Salvador, because Ms. Cirila G. was working at the time the photo was taken).

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Give the remainder of the house down payment not covered by a government loan

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria sells loaves of bread in wholesale and retail. She also sells household items. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell.

Victoria is 30 years old and married with two children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a member of the Madizini borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is 25 years old and married. She cares for two dependents. 

Veronica started her own cafe business selling food a year ago. She works 11 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings (about $150).

This is Veronica’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Veronica hopes to save money, to get more food for her family and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Mayra

texts.en:
Mayra and her husband run a small welding and metalwork shop. She is 43 years old, married with three children. She used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to purchase materials for her metalwork shop. Mayra will use this loan of 3000 soles to buy iron sheets and to fix up part of the shop.

Mayra has been working with Kiva's partner, Manuela Ramos, for five years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners). She is pleased to be able to support her family’s business and contribute to her household’s income with the help of loans from Manuela Ramos. She is grateful for the organization’s confidence in her and in her business venture. Mayra’s goals are to expand the metalwork shop and to finish building a home for her family.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets and to repair a welding/metalwork shop

loans.name: Juana De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Juana de los Ángeles M. A. es originaria de Jinotega, pero reside en Ticuantepe, municipio de Managua, a sus 40 años de edad se desempeña como ejecutiva de ventas de una casa comercial donde venden electrodomésticos.

Pero Juana nos dice que dado la situación y el hecho de que es una madre soltera, ha tenido que buscar otros medio para tener un mejor nivel de vida. Es por eso que aun que trabaja en un lugar fijo, ella conserva su negocio de venta de útiles de cocina como lo son Cucharas, cuchillos, tenedores, platos, entre otros.

Ella ha trabajado en la venta de este tipo de productos “Desde chavala”, nos dice Juana. Desde que inicio sus créditos en ADIM ha mantenido firme ese negocio, actualmente quiere expandir su clientela con la ayuda de su hija de 22 años, quien le ayudara a colocar todo los productos. “Dos vendedoras son mejor que una”  dice Juana.
texts.en:
Juana de los Ángeles M. A. comes from Jinotega but now lives in Ticuantepe, in the municipality of Managua. She is 40 years old and works as a sales executive at a business that sells electrical appliances. Juana tells us, however, that given the economic situation and the fact that she is a single mother, she has had to look for other ways to improve her standard of living. That is the reason why despite having a permanent job, she has also maintained her business of selling kitchen utensils such as spoons, knives, forks, plates, etc. Juana has worked selling this type of product “Since I was a girl,” she tells us. Since she started receiving loans from Kiva partner ADIM she has kept her business steady, and now wants to expand her clientele. She wants to do this with the help of her 22-year-old daughter, who will help her sell all of her products. “Two saleswomen are better than one,” Juana says.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing more products so she can expand her clientele

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés vive con su esposa e hijos, la esposa le colabora en los gastos de la casa ya que tiene una fotocopiadora. Viven en la casa de sus suegros, anteriormente era empleado de una empresa, en la actualidad tiene su propio vehículo con el que trabaja en servicio de taxi. La competencia es media ya que existe mucha demanda por el servicio. El crédito para el que saco fue destinado al mantenimiento del vehículo, cambio de llantas y algunos arreglos más. En los créditos obtenidos de Agrocapital tuvo buen comportamiento de pagos. Es su cuarta secuencia. Los anteriores créditos los cancelo con normalidad, cabe mencionar que el Moisés tuvo algunos días de retraso. Sin embargo todos se cancelaron con normalidad.
texts.en:
Moises lives with his wife and children; his wife helps with household expenses as she has a photocopy machine. They live in their in-laws house. Previously, he was employed by a company, but currently he has his own vehicle that he uses to offer taxi services. Competition is average given that there exists a high demand for the service. The loan that he requested will be invested in the maintenance of the vehicle, to change the tires, and to carry out other additional repairs. In his previous loans from Agrocapital he behaved well and made his payments accordingly. This is his fourth loan. His previously loans were paid as planned, but it is worth to mention that Moises was delayed some days in his payments. Nevertheless, they were paid as planned.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Estali

texts.es: La señora Estali, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Cucardas II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y 05 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.Estali, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, se inicio vendiendo cosméticos de diferentes líneas como: Esika, CyZone y Avon, negocio con el que en la actualidad continua. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.Estali, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Estali is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Cucardas II”, which is located in the District of La Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín Province, Deparment of San Martín. She is 48 years old, married, and has 5 children of whom 2 are still dependents. Estali is a woman who has overcome many difficulties in her life and her desire to get ahead has led to some success. Today she is satisfied with that she has achieved through her business.

Estali sells different brands of cosmetics such as Esika, CyZone, and Avon. With this loan of 1500 soles, she will purchase beauty products to add to her inventory such as perfumes for women and men, crèmes, pressed powders, lipsticks, and nail polishes. She also plans to buy a display case for exhibiting her products.

Because of her maturity, Estali is an example for other women to follow on how to start a business and persevere in the pursuit of one’s dreams. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & a display case

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen is 23 years old and married with four children. She sells shoes and clothes to make a living.

Sales during this season are very high and she hopes to meet the requirements of her customers during this high season. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more shoes and clothes to sell. She really appreciates all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Friendly and happy, Charity, a 37-year-old married mother of seven children, sells clothes of various colors and baby things.  She is determined to lift her business and family above poverty, but the foremost challenge she faces is losing customers to competitors because she cannot meet demand. Charity has been in this business for a long time and hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more clothes and baby things to sell.  She says thanks to all who make the loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and baby things to sell

loans.name: Cristoto

texts.en:
Cristoto S. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. Cristoto is 43 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. Cristoto buys and sells gold dust from the local mines. Cristoto has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Cristoto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristoto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Cristoto is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase more gold dust to expand his business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Cristoto from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase gold dust to expand his business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food to sell in her genge (food stall)

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca A. sells hardware and building materials, such as cement, at Teterem, near Elmina.  Rebecca has completed junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader. Rebecca has been selling hardware since 2006. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy building materials to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy building materials to sell.

loans.name: Marta Beatriz

texts.es: Marta Beatriz M. M. de 44 años de edad, reside en Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo y su hijo. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos en su casa. Este negocio ha sido de mucha ayuda de manera económica para ella y su familia, es por ello que Marta desea poder invertir más en el, ya que lo considera como un negocio rentable. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más productos como verduras, pañales desechables para bebé, comida enlatada y otras cosas más las cuales le permitan poder brindarles mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes y de esta manera ser la tienda más fuerte del lugar, la cual le genere mayores ganancias. Todo esto lo hace Marta con el fin de brindarle todo lo necesario a su hijo el cual es su mayor incentivo para ser mejor en la vida y mejorar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Marta Beatriz is 44 years old and resides in Colón, La Libertad Department. Her family includes her husband and her child. She operates a store selling perishable products from her home.

The business has been of much economic help for her and her family. For that reason, Marta wishes to increase her investment, as she considers it a profitable business.

Marta is soliciting a loan that will enable her to buy more products, including green vegetables, disposable diapers for babies, canned goods, and other things that will allow her to offer a greater quantity of products to her customers. In this manner, her store can become the strongest in that locality, generating the most earnings.

All this Marta does with the goal of offering all that's necessary to her child – a major incentive to do better in life and improve her work.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A GREATER VARIETY OF MERCHANDISE FOR HER STORE

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza T. is from the village of Dullan. She is 42 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Flordeliza owns and operates a fruit and vegetable stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fruit and vegetables in the local community. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2005, Flordeliza joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her tenth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Inés Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Inés M. G. una señora de 52 años de edad, emprendedora de un negocio de venta de comida el cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$10,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 12 años. Este negocio está ubicado en el mercado Israel lewite contiguo al centro cívico de Managua. 

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de  productos para la elaboración de comida y remodelación del negocio.
Ella ha trabajado con ceprodel desde el año 2005 en ese periodo de tiempo lleva 12 financiamiento  por parte de ceprodel los cuales ha invertido en su negocio.

Ella es casada y madre  de 4 hijos a su cargo y dos de ellos  están en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella laboraba  Vendiendo ambulante buñuelos y pasteles.

Lleva 12 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 5 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando su mercadería, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Sra. Inés M. G. is 52 years old and started her food sales business with initial startup capital of 10,000 NIO. Subsequently she took out loans for the next twelve years. Her business is located at the Israel Lewite Market, which is adjacent to the Managua Civic Center.

The loan Inés is requesting will be used as operating capital for her business. She plans to buy products used in food preparation and will use part of the proceeds to remodel her business. Inés has been working with CEPRODEL since 2005. During this period, she has taken out twelve loans with CEPRODEL to invest into her business.

Inés is married and the mother of four dependent children, two of whom are in school. Prior to having this business, she worked as a traveling merchant selling donuts and pastries. It has taken twelve loans from CEPRODEL over a five year period to grow her business and diversify her merchandise. She thanks CEPRODEL for providing this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & remodel her business

loans.name: Monica Birungi ‘S Group

texts.en:
Monica is 40 years old and married, with eight children aged between 5 and 18 years. All her children go to school. The family resides in and rents a three-room house where she stays with six people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water at home, and eats three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include: paying utility bills, school fees for the children, medication and feeding the family, and rent for her business and residence.

Monica operates and owns a food stall in Nakulabye market of the city suburbs. She sells all types of food available at the market and vegetables. On average of she receives 20 customers a day. She has done this business for over five years. She incurs transport costs buying food stuffs from the village of Kiboga, about 55 miles from Kampala.

Her main challenges are seasonality and the ever increasing prices of food stuffs. She sells on a retail basis only and has been with MCDT for over seven years servicing her fourteenth loan, working all this long with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas, sacks of cassava, sweet potatoes and cabbages. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to sell wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs like bananas, sweet poatatoes and cassava

loans.name: Amangul's Group

texts.ru:
Все члены группы из села Кочкорка. Это село на ходитс я в Кочкорской долине, небольшой высокогорной долине, где зимы порой очень суровые и почти круглый год стоит ветреная погода. Жители этого региона в основном занимаются скотоводством. Амангул Калмамбетова – лидер данной группы. Амангул сорок шесть лет. Её муж – член фермерского хозяйства. Амангул с мужем воспитывают семерых детей: шесть дочерей и одного сына. Старшие две дочери уже замужем. Третья дочь работает официанткой в Бишкеке. Две следующие учатся в соответственно десятом и одиннадцатом классах. Самая младшая дочь также уже ходит в школу. Она учится во втором классе, а сын пока дома. Он ещё не достиг школьного возраста. Содержать такую семью было очень нелегко и муж Амангул все предыдущие годы не жалел собственных сил, чтобы в семье был достаток. Пять лет назад, Амангул решила помочь мужу и учитывая то, положение, в котором она находилась, нашла самое оптимальное решение. Она решила заняться шитьём национальных изделий. Тем более, что дочки к тому времени уже подросли и вполне могли помогать своей матери. Амангул вложила в покупку материалов и принадлежностей три тысячи сомов и начала шить изделия. Её прибыль постепенно росла и теперь, по истечении пяти лет, она составляет шесть тысяч сомов. За это время они выдали дочерей замуж и построили дом. Амангул с большим энтузиазмом смотрит в будущее, так как видит большие перспективы в своём деле. Сейчас она нуждается в кредите, который позволил бы ей купить сырьё для изготовления ватных одеял “жууркан”, а именно двенадцать метров атласа и двенадцать метров сатина. В ближайшем будущем она планирует выдать среднюю дочь заму, приготовить приданое двум другим дочерям и расширять производство посредством вовлечения новых работников.  

У Амангул три партнёра:

Дуйшееву Акылу сорок пять лет. Акыл – отец пятерых детей. Супруга Акыла – домохозяйка, которая активно помогает ему в бизнесе. А сам Акыл изготавливает “ширдаки” – шерстяные паласы. Ему нужен кредит чтобы купить материалы для шитья.

Шарыпжанову Тилекмату пятьдесят один год. Он фермер. У Тилекмата трое сыновей и младший сын помогает ухаживать за скотом. Тилекмату нужен кредит, чтобы купить пять овец. 

Абдыкасымовой Кыял тридцать один год. Муж занимается скотоводством. У Кыял двое детей. Сама изготавливает национальные шерстяные ковры и приданое для девушек. Кыял нужен кредит, чтобы купить материалы.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
All of the members of this group are from the Kochkor village. This village is located in the Kochkor valley, which is small valley high up in the mountains, where the winters are at times very severe, and the weather is windy almost all-year-around. The citizens of this region are mainly involved in animal husbandry. Amangul K. is the leader of this group. She is forty-six years old. Her husband is a member of a farm collective. Amangul and her husband are raising seven children: six daughters and one son. Two oldest daughters are already married. Third daughter works as a waitress in Bishkek. Two next ones attend tenth and eleventh grades respectively. The youngest daughter also goes to school. She is in the second grade, and the son is at home for now. He is not of school age yet. It was not easy to support a family like this one, and Amangul’s husband has put all his strengths for years to provide for the family. Amangul decided to help her husband five years ago, and, taking her condition into the consideration, she found the most optimal solution. She decided to start sewing traditional goods. Also, the daughters have grown up by that time and could help their mother. Amangul invested three thousand som into the purchase of fabrics and supplies and began sewing the goods. Her profit gradually rose, and now, after five years, it is now six thousand som. Amangul and her husband married off their daughters and built a house during that time. Amangul looks to the future with much enthusiasm because she sees big opportunities in her business. She now needs a loan in order to purchase materials for making comforters “juurkan.” She needs twelve meters of atlas and twelve meters of satin fabrics. In the near future, Amangul plans to marry off her middle daughter, prepare dowries for two other daughters and expand the business by hiring new workers. Amangul has three partners: Asyl Duysheeva is forty-five years old. She is a mother of five children. Her husband is a member of a farm collective. Asyl makes “shirdaki,” which are wool rugs. She needs a loan in order to purchase materials for sewing. Tilekmat Sharypjanov is fifty-one years old. He is a farmer. He has three sons, and the youngest son helps him take care of livestock. Tilekmat needs a loan to buy five sheep. Kyyal A. is thirty-one years old. Her husband is involved in animal husbandry. Kyyal has two children. She makes traditional wool rugs and dowries for young women. Kyyal needs a loan to purchase materials.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies (12 meters of satin) to make quilts

loans.name: Ester's Group

texts.en:
Ester C. is from the town of Pagrang-Ayan Ramon. She is thirty-eight years old. Ester is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ester C.'s group.

Ester is married. To make a living, Ester owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and for sale. Ester has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ester joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. She used the previous loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Ester is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Ester's second loan taken from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: LA SEÑORA FLORA ES UNA DE NUESTRAS CLIENTES MAS ANTIGUA DE LA INSTITUCION,  ESTA EN LA INSITUCION DESDE EL AÑO 2003, ES UNA CLIENTE CON BUENA ACTITUD, RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE POLLERAS Y MANTAS DE SEÑORA DE POLLERA (LA VESTIMENTA DE LA SEÑORA DE POLLERA EN LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ ES MUY PARTICULAR, ELLAS LLEVAN UNA FALDA GRUESA Y ADENTRO UNA POLLERA DELGADA QUE LA DENOMINAN ENAGUA, EN LA PARTE SUPERIOR LLEVAN LA MANTA CONFECCIONADA CON TELA DE SEDA) , ELLA VENDE EN LAS DIFERENTES FERIAS DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO ENTRE ELLAS LA FERIA DE BATALLAS Y ACHACACHI ESTAS FERIAS ESTAN ALEJADAS DE LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, ELLA HACE UN GRAN ESFUERZO AL LLEVAR MERCADERIA A LOS DIFERENTES PUEBLOS DE LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, ELLA TIENE DOS HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, SU EPOSO ES CHOFER Y TRABAJA TODOS LOS DIAS PARA LA MANTENER SU HOGAR, EL CREDITO SERA INVERTIDO EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Flora is one of this institution's most long-standing members; she has been working with this institution since the year 2003. She is a woman who has a good attitude, and is responsible and hardworking. She has a business selling polleras (traditional skirts) and shawls in the style of "Señora de Pollera" (The traditional "Señora de Pollera" outfit in the city of La Paz is very particular: they wear a thick skirt and then inside a petticoat called an "enagua", and on the top they wear a shawl made of silk fabric.) She sells these items in different markets in the city of El Alto, including the markets of Batallas and Achachi. These markets are on the outskirts of the city of La Paz. She makes a great effort to take her merchandise to the different parts of the city of La Paz. She has 2 children who are school-aged, and her husband is a driver who works every day to support the household. This loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided in the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise (traditional Bolivian clothing)

loans.name: Shiilegsuren

texts.en: Shiilegsuren is 29 years old and lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a ger. Her 8-year-old son, Usuhkbayar, attends a local secondary school. Currently, Shiilegsuren operates a meat-trading business with her husband at Narantuul, the most popular food market in Mongolia. She has been operating this business since 2003 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (approximately 360 USD) and has expanded her business with a loyal customer base. Recently, in 2009, Shiilegsuren and her husband purchased their own plot of land and a car. They have been planning to build a house with a yard on their own land. Shiilegsuren is a very hardworking person. She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital. About Credit Mongol: Credit Mongol’s mission is to contribute to the prosperity of Mongols by providing diversified financial services to micro-loan and small and medium enterprise (SME) clients and to become the best-performing company in micro-loan and SME financing in Mongolia.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Carmelita's Group

texts.en:
Carmelita D. is from the town of Sto. Niño San Agustin. She is 59 years old. Carmelita is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Carmelita D. Group.

Carmelita is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.
