In 2009, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Carmelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita A. is from the village of Linao East, Tuguegarao City. She is 50 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Teresita owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP when she sells her raised animal. In 2005, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her eighth from ASKI. Teresita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Ouch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. TO. O. is the village bank president selected by the fifteen people who make up a group loan in Chheu Teal village in Takeo province. All members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. TO. O. is 39 years old. She works at home as a weaver to earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. Mrs. TO. O. is applying for a loan to buy more silk. Her husband, Mr. Sokha Gnan, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to sell to support his family. The couple supports three children: one is a weaver while the others are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Acquire cattle for meat and milk production

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan T., 48, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. T. and her husband sell food for an income of USD 8 per day. T. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more food for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Sop

texts.en: Mrs. Sop S., age 58, sells both used and new clothes at the local busy market. From this, she is able to earn $5 a day to support her family. She doesn’t have a life partner as her husband divorced her when her child was very small. Now her child is grown and can support the family by selling a few groceries. Recently, Sop S. sold nearly all of her clothes to her buyers and she wants to replenish her stock but she lacks capital. She is, therefore, asking for a loan in order to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: José Patrocinio

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 23 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su menor hijo en el sector Yencala – Garbanzal, una zonarural y agrícola del distrito de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace mas de tres años, el suele criar aves de corral y ganado ovino en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, cuando estos han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente complementa sus ingresos trabajando como obrero agrícola en los campos de cultivo cercanos.

José desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la crianza de sus animales y lograr que se desarrollen de mejor manera, de este modo planea obtener mayores ingresos al momento de venderlos, para realizar su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

José es una persona que brinda todo su esfuerzo en las actividades que realiza, de modo que pueda sacar a su familia adelante, el ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José is a 23-year-old father who lives with his wife and his young son in the area of Yencala-Garbanzaol. It is a rural and agricultural area in the district of Lambayeque, which is located in the province of Lambayeque, 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has made a living by raising and selling animals for more than 3 years. He tends to raise poultry and sheep en some corrals near his home. When these have reached a good level of development, he sells them to his neighbors and to businesspeople that always come to the area where he lives. He also complements his income by working as an agricultural worker in the nearby fields. José hopes to acquire nutritionally-balanced feed to improve his animals so they will develop better. In this way, he plans to make better income when it comes time to sell them. To reach his goal, he saw the need to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 PEN. José is a person who puts all of his effort into the work that he does. In this way, he can take good care of his family. He has previously worked with our institution, and he has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase nutritionally-balanced feed for his small animals that he sells

loans.name: Aom's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is located Andoung Kien village in Takeo province. It has four members who have selected Mrs. Aom Y. who was born in 1957 as the group leader. All the members will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their businesses in this current year.

Mrs. Aom Y. is a juice seller in the local village where she is able to earn a large profit to support her family while her husband, Mr. Soeng Ban, is a recyclables seller. Since her husband’s business is going well, she wants to expand it. So Mrs. Aom Y. is seeking a loan to buy more recyclables; with the rest of the loan she will buy more juice. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a chef while the other is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy more recyclables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old married man and the father of three school-age children. Over the years, he has proven to be a successful entrepreneur with his printing and photocopy shop. He has owned and run this shop for more than 15 years.  He is requesting a loan of $1,200 from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to perform maintenance on his printings machines. The new modifications will allow him to significantly increase his productivity and his income by taking on more printing jobs.  He is positive about his business prospects and plans to further expand his business. He is hoping to open a new branch of his shop in the coming year.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his printings machines

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia T. is from the village of San Jose. She is 42 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 50,000 PHP per cropping.
In 2006, Lydia joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 37,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her tenth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mariana Aurora Filipe

texts.pt:
Mariana Aurora C. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada e mãe de 4 filhos de idades entre 6 a 16 e todos vão a Escola. Fez 9ª classe parou devido a vários motivos, desde já decidiu regressar a escola. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu cunhado que vive com eles.

Nunca saiu da sua cidade natal, tem um negocio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade no quintal da sua casa. Desenvolve esta atividade ha mais de 3 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria e Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa) mensal.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas clientes da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, açúcar, batata, caldo, feijão e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para construir uma banca de material convencional ainda em sua casa.
texts.en:
Mariana Aurora C. was born in Maputo, Southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of four children ages 6 to 16, all enrolled in school. For various reasons, her own studies were interrupted in the 9th Grade, but she recently decided to go back to school. She lives with her husband and children in a house they own, and helps support a bother-in-law who lives with them.

She's never left her hometown, where for the past three years she has been running a small home-based business selling food staples. She works by herself and makes an average of 5.000.00mt per month, which she uses to pay for household expenses. Her monthly earnings also allow her to regularly save some money in the bank and through a traditional rotational savings system.

She has never had loans from other banks or institutions before, and learned about Hluvuku from friends who are clients of the instituition. This is her first loan with Hluvuku/Kiva, and she plans to use the money to purchase more products to sell (rice, sugar, potato, beans, etc).

She's confident in her ability to pay back this loan ahead of schedule, and plans to apply for a new loan to build a better/more conventional space for her store.

loans.use: to buy more food staples to sell at her home-based store (rice, sugar, potato, beans, etc)

loans.name: Reteti Ole

texts.en:
Reteti Ole K. is 24 years old, married to Hellen Ikayo and the father of three children who attend school. Reteti is a businessman who buys and sells livestock. He has been doing this kind of business for the past four years. 
  
He learned about KADET from a neighbor who was already a KADET client. This will be Reteti’s second loan. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to purchase livestock and expand his shed to improve his business. Reteti plans to purchase a plot of land for his family with the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan. 

Reteti is a hardworking man and will do well with the right resources. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer in the livestock selling business.

loans.use: to buy livestock and expand livestock shed

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Chhuon P. is a woman who works very hard every day to get ahead. She has good skills to use an injection machine for illness in the village, and earns an income of approximately US$2.50 per day. Chhuon P. is 69 years old and lives in the Province of Kompong Tom. Chhuon P. was married, but her husband died several years ago. She has two children, and both of them are married. One of her children is a seller in the busy market, and she sells some items such as cooking ingredients, fast food, and plastic products. Chhuon P.’s daughter is going well, and she wishes to expand her business for extra profit. To support her child’s business, Chhuon P. is applying for a loan for her daughter to use to purchase a larger number of items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a larger number of items to sell.

loans.name: Teresa De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Teresa de 27 años de edad es soltera, tiene un bebe de 6 meses de edad, labora como empledada domestica desde hace 5 años, ademas vende productos AVON, ZERMAT y otras cositas que sus clientes le encargan.

Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa, pues quiere reparar el techo de su cuarto que se encuentra en mal estado. 

El mayor sueño de Teresa es poder tener su casita con las condiciones basicas para su bebecito, pues es su razon de ser.
texts.en:
Teresa is 27 years old.  She is single and has a 6 month-old baby.  She has worked as a cleaner for 5 years and she also sells Avon and Zermat products and other things that her customers request.

She is requesting her second loan in order to improve her house because she would like to fix the roof of her room which is in a bad state.

Teresa's biggest dream is to have her house in the basic conditions necessary for her baby since he is her raison d'être.

loans.use: To repair the roof of her room

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; ella tiene 62 años D. edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes donD. la socia venD. productos D. primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche entre otros productos más, a la vez la socia venD. anticuchos por la noche en su mismo negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación D. su negocio y para la compra D. insumos como carne, papa, entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to the Virgen del Rosario Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province and Cusco department.

Alejandrina is 62 years old, married, and she has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business.  She sells basic needs products like rice, sugar, milk, and more products.  In the evenings she also sells “anticuchos” (a Peruvian dish consisting of meat that is marinated in a dressing maD. of aji peppers, skewered on sticks or metal rods, and cooked on a grill) in her store. 

She is requesting the loan to stock her business and to buy ingredients like meat, potatoes, and others.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To stock her business and to buy ingredients like meat, potatoes, and others

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 23 years old and he is still single. He is known in the business of selling tea in a restaurant and this is his nineteenth successful year in this business. The hours of his business are from 5.30am until 10pm every day.

Theoneste has now requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more stock for his small restaurant. With this additional business, Theoneste will hopefully earn more profits than his previous business. With these profits, one portion will be used to build a secure future for his family, as he is in the process of getting engaged to be married. The other portion of his profits will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for expand  his small restaurant

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 63-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a small sugarcane plantation and a pig fattening business. She lives in Pamplona in the province of Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007, and she has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard on her small sugarcane plantation and in her pig fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 7200 PHP.

Lourdes is borrowing 25,000 PHP in order to fund her business operations. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lourdes aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than 1 USD a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 51 years old and widowed with three children. In the past twenty years, Charlotte has been selling clothes to earn a living. She also owns rental houses. In addition, she does tailoring so as to earn extra income. She was previously running a retail shop for a living. Charlotte is a focused lady who hopes to open a boutique in the future. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, Charlotte has benefited because she saves her money on a weekly basis. She can also access loans easily. Hence, she has requested for 60,000 KES to buy more clothes and fabric.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and fabric

loans.name: Husain

texts.en:
Husain is a 54-year-old father of four daughters and two sons. He is a carpenter. Husain produces furniture in his workshop as well as doors and windows. Husain's oldest son is a Palestinian National Authority employee. 

Husain took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a faster machine for cutting wood as well as a large amount of wood to produce more furniture and increase his profit.

Husain appears in the picture above in FATEN's branch in Jenin.

loans.use: To purchase wood and a wood cutting machine for the workshop

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
el señor Dolores A. R. tiene 56 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Maria Azucena Rivas quien se dedica a cuidar la casa, no tienen dependientes, sus hijos ya estan casados el señor R. tiene casa propia y cuartos en alquiler, pero su principal trabajo es el negocio del transporte. tiene un taxi.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de 4 llantas para su taxi y tambien desea cambiar algunos repuestos de motor que estan malos del vehiculo.
hace 6 meses su taxi lo llevo al taller, lo reparo y ademas lo pinto, esta vez quiere cambiarle las llantas que estan gastadas.
el señor R. es una persona muy responsable y con muchos deseos de salir adelante.
nos comento que de aqui en adelante desea vivir tranquilo con su esposa.
texts.en:
Mr. Dolores A. R. is 56, married to Maria Azucena Rivas, a housewife.  Their children are married and no longer live with them.  Mr. R. has his own house and rooms that he rents, but his main work is driving his taxi.  He will use the loan to buy 4 tires for his taxi and he also wants to change some parts in the engine that are bad for the vehicle.
Six months ago he took the taxi to the shop where they repaired and painted it.  This time he wants to change the tires that are worn.
Mr. R. is a responsible person with a great wish to get ahead.  He told us that that from now on, he wants to live peacefully with his wife.

loans.use: To buy parts for the engine and new tires

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma L. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Gemma is separated from her spouse and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Gemma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo K. is a 37-year-old village woman who has had a job as a rice farmer since she was single. In addition, she currently sells fresh fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier and other local fishermen. She runs her business in the market and is earning approximately $2 a day. 

Her husband is a primary teacher. The humble couple has three children who are attending school. 

Keo K. says that she wants to buy a second-hand motorcycle in order to pick up her fresh fish to sell, but her cash on hand is insufficient to buy one. So Keo K. would like to ask for a loan from Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle for picking up her fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for picking up her fish to sell

loans.name: Belkis

texts.en:
Belkis is one of our associates from the Hato Mayor branch, a rural town whose economy depends on agriculture. She is a merchant, selling shoes, jeans and blouses. She sells her products by walking around her community. She lives with her long-term partner and their three children. Belkis tells us that, for her, the most difficult thing is to build a house.
Belkis is very excited to be receiving her eighth loan from Kiva partner, Esperanza International. She has been working at her business for about four years, and it started thanks to her first loan with Esperanza. Belkis is very thankful to have received this loan from Esperanza because she will improve her business. She plans to save the profit to build her house and to reinvest in her business after God blesses her savings. Thank you for supporting this loan!

loans.use: to buy shoes, jeans and blouses.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, aged 37, is a divorced father with one child. He is responsible for his child's upkeep. He owns rental houses and has been in that business for 11 years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use the entire loan to purchase concrete, cement and sand for construction.


He expects to build two more units from the profits anticipated in his business and hopes to have more rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase concrete, cement and sand

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas de Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo en edad escolar.  La señora cuenta con estudios secundarios.
Susana es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora  al Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  solicitará un préstamo por la suma de  S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados vacunos,  ovinos y porcinos.

Con este dinero, más el capital con el que dispone, comprará una vaca.  Ella trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar el ganado y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Susana is a member of the Communal Bank “Hermanas de Choquetanca II” which is located in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 31 years old, married, and has a son who is in school. Sra. Susana has a high school education.

She is a new member who recently joined Manuela Ramos. Susana is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 PEN and will invest the money in her business. She buys and sells cows, sheep, and pigs.

With this money, she will have more capital to buy a cow. She and her husband work together. Her dream is to have more capital so that she can improve her livestock and generate more income. What she enjoys about the Communal Bank is the convenience of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: El Revalse Group

texts.en:
Naun Edgardo, Delmy Rosely, and Mary Isabel, all residents of San Lorenzo, Honduras, formed the “El Revalse” solidarity group in June 2011. Collectively they will serve as guarantors of one another’s loans.

Naun Edgardo has operated a small convenience shop for many years and is requesting a loan of Lps. 8,000 to purchase merchandise for the store. Delmy Rosely and Mary Isabel both sell refreshments, candy, and basic food items out of their homes and are requesting loans of Lps. 6,000 and 5,000 respectively to purchase merchandise for their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, meats, cheeses, refreshments, snacks, candy, personal hygiene products, and household cleaning products.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is made up of five borrowers, who are shown in the picture. The group leader, Mrs. Ry, is a 69-year-old widow who owns a small shop in front of her house where she sells soft drinks and Khmer noodles. She typically makes around $4 of profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. Mrs. Ry has two children; one is still studying in school and one sells Khmer noodles. Because their house has become old and broken, Mrs. Ry would like a loan in order to repair her house.

The other four borrowers are:
Mrs. Sok, who is asking for a loan to buy some poles to repair her house.
Mrs. Lang, a fisherman, who is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase fishing tools. 
Mrs. Sourn, a boat deliverer, who is applying for a loan to repair her old boat.
Mrs. Vuth, who is seeking a loan to purchase more merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: Carlos Arturo tiene 43 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de transporte. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este negocio, Carlos tiene un hijo a su cargo pues siempre se ha empeñado en sacar adelante a su familia por medio de su trabajo. El crédito que solicito fue para la compra llantas, repuestos, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Carlos Arturo is 43 years old. His business is offering transportation services. He has been at this business for more than 20 years. 

Carlos has one child under his care and has always made an effort to help his family get ahead through his work. 

The loan he is requesting is for the purchase of tires and spare parts among other things.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts among other things.

loans.name: Dullateb

texts.en:
Dullateb (pictured in front of his wife’s grocery store) is 25 years old. His wife, Manrofiyah. is 25 years old. They have been married since 2008 and have two young children: one son and one daughter. They live along National Road Number 6, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Dullateb sells cows and oxen, while his wife runs a grocery store at home. He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase cattle and oxen for sale.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and oxen for sale

loans.name: Khanh's Group

texts.en:
Khanh was born in 1957. She lives in Thai Binh village, Mai Lam commune. She has three children. Her husband has died. 

Khanh grows rice and also raises chickens. She has about 300 chickens. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

She has participated in SEDA since 2010. She has borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. She now would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy food for her chickens. She is the leader of a five-member loan group.
 
About the borrowers in her group:
 Vui is 39 years old. She has two children and wants to borrow 7.194.000 VND to invest in her livestock.
 Yen is 51 years old. She has two children and wants to borrow 7.194.000 VND to buy food for her chickens.
 Duyen is 52 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy food for her pigs.
 Diem is 22 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND for her small business.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
La Sra. Jessica pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia  y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, de 32 años de edad y tiene 03 hijos, las dos mujeres tienen 11 y 6 años, estudiantes de nivel primario, y el niño de 3 meses de nacido.
Empezó con un inicial de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, vendiendo jugos de frutas por las mañanas de forma ambulatoria en la puerta de su casa, dejó de  realizar esta actividad por encontrarse en riego de perder a su último bebé, es así como decide,  posteriormente vender productos de primera necesidad (abarrotes). 
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con el ingreso que le generan sus ventas. Actualmente cuenta con clientes fijos, moradores de la zona y familiares, todo gracias al trato y amabilidad que les brinda.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 2500.00,  piensa comprar productos que tienen más salida para implementar su negocio como golosinas, bebidas gaseosas, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, cajas de leche, aceites en litros, carnes, verduras y otros.
Jessica es una mujer trabajadora, su sueño es que su negocio este bien surtido, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Jessica is a member of the communal bank "Las Aguerridas II" of the district of Tarapoto in the province and department of San Martin. She is married common-law, 32 years old and she has 3 children. Her daughters are 11 and 6 and they attend primary school. Her son is 3 months old. She started out with an initial fund of S/.300 nuevos soles used to start a business selling fruit juices in the mornings, traveling from door to door. She had to stop her business because she was at risk of losing her baby. She then decided to start selling basic consumer goods (grocery store products).

Her is very satisfied with the income that she earns through her sales. She has a roster of steady clients including passers-by in the region and family members, and it is all thanks to the good customer service and kind manner in which she receives them.

With this new loan in the amount of S/.2500 she plans on purchasing the products that sell the best to supply her business. She will purchase snacks, soft drinks, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, boxes of milk, cooking oil, meats, vegetables, and other products.

Jessica is a hardworking woman whose dream is to have a well-stocked business. She is very thankful to the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for providing her the opportunity of improving her income.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, soft drinks, sacks of rice, and sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta, 54, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Robert, an overseas contract worker, and is mother to their children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. She continually works hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

Julieta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also earns through Electronic Cellular Phone Loading Station. She buys electronic cellular phone load in quantity and then retails it to customers according to usage. Profit is generated depending on the network's policy of dealership. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.     

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a Php11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Julieta hopes to be able to expand soon as she hopes to visit her husband in Saudi Arabia where he works. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Chelangat

texts.en:
Chelangat is 23 years old and has been farming for three years, producing and selling milk and potatoes to the local market. She is married with one child who is two years old. She buys and retails potatoes in the local market for additional income.

Chelangat has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry birds for a poultry farming venture. She says this will compliment her dairy business and compensate for poor milk prices in the current market. She is optimistic about her poultry business and hopes her family's living standards will improve from the good return the business will make.

She sees fluctuation in market prices as the challenge in farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: El señor Eusebio es un hombre muy trabajador y padre de familia preocupado por el bienestar de la familia. Hace 12 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social, que por lo regular este tipo de vivienda son muy pequeñas; cuentan con recamaras  muy estrechas donde muy apenas cabe una cama y un closet, por tal motivo el comenzó la construcción en la parte de enfrente, un cuarto mas para extender la vivienda y de esta manera tener mayor espacio. Para que Eusebio pueda terminar el cuarto necesita colocar el techo de losa, lo cual necesita comprar cemento, arena y pagar la mano de obra. Para poder sostener los gastos del hogar el y su esposa trabajan en maquiladora de Lunes a Viernes.
texts.en:
Señor Eusebio is a very hard-working man and a father who is concerned with his family's well-being.  He bought his social-interest home twelve years ago.  These homes are normally very small; they have very narrow bedrooms, where there is barely room for a bed and a closet.  For this reason, he has started building a room in front to extend his home, and in this way be able to have more space.

In order for Eusebio to be able to finish the room, he needs to put on the roof.  To do this, he needs to buy cement and sand, and to pay for labor.  He and his wife both work at a factory from Monday through Friday to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 43 years old and has four children who are in school.

Elizabeth has a fruits vending business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fruits to sell in her food stall. Elizabeth has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Sorng

texts.en:
Sorng and her husband Chamnan are both 31 years old; they have been married since 1990 and have two sons and two daughters. Two of their children are in school and other two are still young. They live in a village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sorng and her husband are construction workers. She is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to get to work.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 31 years old, married, has one son and works for a private company that pays him a decent salary. He is applying for a loan for $1,000 from FATEN to make a series of repairs to his house, including painting and replacing the doors and windows. These repairs will allow his family to enjoy much better living conditions. Ahmad was photographed at our FATEN branch.

loans.use: to repair his house.

loans.name: Rosa Lina

texts.es:
Rosa, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para la compra de más cerdos, ya que quiere aumentar su granja, esta nueva inversión le permitirá tener más cerdos, para tener disponible para los clientes.
Ella ha mejorado la condición de su familia, teniendo mayor solvencia económica que antes no la tenían.
texts.en:
Rosa is asking for a new loan in order to buy pigs. She would like to increase her stock. This new loan will allow her to buy more pigs. She will then be able to improve her customer service. 
Rosa is improving the conditions for her family. They will be more financially secure, which is something that they didn’t have in the past.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
Serafina es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad, tiene un puesto D. comida en el mercado, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideos, y para la educación D. sus hijos.
En todo el tiempo que tiene como socia Serafina ha visto como su negocio ha crecido, recuerda que antes su puesto era solo D. carrizo ahora ya es D. material noble. Le encanta el apoyo que le brinda Finca con las capacitaciones que le ayudaron en su vida personal como en su negocio, le enseñaron a poder tener un negocio próspero.
texts.en:
Serafina is a member of the Prosperidad (Prosperity) Communal Bank.  She has a food stall in the market.  She is seeking a loan to invest in buying rice, sugar, and noodles and to help pay for her children's education.

During the time that Serafina has been a member of the group,  she has seen her business grow.  She remembers that before, her stall was only a cart, but now it is maD. of proper materials.  She is pleased with the help she has received from microfinance partner FINCA, which has helped her in her personal life as much as her work and which has taught her how to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and noodles for her food stall.

loans.name: Titintaya De Huatajata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TITINTAYA DE HUATAJATA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de pescado, comercio de ropa, tienda de barrio, comercio de charque.

La señora Julia,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos secos que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de carne y pescado) que adquirirá de La Paz y posteriormente lo venderá en Yungas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el préstamo de dinero fácil.
texts.en:
The “TITINTAYA DE HUATAJATA” community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Copacabana regional office.  The group has eleven members and is run by a board of directors which has Julia as its president.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include selling fish, selling clothes, running a neighborhood store and selling jerky.

Julia tells us that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution through a promotional invitation.  She currently has a business selling dried products that she has been working in for years.

Julia will use the loan she is taking out to increase her capital (buying meat and fish).  She will buy her products in La Paz and then sell them in Yungas.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  Julia is single.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer Julia replied that she likes the easy loans.

loans.use: to buy meat and fish

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Annalyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for three years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Annalyn has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is married and works hard to support her family. She has operated a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines for 10 years. Teresita has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance. In the future, Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Farhat Naz's Group

texts.en:
Farhat naz is a 30-year-old woman and a talented lady. She owns and operates a boutique business. Her work is home based. She prepares beautiful looking embroidered and stitched clothes and displays them in her boutique to attract customers.  

People of her community come to her for buying dresses. She makes good sales every month. She keeps herself up to date about the latest trends in fashion and that helps her understand her customer’s demands and choices. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her boutique business. She will invest the loan in buying clothes, fiber and embroidery material in bulk to be able to make more new dresses and increase her revenue. She is very confident about the further growth of her boutique business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, fiber and embroidery material for boutique business

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with three children. 

Vanessa has a food shop, or "sari-sari" store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Vanessa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vanessa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children go to school. She takes care of an additional family member, her father. She sells bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are transportation and thieves. Her aspirations and goals are to buy a plot of land and also to start selling on a wholesale basis only. She lives in a rented house where the family has access to piped water but does not have access to electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Mana

texts.en: Mana is a 18 year old single woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy perfumes and cosmetic and skin care products which she will be selling. She plans on opening a shop to sell these products. Since Mana is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 22 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 10 years, Edward has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells music,phone accessories and video CDs. 

To help expand his business, Edward has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more phone accessories, empty CDs,Tapes to burn more music and movies to sell, and it will help Edward to generate greater profits and take good care of his parents. Edward hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his shop more. 

Edward is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edward who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy empty CDs to burn more music and movies to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Despite Elizabeth\'s level of literacy she regularly participates in the weekly meetings organised by the field staff of Kraban Support Foundation. She has received a meritorious award from a joint workshop organised by Kraban and Freedom from Hunger Ghana for being the best behaved client during TEACH sessions. Auntie Elizabeth needs a KIVA loan amount of $750 to assist her build a new kiosk for her expanding business. she has prepared a business and marketing plan based on the guidelines she received from the staff of Kraban Support Foundation.

loans.use: Build a new kiosk

loans.name: Ucepio

texts.en:
Ucepio has lived in Santa Lucia his entire life. He has been a rice farmer as far back as he can remember, as his parents had him contributing on the farm as soon as he was old enough to work. He and his wife Eufemia have 5 children, two of whom (ages 17 and 6) still live with them. On his farm, Ucepio farms mainly rice, although there are some plantain trees and there is also livestock. He plans on using the money from the loan to invest in a new crop of rice, which will require seeds and fertilizer for the land.

The Paypayales Communal Bank in Santa Lucia

Ucepio is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program: the Paypayales Communal Bank. All bank members are part of a rice farmers' cooperative in Santa Lucia named Dios Con Nosotros (God is with us). They will use these microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. As members of a communal bank, they are all the guarantors for each other's loans. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Dios con Nosotros Cooperative are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about the commnity of Santa Lucia, compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The region is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area, as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them harvest their crop. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not have access to formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also often lack skills and knowledge of how to commercialize their product and get fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them to repay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Buy pesticides, fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Rufat

texts.en: Rufat H. is a 23-year-old resident of Aghsu city in Azerbaijan. He started his dentistry practice in Aghsu two years ago and though he is able to provide for his family, growing the business is more difficult than he expected. Rufat is requesting his first loan with Normicro for $575 in order to purchase some needed equipment, supplies and medicines in order to expand his practice.

loans.use: To purchase equipment, supplies and medicines for his dentistry practice

loans.name: Maria Inés

texts.es:
Maria Inés is originally from Juárez in Nuevo León. She's married and has one child. Her husband is a taxi driver, so he doesn't have a secure income. To improve the economic situation of their family, Maria started out selling hamburgers four years ago. Thanks to the quality of the products she makes, little by little, her clientele grew, and to offer a good service, she incorporated other foods to sell, such as tacos, enchiladas and soups.

Now, to continue growing, she is requesting a loan of $250 which she will use to remodel her stand to give it a better appearance and offer better service to her customers. She is able to return this amount in 3 months. Be an important part of the development of this business, and they will thank you very much for your help.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Maria Inés es originaria de la localidad de Juárez en Nuevo León, es casada y tiene un hijo, su esposo es taxista por lo que no cuenta con un ingreso seguro, para mejorar un su situación económica de su familia Maria inició con la venta de hamburguesas hace cuatro años, gracias a la calidad de los productos que elabora poco a poco fue incrementando su clientela y para ofrecer un buen servicio incorporó la venta de otros alimentos, como tacos, enchiladas y sopes.

Ahora para continuar creciendo está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la remodelación de su puesto para darle una mejor apariencia y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella está dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, ellos agradecen mucho tu ayuda.

loans.use: Remodelación y compra de insumos

loans.name: Maliumai

texts.en: Maliumai is married with 5 children. She's living with her relatives and her elderly mother. Her father, unfortunately, became very ill and could not work anymore. Maliumai was always interested in a vegetable garden, so she stepped in to continue. Her first loan she used to buy some fertilizers, chemicals, and to pay for the laborers to help clear the area. She's very pleased with the help given, and she also plans to have a table in the new market to sell her vegetables.

loans.use: To assist with her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Olive would like to buy more tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier lives in a rented place in the city of La Paz. He paints small landscapes and does pencil sketchings, whichever his clients request. His income is limited, so he has decided to sell his paintings with framing and glass so that they have more value. The credit he requests is to buy materials (wood, glass and canvases).

An evaluation has qualified him for this new loan. Javier has already had 2 previous loans, which have been repaid in full.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Javier vive en alquiler en la calle Ángel Dávalos de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es el arte de pintar cuadros pequeños de paisajes y además realiza el dibujo en lápiz según lo que le pidan sus clientes. Sus ingresos son reducidos por lo cual decidió vender sus pinturas con marcos y vidrio para que tenga mas valor; el crédito que solicita es para comprar material (madera y vidrio y lienzos).

La evaluación realizada lo califica para acceder a un nuevo crédito. Javier ya obtuvo dos créditos anteriores los cuales a la fecha están cancelados en su totalidad.

loans.use: Purchase of wood, glass and canvases.

loans.name: Mugongo A2 (I) Group

texts.en: Christine is 47 years old. She is a widow with 6 children. She has a poultry farm. She intends to reinvest the extra profits in her poultry business.

loans.use: To buy feeders and drinkers for poultry and build a hatchery for the chicks.

loans.name: Marach B(V) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Saida S.. She currently sells new clothes and is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Saida is 23 years old and is married; her husband works in an immigration office. She has 1 son. Each week, Saida makes approximately UGS 30000 (US$18.00) in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to complete her house, which is under construction. Saida has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGS 500000 (US$291.00) in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Saida is joined in her small group by Sauda K., Mary O. and Mariam T.. Sauda K. sells new clothes and wants to start a shoe business with the loan. Mary O. is currently operating a business in dry foods and wants a loan to expand. Mariam T. operates sells new clothes and wants to increase her stock for sale.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 24 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, aged 7, 5, and 3. She and her husband also take care of 1 other person, aged 52. Asia sells popcorn, and she started her business in 2007. Every day she works from 10:00 AM to 8:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Asia now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Njem

texts.en:
Mrs. Njem S., age 58, is a mother of six children and works as farmer growing a variety of vegetables on a plot of farmland. On average, she earns $2 a day. Her husband is also a farmer; he grows rice year-round, making around $3 per day.

Two of the six children are employed as garment workers with a salary $70 a month. The other four children are students and sometimes help their mother planting vegetables.

To make the plants grow faster, she would like to borrow from Kiva to purchase fertilizers and a water pump to water the crops. With the remaining funds, she will purchase watermelon seeds to grow for the next season. (Husband is pictured because Mrs. Njem S. is not available)

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and water pump.

loans.name: Johari's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Johari is 24 years old and is a single woman with 2 children. Johari sales ugali, rice, sausage and meat, and she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items (bananas, maize flour, rice and meat) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwasiti, Tausi and Jasmini, who have businesses dealing in food vending, soap & charcoal sales and a general store owner.

loans.use: To buy more food items (bananas, maize flour, rice and meat) for her business.

loans.name: Desak Putu Pujawati

texts.id:
Desak Putu Pujawati, a mother of 3 children, is a client of DINARI. When she joined DINARI, she has been a pig breeder. With her business, she is able to help her husband, who is a farmer, to fulfill their family’s daily needs.

The proposed loan will be the second loan for Desak Putu Pujawati. The first loan has helped her improved her financial condition. At first, she was able to earn Rp 200,000.00 income a month, and has used them to fulfill her family’s needs and to afford her children’s tuition fees. To continue the business, she still needs the loan from DINARI, until she is able to run the business to be a self-financing business. The proposed loan will be used to invest in piglets and fodders.

Desak Putu is very optimistic that the income she would earn will be higher than before, for she is getting more expert in taking care of pigs. She is also trained by veterinary and DINARI staffs.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Desak Putu Pujawati adalah salah satu klient binaan Dinari .Sejak awal bergabung dengan Dinari Ibu 3 Orang anak ini memiliki usaha memelihara babi.Karena dengan usaha ini Desak Putu Pujawati dapat membantu menunjang pendapatan suaminya yang bekerja sebagai petani. Kali ini merupakan pinjaman periode ke dua yang diterima oleh Desak Putu setelah melewati tahap pertama dengan hasil yang cukup membantu keuangan keluarganya. Keuntungan sebesar Rp. 200.000.- / bln yang di dapat oleh Desak Putu pada periode awal di pergunakan untuk biaya kebutuhan sehari –hari dan biaya sekolah anak –anaknya, sehingga untuk kelangsungan usaha ternak babinya Desak Putu masih melanjutkan pinjamannya, sampai nantinya Desak Putu bisa mandiri. Modal yang didapat ini oleh Desak Putu dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit babi baru dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan. Desak Putu sangat optimis bahwa hasil yang akan di dapatnya akan lebih baik dari sebelumnya, mengingat Desak Putu semakin terampil dalam memelihara ternak babi dan mendapat penyuluhan langsung dari dokter hewan maupun staf Dinari.

loans.use: To invest in piglets and fodders

loans.name: Florence Bogere's Group

texts.en:
Florence is the leader of a five-member group. She is 42 and married with 6 children. All of them are in school. The community she lives and works in is semi-urban and a slum in a low-lying area that floods in the rainy season. Her main challenges are the floods from the rainy season as well as the long distance she has to travel to get some of her products.

Florence has been selling beer and sodas for six years and sells her products in small quantities to those who come by. She plans on using this loan to increase her stock of "waragi," a local alcohol that she sells. By purchasing larger quantities of waragi at a time, she will be able to reduce her transportation costs and time wastage.

Florence plans to use the additional income for school fees for her children. Her future plans include buying a plot of land and building a house for her children.

Florence has successfully paid back 19 loans during her time with MCDT.

loans.use: Increase stock for her bar

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarom S. sells dry fish in the local market in Tep Or Chun village in the Kandal province. Since her business is now going well and she has a lot of customers with different demands, Mrs. Sarom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more dry fish to resell.

Mrs. Sarom S. is a 53-year-old widow with four children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, while the others help with their mother's business.

loans.use: To buy more dry fish to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Ms. Sok C. T. is a villager in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She decided to ask for a loan because she wants to repair her house. She is a vegetable seller who can earn a little income to support her whole family. Her husband’s name is Hell Phallar. He assists his wife with her business. They have five children to support for both their living and studying.  Ms. Sok C. T. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to fix the house.

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es: Llerme tiene 50 años, es madre de 4 hijos, siendo uno de ellos independiente ya, y los otros tres últimos son solteros y trabajan.Hace 2 años viene alquilando habitaciones en su propio domicilio y le va muy bien. Ella es una mujer con visión de negocio, pues quiere seguir ampliando sus habitaciones, así como también volver a vender comida por las noches, actividad que antes realizaba.Para mandar a construir más habitaciones y cumplir con lo que se ha propuesto, estima de una cantidad de dinero que solicita.
texts.en:
Llerme is a 50-year-old mother of four. The eldest child has a family, and the other three are single and working. Two years ago Llerme started renting out rooms in her home, and it has gone very well. She is a woman with a vision for her business, so she wants to enlarge her rooms and also sell meals at night, which she used to do and would like to start doing again. In order to build more rooms and fulfill all that she has proposed, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase and improve the rooms she rents in her home

loans.name: Doris Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Doris pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amigas por Siempre”, ubicado en la Urbanización Fonavi Mz.A Lt.10, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como repartidor de productos de primera necesidad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. 

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa, para lo cual se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus hijos, ir al mercado y comprar lo necesario para su bodega. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 3 paquetes de fideos, 2 cajas de leche, detergente, gaseosas, etc. 

Doris es una mujer trabajadora. Se siente contenta por todo lo que ha logrado en la vida.
texts.en:
Señora Doris belongs to the "Friends Always" Communal Bank located in the Urbanization Fonavi Block Lot 10, district of Yarinacocha, Colonel Portilla province, department of Ucayali. She is 48 years old and a mother of 3 children, 2 of legal age and one that still depends on her. She is married and her husband works as a distributor of groceries. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in the sale of groceries. Currently she relies on a convenience store at home, for which she rises very early to attend her children, to go to the market and to buy the necessary things for her store. With this loan of 1,500 soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 1 bag of rice, 1 bag of sugar, 3 packages of noodles, 2 boxes of milk, detergent, carbonated water, etc. Doris is a hard-working woman. She feels happy for everything that she has achieved in life.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc for her convenience store.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy vive en la avenida Hacia El Mar  de la zona de Senkata, zona peri urbana de la ciudad de el  Alto
 
Vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica a la artesanía como tejedora. Tiene tres hijos de 9, 5 y 2 años respectivamente.

Posee un taller de cerrajería que se encuentra en su domicilio, realiza trabajos en metal consistentes en puertas y ventanas.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra materiales para su trabajo diario.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito
texts.en:
Eloy lives in the Hacia El Mar Avenue in the area of Senkata, a peri urban part of the city of Alto Vivo. He lives there with his wife, who makes handicrafts as a weaver. They have three children who are 9, 5 and 2 years old. Eloy has a metal shop in his home. He does work in metal, such as doors and windows. This loan will be to purchase materials for his work. This is Eloy's first loan with Impro, who evaluated his situation and determined he qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Higidia

texts.es: Higidia tiene 57 años, y vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de productos de medicina, comenzó siendo consumidora y luego lo hizo su fuente de ingresos, en un inicio fue difícil adquirir clientes, pero se adaptó a esta forma de trabajo, que consiste en buscar a sus clientes casa por casa y a través de amistades. Este negocio le ha permitido tener  lo ingresos necesarios para sus 4 hijos, ya que muchas veces el sueldo de su esposo suele ser insuficiente. Ahora, Higidia se está proyectando a manejar mayor capital para sus ventas y establecerse en un local en una zona comercial. Es la tercera  vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, demostrando ser una persona responsable. Con esta cantidad comprará al por mayor más productos, además alquilará un local donde ofrezca comida y venda estos productos de medicina natural.
texts.en:
Higidia is 57 years old and lives with her husband and their children. Since a year ago she has been dedicated to selling medicinal products. She began as a consumer and later made it her source of income. At the beginning it was difficult to acquire clients but she adapted to this form of work, which involves searching for clients from house to house and through friendships. This business has allowed her to have the necessary income for her four children since many times the salary of her husband tends to be insufficient. Now, Higidia is planning to operate with greater capital for her sales and establish a store in a commercial zone. This is the third time that she has requested a loan with MFP, showing that she is a responsible person. With this quantity, she will buy more products in bulk and she will rent a store where she offers food and sells these natural medicine products.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the products that she sells

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đinh Thị Quyền, năm nay 47 tuổi ở Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Chị  tham gia vào Qũy từ năm 2007. Gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành, trong đó có 2 con đã đi làm. Nguồn thu chính của gia đình chị là chăn nuôi vịt đẻ v à làm ruộng. Ngo ài th ờigian gi úp vợ chăn nuôi chồng chị còn làm thêm nghề đánh bắt  cá sông. Hiện tại   thu nhập   bình quân của gia đình chị đạt  4.000.000 đ/ tháng . Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, xây sửa chuồng trại
texts.en:
Mrs. Dinh Thi Q., 47 years of age, lives in Quang Xuong district, Thanh Hoa province. She has participated in the Fund since 2007. Her family has three grown-up children, two of them are employed. The main sources of income of her family are from raising ducks and farming. Her husband, apart from helping her to raise ducks, also catches fresh-water fishes. Currently, the average income of the family is VND4,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND9,000,000 to invest in poultry and to renovate the coop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy poultry and to renovate the coop

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
Mme Coumba a 29 ans mariée et mère de 2 enfans. Elle vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et ses 2 enfants dans le 1er quartier  de la ville de koutiala ( Region de Sikasso ). 
Mme Coumba n’a pas fréquenté l’école et s’est très vite intéressée aux activités génératices de revenu notamment la vente des fruits et légumes qu’elle a appris auprès de sa maman. Elle est à sa 10 ème  d’année d’expérience dans le commerce. Son activité est très rentable et lui procure assez de revenus, elle peut vendre plus de 2 gros caisse de pomme de terre par jour. 
Pour pouvoir élargir et augmenter son fonds de roulement, elle a fait recours  à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après 7 prêts solidaires(prêt de groupe) tous remboursés sans difficulté,  elle est à son 1er prêt  individuel. 
 Avec ce prêt, elle  compte acheter , 10 caisses  de pomme de terre à Sikasso ( 3 ème Region du Mali ) et dans les villages environnants de Koutiala auprès de producteurs. Elle  vend  en face de   l’hopital de koutiala à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’ hommes,  au comptant ou à crédit.
Elle compte générer un bénéfice de 65.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage d’ utiliser  pour  le remboursement des intérêts de son prêt,  participer aux charges quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités.
texts.en:
Ms. Coumba, 29,married and the mother of 2 children, lives in a monogamous family with her husband and her two children in the first district of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region).

Ms. Coumba did not go to school and became interested, early on, in earning money, more specifically in selling fruit and vegetables, a skill she learned from her mother. She is now on her 10th year in this business. Her business is very lucrative and brings in a good deal of revenue for her; she can sell more than two big boxes of potatoes per day.

In order to expand and increase her working capital, she came to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After 7 solidarity loans (group loans), all reimbursed without difficulty, she is on her first individual loan.

With this loan she intends to buy 10 boxes of potatoes in Sikasso (third region of Mali) and in the villages surrounding Koutiala from producers. She sells opposite the hospital of Koutiala to a clientele made up of women and men, for cash and credit.

She expects to generate a profit of 65,000 F CFA a month that she plans to use for reimbursing the interest on her loan and for participating in daily expenses for the family, investing the remainder in other activities.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of potatoes for re-sale

loans.name: Martha Petrona

texts.es: Martha Petrona G. Carbajal tiene 58 años, su estado civil es soltera. Tiene 4 hijos. Todos sus hijos trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña Martha es un bar y comedor. Hace más de 32 años que se dedica a este negocio y da inicio al negocio con capital propio y cuando empezó este le generaba ingresos fue por esto que decidió mantener este negocio. Doña Martha tiene los propósitos de son de obtener los ingresos necesarios de su inversión por lo que la situación en la que nos encontramos es muy difícil y el único medio de ayuda  que presentamos actualmente en el país son las micro financieras y las organizaciones en el exterior que nos ayudan. Sus deseos son de seguir trabajando y prosperar con su negocio. la cantidad que necesita es de C$ 19.000 córdobas a un plazo de 18 meses.
texts.en:
Martha Petrona G. Carbajal is 58 years old, single, and has 4 children, all of whom work. Martha earns income from her bar and cafe. She has had this trade for more than 32 years that she started with her own capital. She has earned income from this business since she started it. Martha's goal is to earn enough income to support herself. The situation is very difficult in her country; microfinance and outside organizations are the only methods of help currently offered to them. Her wish is to continue working and for her business to prosper. The loan quantity is C$19.000 cordobas to be paid off in 18 months.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Avazhon

texts.ru: Гулмирзоев Авазхон житель Вахшского района. Возраст 33 года , образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Обратился за кредитом для того, чтобы закупить комбикорм. Это поможет ему в его деятельности . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 5 месяцев. Аваз не женат и не имеет детей. Живет с родителями и семьей брата. Зарабатываемые деньги использует на развитие бизнеса , а так же на обеспечение семьи.
texts.en:
Avazhon G. lives in the Vakhsh district. He is 33 years old and has a high school education. He practices animal husbandry. He has requested a loan for purchase of complete animal feed. This will help with his work. The loan will be repaid over 5 months. Avaz is not married and has no children. He lives with his parents and brother's family. His income will be used to further develop the business, as well as to support the family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase complete animal feed

loans.name: Hadia

texts.en:
Hadia is 48 years old, married, and has three children: ages 34, 32 and 24. She also cares for one additional dependent.

Hadia has been a fish and charcoal seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 10 years. She belongs to Hatutaki shari group loan (Group code 2051). She works at her business daily and currently earns an average monthly profit of $50.

Hadia is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish and charcoal for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more fish and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma has been a clothes seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to the Msimamo loan group (group code 2015). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes to add her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Mwajuma is 22 years old and married. She has two children, ages 6 and 3.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to add her current stock.

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.en:
K. Đỗ Thị, 57 years old, lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, K. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The primary source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. K. has just started operating this business and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.
