Jipange is a Nuru International group of six farmers in Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru International to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan.

Josephine, who is raising her hand, is the chairperson of the group and has been a member of the group since the year 2011. She is 35 years old and is married with two children who go to school. The loan from Kiva will enable her to acquire hybrid seeds and fertilizer, which will enable her to obtain high yields. Josephine, just like the other members of her group, will take input loans for one acre. She will grow maize on 1/2 acre, and sorghum and millet on ¼ acre each. She plans to sell the surplus and pay school fees for her children. She also plans to join a saving and loaning scheme so she will save some of the money obtained from selling the surplus. This will give her more financial independence.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a mother of 4. She has been in the poultry business for 6 years now. Currently she has a stock of 50 broilers that are 3 weeks old. The poultry business is the main source of livelihood for Pauline's family upkeep and payment of school fees.

Pauline wishes to expand her business. She intends to use her KIVA loan to buy 100 more birds and feeds as well as pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: Purchase of 100 day old chicks, drugs and stock feeds

loans.name: Ulysses

texts.en:
Ulysses is 32 years old, married with 2 children, settled for a living at Clarin, Misamis Occidental with his family. He works as a security guard, and at the same time had a motor transport business to make a living. He has been a member of Gata Daku MPC for almost ten years and used his previous loan for buying spare parts and motor accessories. It has been successfully repaid.

To maintain a better service, he took a new loan 20,000.00 to purchase a pair of tires and for maintenance costs and motor improvements. He wants to improve the general living of his family in the near future and dreams to build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase tires and for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Alasgar

texts.en:
44 year-old Alasgar is a refugee who fled from the occupied Azerbaijani territory Gubadli after the break out of the Armenian-Azerbaijani conflict.

So, his new life started in the city of Sumgayit where he settled with his family. To make end meet he got involved in cattle trading. Now he is applying for a loan of 500 USD. He plans to increase the number of cattle he has and launch milk and cheese sales. It is his belief that this will improve his welfare and meet the increasing needs of his family in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a divorced mother with 2 daughters. For nearly 6 years, she has been building up her small business selling children’s clothing and shoes. She has proven to be a hard and passionate worker. Her children are now all grown, so as a single woman she relies on the success of her business to meet her needs. The net monthly profit from her business amounts to about $145 and she has approximately $600 in working capital. Today Valentina is requesting a loan for $500. The funds will be used to broaden the assortment of children’s clothing and shoes that she has to sell at the market. She is encouraged by this opportunity to continue to work with Nadiya Ukraine where she has proven to be an outstanding client in the past.

Валентина – розлучена, в неї двоє дочок. Вже майже шість років вона розвиває власний бізнес з продажу дитячого одягу та взуття. Вона дуже працьовита та віддана власній справі. Дочки Валентини вже дорослі, вона живе одна. Отже, для того, щоб забезпечити власні потреби, вона покладається лише на власний бізнес. Щомісячний прибуток Валентини складає приблизно 145 доларів, в неї 600 доларів робочого капіталу. Зараз Валентина просить про позику в 500 доларів. Вона планує використати отримані кошти для того, щоб розширити асортимент дитячого одягу та взуття для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі на ринку. Валентина вчасно сплатила усі позики, які отримала від «Надії України», вона дуже радіє можливості й надалі співпрацювати з нашою організацією.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila runs a prosperous little clothing sales kiosk at the Pervomaiski Rhinok (market) in Nikopol, Ukraine. A teacher by profession, she decided to open her own business about ten years ago and has done very well. She sells a variety of women’s skirts, blouses, and dresses.

Income from Ludmila’s business helped her and her husband, Victor, build their own home. Her income also helps provide for her two children – a son aged 23 and daughter, 17. Ludmila is typical of many women entrepreneurs who desire to earn extra income to provide a better living for their families.

Ludmila has requested a loan for $800 to use to help her purchase additional inventory to sell. She typically will buy about $400 worth of clothes from her suppliers three times a month. This allows her to maintain an adequate amount of inventory on hand and she can easily update her product selection if an item is selling well or not moving quickly enough. Ludmila’s business has benefited much from loans she has received in the past. We believe that this loan will continue to help her business be successful and provide much needed income for Ludmila and her family.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Mrs Yin S. L. is 26 and lives in Phnom Penh in Cambodia. She sells clothes near a factory. Her husband is a security guard. They have 3 children. 
Mrs Yin S. L. wants to purchase clothes to expand the inventory in her store. In the future she would like to open a bigger shop. In the picture, we can see her three children.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her clothing store

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 34 years of age, and is married with 3 children. Her husband works for one of the spare parts companies in the town area, and also works on their plantation during weekends. But most of the time Nora is in charge. She decided to give 100 percent of her time to the plantation, since she knew her husband's fortnightly income was not sufficient to support the whole family. She used her first loan to buy a back sprayer, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, and more taro tops. Nora is a very hard working woman, and in the future she hopes her business will grow bigger, and her biggest plan is to earn good money so she can improve their family home.

loans.use: To assist with her taro plantation

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en: Bakhtiyar is an Internally Displaced Person from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory of the Gubadli region, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan.  Right now he lives with his family in the Surakhani settlement in the eastern suburbs of Baku.  He has a car and provides taxi service.  He is married and has four childen.  He has been in this business for four years.  He drives inside Baku, goes to the suburbs and sometimes to other regions.  Going far distances wears the car out and he now needs to get the engine of his car reassembled.  As he has little of his own funds to do this, he has applied to Normicro Baku branch to borrow $400 to repair his car. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To repair his car's engine for his taxi service

loans.name: Odette Amani

texts.en: Odette Amani A. is a 59-year-old widow. Odette is a farmer in Sassandra, a rural city on the south-west coast of Côte d'Ivoire. She cultivates cassava on about 2 hectars of land belonging to her family. Cassava is one of the main products in the Sassandra region, where it is used for different types of foods. Odette, who produces a big quantity of cassava, is confronted by a problem of conservation. She would like to get a loan in order to build small conservation silos  against rats and insects under her hangar. She said that this will help her to conserve part of her production for a lean period. Odette is dynamic and hard worker.

loans.use: Odette Amani Ahou will use the loan to develop a storage space for cassava

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Pili Mwashirindi from Mbeya, Tanzania. She is married with three children, ages 3,6, and 10. In 2004 Pili established a clothing business, and now requires a loan of $625 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Mugunza A(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Hamida H.. She operates a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase her stock. Hamida is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has 3 children ranging in age from 6 to 12 years and her children go to school. Each week, Hamida makes approximately UGX 70000 (US$41.00) in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a new refrigerator for her shop. Hamida has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000(US$175.00) to add more stock in the shop and the loan was paid back on time.

Hamida is joined in her small group by Zubeda D. and Aisha N.. Zubeda D. sells used clothes and wants to expand the business. Aisha N. currently operates a retail shop and wants a loan to add stock in the shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Kyowamwino C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Christine N.. She is currently in the business selling fish and is requesting a loan to purchase fish in bulk. Christine is 21 years old and is married. She has 1 child aged 4 who goes to school. Each week, Christine makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy building materials.

Christine is joined in her small group by Ruth K., Gertrude N., Egilanda A., and Tapenensi N.. Ruth K. has a business in clothing sales and wants to increase the stock of clothes. Gertrude N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase more shop items. Egilanda A. operates a restaurant business and wants to purchase more utensils and cutlery. Tapenensi N. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to purchase more baskets of tomatoes.

loans.use: To boost fish selling business

loans.name: So

texts.en: Ms. So N., 27, sells vegetables at the Pursat Market, where she earns $2.40 per day. She is unmarried and lives with her family in the Stha Ny Village in Pursat Province. N. seeks a $350 loan to expand her inventory of vegetables. With this loan, she hopes to increase sales and improve her family’s financial stability.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of vegetables

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine D. is forty-three years old. She is a wife and the mother of three children who are in school. She is a very industrious woman and her biggest wish is to provide a quality education for her children to give them better opportunities in life . Josephine owns and operates a grocery shop with items like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With increased stock of different varieties, she hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of her children. She belongs to the community group called Steadfast Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Khaladdin

texts.en: Khaladdin is 38 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Kayidish village, which was built for IDPs. This man is married and has 3 children. He has been in the taxi business for 5 years. He transports people on a minibus from Fuzuli to Baku. Now he requests a loan of $975 to buy spare parts for improving his business.  He promises to repay the loan in full on time.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase chairs and other materials to provide her pupils with a more comfortable atmosphere.

loans.name: Mun

texts.en:
Mrs. Mun T., 35, is married with two children and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has worked as a rice farmer since 1991. At the same time, her husband started operating a recycling business. He buys recycling items from different locations and resells them to the recycling plant.

Her two dollar daily income and her husband's four dollar daily income is barely enough to cover the family's expenses. This couple is requesting a loan to purchase a motor-bike for her husband to use for his business. A motor-bike will allow him to travel further distances to collect recyclable items, thus improving his amount for resale to the plant. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Mun T. is not available).

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike for business transportation

loans.name: Asha's Kujikwaa Si Kuanguka Group

texts.en:
Asha is 26 years old. She is married with 2 children ages 6 and 3 years old. She has been a food seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more food items to improve her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Salma, who has a business dealing with clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items to improve her business

loans.name: Vencedoras Group

texts.en:
Vencedoras Community Bank is located in Huancavelica, in the community of Locrojo. Locrojo is located at 3,300m to the northeast of the capital of Churcampa. Dedicated to the production of corn, potatoes and peas, this community is also known for raising cows, pigs and smaller animals. 

Ana M. B. is part of the Vencedoras Community bank and lives in Huancavelica with her four children aged 17, 14, 8 and 5. Her business includes selling children's clothes, which she sells to members of her community. Unfortunately, last year there was a robbery at her stO., but with the help of FINCA Perú she has been able to continue her business. She would like to invest the loan she receives into improving her stO.. FINCA Perú has taught her the importance of saving and since she started with FINCA she's been saving to be able to take care of any emergencies that might happen to her or her family. Ana's goal is to make sure her children are in school and continue to be educated, and to earn mO. at her stO.. 

Carmen Rosa E. Q. is also part of the Vencedoras Community bank. She lives in Huancavelica with her four children aged 10, 8, 6 and 4. She has been selling and buying animals for the past five years. Carmen understands that all businesses have their highs and lows and with her savings, which is encouraged at FINCA Perú, she has been able to continue to proviD. for her family. She will invest her loan into improving her business.  She dreams of one day being able to buy her own land and build a new house, and with the help from loans and savings she will be able to do this.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Lizeth Karina

texts.es:
La señora Lizeth pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Siete Estrellas”, ubicado en el Jr. Libertadores Nº 299, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de un hijo menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de transporte terrestre (Manejo de una motokar). Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza (EBEL). Compra por campaña para vender a sus clientes a un precio justo.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará variedades de productos de belleza, perfumes, colonias, talcos, etc.

Lizeth agradece a Dios por darle buena salud y a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Señora Lizeth belongs to the communal bank called "The Seven Stars", located in the district of Calleria in the area of Coronel Portillo in the state of Ucayalli. She's 30 years old. She's mother of a young little boy who still depends on her financially. She's married and her husband is in transportation (driving a motorcar). With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it by buying soda/refreshment to sell. She currently sells beauty products/cosmetics (Ebel). She buys in bulk so that she can later sell to her clients at a fair price. With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase a variety of beauty products such as perfumes, colognes, powders, etc. Lizeth gives thanks to God for being healthy and to Manuela Ramos for all the help she has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products such as perfumes, colognes, powders, etc.

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheang V. is 35 years old and now lives in Ta Sean village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Seim V., are fruit sellers. Since this business is going well, they want to expand their business; to this end, Mrs. Sokheang V. decided to ask for a loan to buy a greater variety of fruit in their business. She hopes thereby to expand her customer base and thus increase her income and improve the life of her and her family. She has six children: one is a construction worker; one helps with the business; three are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of fruit for their business

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: Mirtha tiene 36 años, y vive con sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de muñecas de tela que ella misma elabora, lo que viene haciendo desde hace un año, para lo cual se ha preparado estudiando en un centro ocupacional y ahora esta actividad es una de sus mayores fuentes de ingreso. Mirtha es docente y aprovecha pequeños espacios de su tiempo para vender sus muñecas, y con la creatividad que posee ha logrado elaborar novedosos diseños que atraen a sus clientes que le hacen más pedidos, y aún más en esta época festiva.  Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con esta cantidad podrá invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios para  la elaboración de las muñecas, así mismo, adquirirá prendas de vestir para vender junto con las muñecas.
texts.en:
Mirtha is 36 years old and lives with her parents. She works selling cloth dolls that she makes herself, which she has been doing for a year. She was trained to do this by studying at an occupational center and now this practice is one of her greatest sources of income. Mirtha is a docent and takes advantage of the limited time she has for selling her dolls. With her creativity, she has been able to make original designs that attract clients who place more orders with her, which happens even more often during the holiday season. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan with MFP, and she promises to be timely with her payments. With this amount, she will be able to invest in buying the necessary materials for making the dolls and clothes to sell with the dolls.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for making her dolls

loans.name: Gulomjon

texts.en:
Gulomjon B. is married and lives in Isfara, Tajikistan. He works as a taxi driver. He loves being self-employed and managing his own time. Gulomjon has a nice car and offers taxi services around his region. He is a workaholic and is always ready to work non-stop, even on the weekend.

Gulomjon has been in this business for 2 years. Today he is planning to replace the fuel supply system with one using gas as a fuel change, as this is cheaper than petrol. And also his car needs some fixing. For this reason he is asking for a loan of 1200 USD. This will generate additional profit as he finds more clients. This business is a crucial segment of his life, since it is Gulomjon's opportunity to support his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a kapron gas-cylinder for his car's fuel supply system

loans.name: Maiha Zakhem Group

texts.en:
Asia Kasimu, 34, is married with no children. She sells soft drinks. She started this business in 2002 and works daily from 9am until 11pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 311.

This will be Asia’s seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock and bought a fridge. She has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for this seventh loan but has not planned what she reA. wants to do with her share. Asia will share this loan with her loan group, "Maisha Zakhem", which totals 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Asia is 1st from left, standing, second row.

loans.use: To reinforce the working capital of the various businesses

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita M. grows rice for a living. She is 38 years old and has 2 loving children. She and her husband rent a 1-hectare plot of land, which they use to plant rice to support the family. She dreams of having her own land someday to better support their needs. Aside from rice, they also grow vegetables in their backyard. Teresita waters the vegetables  every day and uses her harvest to pay tuition and book fees for her children.

She is requesting a  loan of PHP 9,000 from Kiva's partner, CEVI, to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. She is also interested in looking for other possible income areas to help her family more. The loan will truly help Teresita increase her yield and start a new business.

CEVI provides not just credit assistance. They also give training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mme Afi A. est née en 1977 à Séwui au Ghana. Mariée avec trois (03) enfants à charge, elle réside actuellement à Kladjèmé. Son activité principale est la préparation et la vente de la bouillie de mais dans son village tous les matins. Elle mène cette activité depuis plusieurs années et en tire suffisamment de revenus pour faire face aux besoins de sa petite famille. Malgré sa volonté et son dynamisme, elle n’arrive pas à sortir de sa situation précaire, faute de moyens financiers suffisants. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour acheter un stock important de mais, de sucre et autre. Ce financement va réduire ses coûts d’achat et augmenter considérablement ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Afi A. was born in 1977 in Séwui, Ghana. She is married and has three dependent children. She is now living in Kladjèmé. She prepares and sells corn porridge every morning in her village. She has had this business for a number of years and is able to make enough money to take care of the basic needs of her small family. Despite her will and her energy, she is unable to get out of her precarious situation due to a lack of money. She is therefore asking for this loan to buy large amounts of corn, sugar and so on. This loan will reduce her buying costs and considerably increase her profits.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large amounts of corn and sugar

loans.name: Tufa

texts.en:
U. Tufa lives in Khujand and she is married with four children. She is a loving mother who does everything to ensure that her children will be happy in their future.

Tufa is a school teacher but she is also engaged in business, selling women’s wear. She works with her sister, who brings the goods from Uzbekistan, and she sells it in the week-end bazaar. It is a joint family business.

Tufa applies to Kiva with the request of a business support loan of 2,500 STJ for 8 months for importing new seasonal wear and to increase business turnover. She thanks Kiva for its support and invites you to Tajikistan.

loans.use: To import new seasonal women's wear

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent A. works as a baker selling bread at Kojokram near Shama Junction, which she has done since 2001. She is single with two children. Millicent received an education through senior high school. She is responsible for paying some of her family’s various expenses, such as the light bill. Her loan will be used to purchase additional flour which she will use to bake more bread.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional flour for bread making

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en:
Huê Hoàng Thị, 55 years old, lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has three adult-aged children. Huê owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising pigs for sale. Huê has just started operating this business and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month.

In 2003, Huê joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Huê has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Huê is now requesting a new loan of 90,00,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Huê plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Edobor

texts.en: Edobor has a cassava and maize farm. He is 48 years old and married with seven children. He hopes for the loan of N50,000 to hire laborers to clear his farm. He is saying thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for labor to clear his farm

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita manages a general store business in their simple village in San Rafael, in the municipality of Roxas, Isabela. She has three children.  Nenita says that she will work hard in order to give a better quality life to her family.  

Nenita is hoping for her business to grow through the support of KIVA lenders. She is borrowing the amount of PHP10,000 as additional working capital for her store. With this loan she plans to make her business more progressive by investing in different merchandise and commodities to sell in her store. With her daily profit, Nenita will then able to finance the daily expenses of her children in school. Nenita struggles a lot for the progress of her family's lives and is hoping to continue to provide for the education of her children until college so that they will have better living opportunities in the future.

loans.use: To expand the range of products sold in her store

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La señora Maribel
texts.en: Miss Maribel

loans.use: To build a concrete roof

loans.name: Cheriben

texts.en:
Cheriben G. lives in the city of Antipolo, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is married to Ronnie, who is 51 years old and also her business partner. She has six children and, as a mother, she hopes only for what is best for her children.

The hope of getting out of the spiral of poverty brought Cheriben to join ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2007. She has been running a business selling chickens for ten years. Now on her fourth loan, Cheriben is requesting the amount of 20,000 PHP as additional capital for her business – 15,000 PHP of her loan will be used as capital in the purchase of chickens while the remaining 5,000 PHP will be used for other expenditure, such as transportation. Cheriben's business is successful and it gives her family a good profit on which to live. As a mother, Cheriben aspires to send her younger children to school and have them find jobs. She also hopes to have a durable house and the opportunity to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy chickens for resale and meet other costs such as transportation

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is a single parent and has one child. She has received schooling through commercial school.

Mary is a vendor of mobile phone top-up cards at Nkontrodo, in Elmina, which she has done since 2006. She uses her income to pay bills.

Mary will use the loan to purchase more mobile phone top-up cards for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phone top-up cards for resale

loans.name: Bangoma #2 Group

texts.en:
Bangoma #2 is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Kagbah D., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Kagbah is married with 6 children, ages 12-29.  Her oldest is in the 9th grade, she is behind due to the war.  Kagbah is 40 years old, illiterate, and lives in Borkeza Town.  

Kagbah’s business is palm oil wholesale in the Bokeza market and other markets in a stall alongside other vendors.  Palmoil is used for cooking and making soap.  Kagbah has been running her business for 3 years.  Today her business is only open when she has inventory, even though the demand is constant.  She’s taking a loan to increase her inventory sufficiently so she can keep her business open year-round and increase her sales beyond Bokeza market.  With the profits she dreams of building a market out of her house, invest in the future of her kids, especially school which she was unable to attend.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita T.'s main source of income comes from selling chicharon in her community. She is 57 years old, married, and living in Tinago Ozamiz City. Perlita has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Perlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Perlita is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Moeurn S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to make the field more productive. Her husband, Mr. Yaem Soeun, uses a horse and cart to transport goods and passengers. He is on the left in the photo. This couple has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other two are attending the local school. She is a villager in Doem Pour village in Takeo province.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de cinq femmes (trois mariées et deux célibataires) ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant dans des foyers monogames  à Ouayerma, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso  3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Dans le but de d’augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur sixième  prêt de groupe. Tous les prêts passés  se sont  bien dénoués. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de bois de chauffe,  de fruits et  légumes, de bazins et de pagnes wax. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 20 colis de pagnes wax, 10  chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe,  40 paniers de fruits et 2 pièces de bazins. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville auprès des grossistes. Les marchandises sont revendues au marché de Médine, dans les différents quartiers ou de façon ambulante, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée dans l’éducation et  la santé des enfants et l’autre partie sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt.
Les femmes du groupe Danaya ambitionnent devenir des grossistes et entreprendre des voyages entre le Mali et les pays frontaliers.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of five women (three are married and two are single) with an average age of 34 years and 3 children and living in private homes in Ouayerma, a district in the village of Sikasso, an economic hub in Mali.

In order to increase their sales, they have decided to work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner), this being the group's sixth loan. All of their past loans have been properly repaid.

They each carry out different businesses, such as firewood sales, sales of fruits and vegetables, and sales of fabrics.

With this new loan they plan on purchasing 20 rolls of printed fabrics, 10 wheelbarrows of firewood, 40 baskets of frutis and 2 measures of taffeta fabric.

They purchase their products from wholesalers in the large market in the village of Sikasso. The merchandise is later resold in the markets in Medine, and in various districts, to a clientele made up of both men and women, most of whom pay in cash.

Their monthlyh forecasted earnings are of 15000FCFA, part of which will be put towards the education and health care of their children, and another part will be used to repay the loan.

The women of the Danaya group are ambitious and plan on becoming wholesalers and plan on making trips from Mali to other neighboring countries.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various types of merchandise.

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en: Fadwa is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of three children who still go to school. She has been the owner of a mini market in her town since 2000, selling a variety of food products. Today, Fadwa is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy merchandise needed for the mini market so she can carry more products and earn a good income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad, age 33, is a responsible father of six children who has always watched over his family’s financial security. He accomplishes this by raising and selling sheep. He purchases sheep, feeds and cares for them, and then resells them at higher prices.

He applied for a loan of $2000 to purchase more sheep. You could become an important part of his family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 42 years old. She is married and has four children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim, which is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the local people. Rose works hard to provide for the family. She is a trader, dealing in bags of charcoal. Rose buys from nearby communities and treks to supply nearby towns. She also sells to local restaurant operators. Rose has been in this business for seven years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2007, he opened a clothing shop for men in his town. He helps his father with the family income. Today, Ahmad is requesting to borrow $1,200 in order to add new inventory to his shop to attract more clients with his new collections.

loans.use: To dd new inventory to his shop.

loans.name: Lunida

texts.en:
Mrs. Lunida P., 44 years of age, is married and is a resident of Maquilao, Tangub City. She is blessed with seven children, mostly of adolescent age.

Lunida’s husband is a fisherman and, because of the condition of this business in the past, they felt financial hardships in supporting their family. To help her husband, Lunida decided to engage in fish-vending. For ten years, she was able to generate income from her business and now she is earning an average net income of not less than 2,000 PHP a month.

As a first-time borrower, Lunida is given a privilege of obtaining PHP 4,000 to add to the capital of her fish-vending business. Her dreams in life are to be able to send her children to school and to someday have a fish stand.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her fish-vending business

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena R. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Efrena is married and has 5 school-aged children. Efrena owns & operates a specialized retail store which supplies a variety of different products such as bananas, coffee and chicharon (pork cracklings). She also sells gasoline for motorcycles in the local community. Efrena has been operating her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Efrena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Efrena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Efrena is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Efrena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn S. is a villager in Ta Pov village in Takeo province. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and then re-sells for a better price. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep in stock. Her husband, Mr. Ngoy Chhorn, is a farmer. Mrs. Thorn S. is a 44-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is a laborer while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is 35 years old and married to a civil servant. They have 3 children, who are excelling in school, and this gives Bola joy. She is a hard working and friendly woman. She has a stall where she sells medicines and sachet water at retail prices to her customers. She loves her business and hopes to expand it. She would like to own a maternity home in the future. Bola hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more medicines and sachet water to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Wasuk

texts.en:
Wasuk S., currently in the business of selling ice cream and bread, is requesting a loan to stock more bread to sell. Wasuk, 37 years old and married to an electrician, is the mother of two children, both students. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rental purpose.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie M. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Virgie owns and manages a fishpond. Her monthly income amounting to 1,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) comes primarily from fishpond-caught fish. 

In 1999, Virgie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for fishpond maintenance. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Virgie from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Fishpond maintenance

loans.name: Joao Miguel

texts.pt:
João Miguel U. nasceu na cidade de Inhambane, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 46 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 23 e 02 anos de idade, a filha mais velha esta na Republica da África do Sul, casou se e reside lá. Fez 3°ano de Universidade em electrónica. Vive numa casa de aluguer com a sua família e sustenta sua sobrinha que vive com ele.
Saiu de Inhambane para a província da Beira em missão de serviço, em 2009 é transferido para Maputo. Trabalha no Ministério da Defesa como engenheiro electrónico ha mais de 30 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 11.957.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta Bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 16.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, varões de ferro, areia e tinta e outros) para reabilitar a sua antiga casa no Bairro da Machava.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para a continuar com a reabilitação da sua casa e iniciar um projecto nos seus dois terrenos no bairro de Bobole e Mulotane.
texts.en:
João Miguel U. was born in Inhambane City, Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. He is 46 years old, married and the father of two children, ages 23 years and 2 years. The elder daughter, who is married, lives in South Africa. He finished three years of university study in electronics. He lives in a rented house with his family and supports a niece who lives with him. João left Inhambane when he was transferred to Beira Province for work, and in 2009 he was transferred to Maputo. For more than 30 years he has worked for the Ministry of Defense as an electronic engineer. He has no employees and has a salary of 11,957 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses while managing to save some in his bank account. He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through co-workers who are also customers of this institution. This is his first loan. He is asking for 16,000 meticais, which he will use to buy construction materials (cement, iron bars, sand and paint and other items) to renovate his old house in Machava neighborhood. João promises to pay off this loan on time so he can take out other loans. In the future he would like to ask for more loans to continue renovations on his house and to begin a project on his two plots in Bobole and Mulotane neighborhoods.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, iron bars, sand and paint and other items)

loans.name: Flor's Group

texts.en:
Flor T., aged 45, is from the village of Villaflor. She is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Flor is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a gardening business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Flor has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2000, Flor joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Flor is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the 10th loan she has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic products and enamel dishes

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira A. is a resident of Multan, Pakistan where she has an embroidery business. She takes orders from nearby areas and fulfills them in order to make money. She has eight years of experience in this work. She learned this art from her mother at a young age and now is being rewarded in the form of money for her talent. Her art is also helping her to improve her family's standard of living. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Asasah because she wants to expand her business. With the loan she will buy fabric and embroidery materials in bulk. In this way she will be able to work more and fulfill larger orders.

loans.use: Purchase embroidery materials and fabric for her embroidery business

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is an individual loan client with Esperanza and her story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). She is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries; where the main economic activity is a free trading zone, a cement factory, and others; and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her 4 children.

Olga is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy rice, flour, and other foods. Her business is a Colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally those colmados are in the same neighborhood, a short walk from any home. She will use the profits to change her house and business from wood to concrete block and give a safer home to her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: purchasing rice, beans, sugar, and flour for resale

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald P. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal East, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 46 years old. Ronald is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ronald owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Ronald has been engaged in his business for more than seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ronald joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronald has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ronald is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ronald from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand his product offering

loans.name: Bavawalala Development Group-Jinja

texts.en:
For the last six years Patrick M., a happily married 47-year-old father of two, has brought hard work to bear in the poultry-selling business that he operates from Buwenda-Jinja. Such an enterprise is a very worthwhile undertaking considering the high profits that can be earned.

After completing his national agro advisory services apprentice course, Patrick felt it would be a good time to establish another business in addition to his farming operation. While maintaining his farming activities, he devotes more time to his poultry sales, earning profits that add up to 40,000 shillings. Patrick is now requesting a loan to buy more layer chickens in order to expand the business.

loans.use: The purchase of more layer chickens

loans.name: Tunjung Wiguna Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut W. is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali.  Ni Ketut W. is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Tunjung Wiguna (PK-10254).

Ni Ketut W. is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, Ni Ketut W. owns & operates a business venture raising pigs for sale.  Ni Ketut W. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 90,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ni Ketut W. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Ketut W. is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK. She is requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  Ni Ketut W. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.



"

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Yanira Marisol

texts.es: Yanira Marisol G. de 39 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, el cual se encuentra en el oriente del país. Ella vive junto a sus cinco hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Como toda madre soltera Yanira debe trabajar muy duro por poder sacar adelante a su familia, es por ello que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como: cremas para el cuerpo y el cabello, perfumes, maquillaje y otros más, este producto lo vende en su casa de habitación y así mismo sale a comercializarlo con vecinos y amigos. Ella también comercializa ropa para niños, hombres y mujeres, esta  la vende de forma ambulante por diferentes colonias y cantones del departamento de Usulután, ella cuenta con muchos clientes fijos ya que ofrece muy buenos precios. Yanira solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio comprando productos de belleza y así mismo ropa en diferentes estilos, tallas y colores de forma que pueda abarcar mayor cantidad de clientes. El mayor deseo de Yanira es el de mejorar sus ganancias y de esta forma brindarle una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yanira Marisol G., 39, lives in Usulután Department, located in the east of the country. She lives with her five minor children who are students. Like every single mother Yanira must work very hard to raise her family. For this reason she is a beauty supplies merchant, such things as: body creams and hair creams, perfumes, makeup and others. She sells from home and also goes out to sell directly to neighbors and friends. She also sells children, women and men’s clothing in an itinerant way throughout the various neighborhoods of Usulután Department. She has many regular customers because her prices are very good. Yanira is asking for funds to buy beauty products and clothes of different styles, sizes and colors so she can attract a wider variety of customers. Yanira’s greatest wish is to improve profits so that she can offer her children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Agrivina Wangari

texts.en:
Wangari is 24 years old and married to Paul Munithi who is a businessman. She is newly married but takes care of her orphaned niece. She is a tailor and she also sells new clothes. She has been in the business for a period of ten years now with a monthly profit of approximately Kshs 7,000. 

She intends to use the loan to buy more tailoring materials and boost her husband's business. She was introduced to KADET LTD by KADET staff. She hopes to introduce a uniforms section in the tailoring business.

loans.use: Buy more textiles for dressmaking

loans.name: God Alive Group

texts.en:
Oretha M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'God Alive'.  She is 27 years old, married, and has one child who is three years old. She was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to lack of financial support. She cares for four siblings.

For 11 years, she has been operating a bakery in Duala Market in Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, butter, oil, baking powder, yeast, etc. She describes herself as a very quiet woman whose dream is to improve her business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Helena is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of flour, sugar, butter, oil, baking powder, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S. is 52 years old and lives with her husband and three of her children in Kandal province. To earn a living, she has been making and selling cakes in the local market and is able to make about US$6 every day. Her husband is a farmer, typically making US$1 a day. This couple also gets support from two children who are garment factory workers. Chea S. is asking for a loan of US$700 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Djahangir

texts.ru:
Djahangir H. 32 let. Djahangir yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy.

Djahangir uje 8 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji produktov v svayom maqazine. Etomu biznesu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit produkti dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en: Djahangir H. is 32 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli and now lives in the Absheron region with his family.  Djahangir has been involved in the business of selling products at his store for 8 years.  He learned this business from his father.  Currently, Djahangir needs 2000 AZN in order to buy products for resale.

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.ru: Махмудчонов Анварчон житель района Дж. Руми. Возраст, 28 лет. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Образование высшее, экономист. По профессии не работает. Занимается торговлей на центральном рынке района. У него собственный продуктовый магазин. В этой области он уже два года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Так как Анварчон только начинает свой бизнес, он хочет расширить свою деятельность и получить больше дохода.
texts.en: Anvarjon M., 28, lives in Rumi region. He is married with one child. Anvarjon has a university degree in Economics. However, he makes a living by selling goods at the central market. Anvarjon owns a grocery store. He has been in this business for two years, and is now applying for a loan in order to increase turnover. Since Anvarjon's business is still developing, he would like to increase turnover and profits.

loans.use: to increase turnover

loans.name: Monica Antonia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MONICA ANTONIA A. A.  DE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE CON SU CONYUGUE EL SEÑOR ALFREDO SACATOMA SURCO, ELLA  ES UNA MUJER MUY TRABAJADORA QUE SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA-VENTA DE PISCOS Y VINOS EN SU DOMICILIO, A LA VEZ LA SEÑORA MONICA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PECANAS, LA CUAL CULTIVA EN SU CHACRA EN DONDE TIENE UNAS PLANTAS DE PECANO. LA SEÑORA MONICA CUENTA CON 5 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO. SU ESPOSO EL SEÑOR ALFREDO SACATOMA, EL TRABAJA REALIZANDO OBRAS DE AGUA Y DESAGUE, AMBOS TIENEN DOS HIJOS DE 13 Y 8 AÑOS DE EDAD, AMBOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
texts.en: Monica Antonia A. A., 43, lives with her husband, Alfredo Sacatoma Surco.  She is a very hardworking woman who has a business buying and selling fish from her home.  Monica also sells pecans, which she cultivates on her fields where she has some pecan plants.  Monica has 5 years of experience in this line of work.  Her husband, Alfredo Sacatoma, does water and sewage work.  They have 2 school-aged children who are 13 and 8 years old.

loans.use: so that she can irrigate her pecan fields

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a samosa selling business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanaisha faces a major challenge of high competition in her business. She hopes to own a a café in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to renovate her house and purchase 50 pieces of blocks and sand. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her business.

loans.use: To renovate her house and purchase 50 pieces of blocks and sand.

loans.name: Milton David

texts.es:
Milton David A. G. tiene 28 años de edad, Es soltero, vive con los padres  en  el  Cantón de Moncache  Provincia los Ríos. No tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE   se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Santa Sofía, Todos los socios se dedican al cultivo de ciclo corto especialmente siembran maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.


Milton David se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Briones  y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca y G..

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa y un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Milton David A. G. is 28 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in the canton of Moncache, which is in Ríos province.  He does not have any children.

The members of the October 27th rural communal bank are based in the precinct of Santa Sofía. All of the group's members work in short-cycle agriculture, and in particular, they plant corn, rice, and pigeon peas. Collectively, they have been doing this work for a long time.

Milton David plants corn, rice, and pigeon peas. He buys products in the Briones market and sells what he produces in the Vaca y Garcia market.

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for cultivating corn, rice, and pigeon peas. With the economic support provided by this loan, he will be able to meet his needs. He faces challenges like insect plagues and crop illnesses, as well as the changing climate. His dream is to buy a house and his own plot of land.

He likes sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Prach

texts.en:
Mrs. Prach C. was born in 1967 and lives in Samraong village in Takeo province. She is married with five children, two of whom are employed in garment factories while the others are enrolled in public school. She and her husband, Mr. Nem Sok, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support their family. Nem Sok is also a construction worker.
Mrs. Prach C. has an ox, but she is not able to plow the rice field with just one ox. To improve this situation, Mrs. Prach C. is requesting a loan to buy another ox so that she has two oxen to plow.

loans.use: To buy an ox

loans.name: Julián

texts.es: El Sr. R. es originario del municipio de El Sauce, es un pequeño Agricultor y Ganadero que se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 33 años. Tiene dos años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde se le han otorgado tres créditos para la compra de ganado el que le ha permitido aumentar su inventario de animales y mejorar el nivel de vida de su esposa y sus tres hijos. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de una vaquilla.
texts.en: Senior R. is from the municipality of El Sauce, he is a small farmer and rancher and has been for 33 years.  Senior R. has worked with CEPRODEL for two years where he has been approved for three loans for the purchase of livestock. The loans have allowed him to increase his inventory of animals and improve the quality of life for his wife and three children. The loan that he is seeking is for the purchase of a heifer.

loans.use: To buy a heifer.

loans.name: Mujeres De Suenos Y Metas 2 Group

texts.es:
Cipriana es la coordinadora del Grupo Mujeres de suenos y metas 2. Su familia está compuesta por 4 hijos y su pareja, el cual es el padre de sus hijos. Viven en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, en una de las comunidades de mas escasos recursos ubicada al norte de la ciudad, en unas de sus comunidades rurales.  

Cipriana está muy emocionada de recibir su cuarto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional.  Ella opera un negocio de venta de comida rápida, en un puesto frente a su casa, su especialidad es comidas fritas. Va a invertir este nuevo préstamo en la compra de ingredientes como pollo, plátanos, aceite, carbón, un caldero para cocinar. Sus ganancias van a ser ahorradas para poder en un futuro poder tener un pequeño restaurante en su comunidad, lo que en República Dominicana le llaman un comedor. Este es uno de sus suenos al igual que pode tener una buena vivienda, donde pueda descansar y vivir segura.

Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque las cuotas de pagos son más flexibles y a un menor interés. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la República Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la República Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante.
texts.en:
Cipriana is the coordinator for the group “Mujeres de Sueños y Metas 2” (Women with Dreams and Goals 2). Her family consists of her four children and her partner who is the father of her children. They live in Santo Domingo in one of the poorest communities located north of the city. This community is in a rural area.

Cipriana is extremely excited about receiving her fourth loan from Esperanza International. She manages a fast food business from a stand in front of her house. Her specialty is fried food. She plans to invest her new loan in the purchase of supplies such as chicken, plantains, oil, charcoal, and a pot for cooking. Her earnings are being saved for the future so that she can open a small restaurant in her community, otherwise known as a “comedor” in the Dominican Republic. This is one of her dreams along with having a nice house where she can rest and live securely.

The group started with Esperanza because of the flexible payments and low interest rate. Cipriana’s story is representative of the other members of her group and clients of Esperanza. They are Haitians (most of whom have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some just recently) and Dominicans who live in poor communities that lack potable water and reliable electricity.

loans.use: Purchase chicken, plantains, oil, charcoal, and a pot for cooking

loans.name: Rhina Senayda

texts.es:
Rhina, tiene 33 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, vive con su familia, tiene 4 hijos de 3 años, 6 años, 10 y 14 años de edad, Rhina se dedica a una tienda y vende Hot Dog, la tienda está instalada en su casa, lo cual está pendiente de atender a los clientes la mayor parte del tiempo, las ventas de Hot Dog, ella prepara la venta y tiene empleados que se desplazan en bicicletas recorriendo varios lugares de San Miguel ofreciendo y vendiendo los Hot Dog, lleva ya 10 años de dedicarse a este negocio.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar bicicletas con carretón y otra parte en mercadería para la tienda, esta inversión le ayudara con el negocio, ya que al disponer de más bicicletas podrá emplear a nuevos trabajadores y aumentar su producción.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuertemente por lograr una empresa propia que logre abastecer varios lugares, mejorando su condición económica y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rhina is 33 years old and lives with her family in San Miguel in the Department of San Miguel. She has four children (ages 3, 6, 10, and 14). Rhina manages a store and is also a hot dog vendor. Her store is located in her home, which allows her to attend to her customers most of the time. For her hot dog business, she prepares the food and then her employees travel on bicycles to different places throughout San Miguel offering and selling hot dogs. Rhina has been in this business for ten years.

She currently needs a loan to acquire bicycle carts as well as merchandise for her store. This investment will help her with her businesses. She needs the additional bicycles because she plans to hire new employees and increase her production.

Her goals include working hard to expand her business to more places and improving the financial condition of her family.

loans.use: Purchase bicycle carts for selling hot dogs & merchandise for her store

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is a married woman who lives in Badian, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store and a food vending business. Her husband Romeo, who is 44 years old, works as a municipal driver to earn his living.  They have two children who are 7 and 15 years old. Belinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Belinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Belinda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth K. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Ruth has a salon, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase hair oil and braids for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ruth hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Ruth hopes to own a plot of land and build a house. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase hair oil and braids for resale.

loans.name: Cristia

texts.en:
Cristia T. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Cristia is single. To make a living, Cristia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Cristia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cristia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cristia has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Cristia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cristia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a dedicated businesswoman, borrower and mother of two who makes her living selling ice cream and other homemade sweets from a push cart. She loves her job because it allows her to walk around outside all day, exploring her neighborhood and getting exercise. Prior to receiving her first loan two years ago, Rosa worked handing out fliers at the supermarket, a job that didn’t provide her any opportunity for advancement. Rosa has always excelled in math and when she was younger she dreamed of becoming an accountant, but didn’t have enough money to invest in the necessary schooling. Now, she enjoys applying the analytic skills of her ice cream business - growing her customer base and increasing her profits year after year.

Rosa is seeking a fourth Grameen America loan of $3,000 to purchase new equipment for her cart and additional food to sell. When she isn’t working, Rosa spends her evenings cooking dinner for her family and encouraging her children to follow their dreams.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and food for her ice cream cart.

loans.name: Villa's Group

texts.en:
Villa is married to an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW). They are blessed with three children. They are harmoniously living at San Antonio, Cauayan City, Isabela. Villa manages a massage parlor where she earns 4,000 PHP a month. Villa's group members are determined to pursue their businesses to improve their living standard. 

Villa is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase needed materials and to open up her new massage parlor in their town. Her profits will be spent in food, shelter, and medicines. She hopes that Kiva and ASKI MFI will continue to support her business to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase materials to open a new massage parlor

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina tienen es muy conocida en su comunidad, ya que es la dueña de “Uñas Lemani”  un salón de belleza ubicado en Mollejones de Pérez Zeledón. 
Hace 5 años Carolina abrió su propio negocio, un salón de Belleza  que le ha permito superarse como madre y como microempresaria. La demanda es alta y necesita ampliar su negocio, es por eso que necesita un préstamo ₡594 000 (quinientos noventa y cuatro mil colones) para la compra de los materiales necesarios para ampliar su local y acondicionarlo con la herramientas de belleza necesarios. Carolina es muy positiva y asegura que podrá reembolsar su crédito sin ningún problema que el negocio crecerá aun mas, así como sus ingresos. 
Ella es socia de la empresa de Crédito Comunal Bancruce, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Carolina is very well known in her community since she is the owner of “Lemani Nails” a beauty salon located in Mollejones de Pérez Zeledón.
5 years ago, Carolina opened her own business, a beauty salon, that has allowed her to get ahead as a mother and a microentrepeneur. The demand for her services is high and she needs to expand her business and that is why she needs a loan of ₡594 000 (five hundred ninety-four thousand colones) to buy the materials necessary to expand her place and to set it up with the beauty tools necessary. Carolina is very positive and is sure that she will be able to pay back the loan without any problems since the business will grow as will her profits.
Carolina is a member of the Bancruce Communal Bank, one of the 110 member companies of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy beauty tools and construction materials.

loans.name: Marlly Lorena

texts.es:
A sus 24 años de edad y como madre de un hijo de 7 años, Marlly Lorena se vio en la necesidad de empezar a trabajar como independiente desde muy joven, pues con lo que su esposo ganaba no les alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos básicos del hogar.  Por ello, esta emprendedora Comenzó a vender ropa, zapatos y varios productos de uso personal.
