Aunque ella debe estar diariamente al frente de su hogar, su trabajo no le impide realizar sus labores como madre y ama de casa. Marlly lleva a su hija al colegio y mientras su hija estudia ella visitas sus clientes ofreciéndoles productos muy favorables y de muy buena calidad y así poco a poco ha ido ganando más clientes lo que le ha permitido seguir adelante con su negocio, sin descuidar sus responsabilidades en el hogar. 

Actualmente Marlly Lorena necesita de un préstamo para comprar mercancía que le permita incrementar sus ventas y proporcionalmente sus ingresos, ya que ella sueña algún día tener su propia casa brindarle darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. .
texts.en:
At 24 years of age and as the mother of a 7-year-old child, Marlly Lorena was obligated to work on her own from a very young age.  They could not cover basic household expenses with what her husband earned.  That is why this entreprenuer began to sell clothes, shoes and various products for personal use.

Eventhough she must run her household daily, her job doesn’t get in the way of her duties as mother and housewife.  Marlly brings her daughter to school and visits her customers while she is studying.  She offers them very good, high-quality products and little by little has gotten more customers.  This has allowed her to expand her business without neglecting her responsibilities at home.

Marlly Lorena currently needs a loan to purchase merchandise in order to increase her sales and her income proportionately.  She dreams of having her own house one day and of providing her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in order to improve earnings.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 34-year-old hard-working housewife who has five children to raise with her husband Maher.

The two of them decided four years ago to start a small business together and help each other to succeed, so they started selling cleaning products at home which opened a door during these four years to having a cleaning products refill business.

Now Maha is applying for this loan so they can buy more bottles and safe equipment to use when refilling and selling, so they can grow their business and expand. 

Since Maha is a conservative person, she asked that her husband could appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy more bottles and safe equipment to use while refilling cleaning products.

loans.name: Balikyegomba Kikonge Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 29 years old and married with four children aged between eight and one years old. She lives in her own house in Kibaale, Uganda.

For six years Agnes has had a retail shop, the profits from which have allowed her to buy a plot of land. She faces the challenge of high inflation but hopes to grow her business into a wholesale shop.

Agnes intends to use her loan to buy more soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Gina has a food shop where she sells snacks like rice & cassava cakes. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Gina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke rental business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 5 years.  She also earns additional income from food vending.    

Susan is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional videoke units for her videoke rental business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: purchase videoke units to rent

loans.name: Siria

texts.es:
La señora Siria es D. la ciudad D. Encarnación, está casada con el Señor Ambrosio y comenta que son muy felices en su matrimonio.
Ella se dedica a al comercio hace ya 16 años, venD. todo tipo D. artículos como ser ropas, calzados y demás. Gracias a este trabajo ella ha logrado mantenerse y mantener a su familia. Ella se siente muy orgullosa D. lo que hace ya que es un trabajo digno y muy honesto. Sueña con poder tener un local propio donD. poder exhibir las mercaderías que venD.. Ella es una cliente recurrente D. la Fundación y ha cumplido D. forma satisfactoria con sus créditos.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra D. ropas D. temporada D. invierno, con lo que podrá satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da, pues D. obtener el crédito, este le será D. gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Siria is from the city of Encarnación. She's married to Ambrosio and says that they are very happily married. She has been in sales for 16 years and sells all kinds of items such as clothing, shoes etc. Thanks to her work, she has been able to support herself and her family. She feels very proud of what she does since it's dignified and honest work. She dreams of being able to own her own store where she can display the merchandise she sells. She is a repeat client of the Foundation and has repaid her loans in a satisfactory way.

She is requesting this loan so she can purchase winter clothing in order to meet her customers' demand. She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity they are giving her. Receiving this loan will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for selling.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Virgincita has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA and AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy stock from NATASHA and AVON to sell in her store.

Virgincita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA and AVON to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, tomatoes and wheat flour.

loans.name: Emerlita

texts.en:
Emerlita is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children. 
Emerlita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Emerlita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Emerlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sari Madu Group

texts.en:
S. Madu Group has 15 members. The group is composed of women in the village who have the same business: raising pigs. They pursue this effort to support the family economy. The group members are located in a rural area so that their main job is as farmers, but with assistance from MUK, they want to pursue this business more seriously.

Ni Ketut, head of the group, is married and has two children who are married. Her husband worked as a builder. Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy two piglets and the rest to buy food. With this venture, she dreams of using the profits to fix her kitchen.

loans.use: To buy two piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 22 years old, married  to Tuyote and they have one child who is two years old.  She has been selling clothes for the last two years, and makes a monthly profit of KES. 10,000.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a group of clients, and is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, which she plans to buy more clothes to sell.

With the anticipated profits from the loan, Sophia will open another outlet where she will start selling beads to match the colors of the clothes she has been selling.

In the future Sophia plans to grow her business and provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Munkhtsetseg, 31, works in a bakery factory as a confectioner. She lives with her son and husband in a rental house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her salary does not meet her family's expenses often. This year, her son has entered secondary school and family expenses have been notably increased since then. Due to this, she decided to start her second business of a taxi with her husband’s old car. It is beneficial to increase her earnings further. Now she needs some money to make adjustments to the car for providing secure and comfortable service to the passengers.

loans.use: To make adjustments to the car for providing secure and comfortable service to the passengers.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, de 33 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Estelí, de oficio comerciante  dueño de una pulperia, es padre de tres hijos de 13, 10 y 1 año respectivamente. Sus hijos mayores están estudiando su esposa es ama de casa. El empezó este  negocio con capital propio, no tenia mucho que ofrecer, fueron pocos productos que vendía, vio la necesidad de invertir mas solicito un préstamo en otros lugares así fue levantando su pulpería, además el trabaja perforando hojas de tabaco en una  fabrica de puros estos son segundos ingresos, pues es por sus hijos que el se esfuerza cada  día para que no les falte nada y se preparen con estudios ya que  el solo logro cursar  hasta el tercer grado de la primaria no tuvo nadie quien lo apoyara y no quiere que eso le suceda a sus hijos. 
El requiere el préstamo para surtir su pulpería de productos tales como granos básicos, enlatados, papel higiénico, gaseosas, carne, pollo, snacks, dulces, detergentes, ambientadores, aceite, leche, huevos. Con esta inversión le ayudara a surtir su negocio de productos mas demandados por  sus clientes, mejorar sus ingresos. Una de sus expectativas es comprar2 estantes y vitrinas para exhibir sus productos e ir mejorando su pulpería poco a poco que cumpla con las necesidades de su vecindario
texts.en:
33-year-old Víctor is originally from the city of Estelí.  He owns a grocery store and is the father of three children who are 13, 10 and 1.  His older children are in school and his wife is a housewife.  Víctor started this business with his own capital.  At first, he didn't have much to offer and sold few products.  He saw the need to invest some more in his business and so requested a loan.  In this way, he gradually improved his grocery store.  Víctor also works perforating sheets of tobacco in a cigar factory which makes him a second income.  He works hard every day for his children, so that they don't want for anything and so that they can prepare themselves with a good education as Víctor himself was only able to study up to the third year of elementary school because he didn't have anybody to support him.  He does not want this to happen to his children.

Víctor needs this loan to stock his grocery store with products such as basic grains, canned goods, toilet paper, soda, meat, chicken, snacks, candies, detergents, air fresheners, oil, milk and eggs.  This investment will help him to stock his business with the products which are in most demand with his customers, and improve his income.  One of his hopes is to buy shelves and cabinets in which to display his products.  He would like to continue gradually improving his grocery store and meet the needs of his neighbors.

loans.use: to buy products such as basic grains, canned goods, toilet paper, soda, meat, chicken, snacks, candies, detergents, air fresheners, oil, milk and eggs

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe de 27 años de edad, convive con esmeralda de 25 años, fruto de esta relación tienen un hermoso bebé. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de puerto Amargura del distrito de LLochegua. Felipe es un joven con gran entusiasmo para las labores agrícolas, ya que desde muy pequeño estuvo insertado a estas labores, gracias a que sus padres fueron sus primeros mentores quienes le enseñaron a cultivar diversos productos. Actualmente se dedica al cultivo de cacao, y posee una buena extensión de terreno cultivado, y anualmente produce mas de 2 toneladas. Generalmente trabaja juntamente con sus personales de campo y su esposa quien esta al pendiente del niño y el bienestar de la familia. Su producto recolectado y una ves sacado lo vende en el distrito de LLochegua a los acopiadores a un precio rentable. Felipe esta sorprendido por los buenos resultados que tiene, gracias al buen manejo agronómico que realiza Felipe. En un futuro desea invertir en una tienda de abarrotes para que su esposa pueda dedicarse a ello y tener otro ingreso la familia. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará abono para fertilizar su campo agrícola.
texts.en:
Felipe, 27, lives with Esmeralda, 25 and they have a beautiful baby.  They live in their own house located in Puerto Amargura in Llochegua District.  Felipe is a young man with much enthusiasm for farming since he’s been doing this kind of work since childhood; his parents were his first mentors who taught him how to grow various products.  

He currently grows cocoa beans and he has a good sized plot of planted farmland; he produces more than two tons at present. He usually works alongside his farm hands and his wife cares for their baby and for the family’s wellbeing.  His product is picked and once collected he sells it in Llochegua District to grain gatherers at a profitable price.  

In the future he’d like to invest in a grocery store so that his wife can tend to it and they can have an additional source of income.  This will be his first MFP loan so he commits to make his installment payments punctually.  He will use the 1500 new soles to buy manure to fertilize his fields.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Alfonso Antonio

texts.es: Alfonso Antonio tiene 44 años, el se dedica a brindar el servicio de mecánico automotriz. Desde hace mas de 10 años que tiene de poseer conocimiento es este tipo de actividad. Lo aprendió por su Padre que desde muy joven le enseño a ganarse la vida de una manera humilde. Sueña con incrementar su capital de trabajo que le será beneficioso para mantener a su familia, pues como Padre responsable siempre esta brindándole sus hijos lo necesario. El crédito es para la compra de  herramientas como: llaves de ajustes, gatas, pinzas, limas, taladros, extractores, llaves de tuercas, llaves combinadas entre otros.
texts.en: Alfonso Antonio is 44 years old and provides automotive mechanic service.  He’s known this business for more than ten years, having learned it from his father when he was very young.  He taught him how to earn a living in a humble way.  He dreams of increasing his working capital which will help him to support his family.  As a responsible father, he always wants to provide for his children’s needs.  He will use the money from this loan to buy tools such as adjustable wrenches, jacks, pliers, files, drills, extractors, wrenches, and other things.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 51, married and has three children – two adults and a minor who is still schooling. He lives with his family in Murang’a, Central Kenya, where he has been in active farming for over 30 years. His farm currently produces milk and vegetables for the local market. Joseph laments the high cost of feed, especially for dairy cows.
Joseph has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming in addition to his vegetable and dairy farming. He hopes his enhanced farming will increase his household income and enable him to educate his child who is still schooling.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en: Basilisa, 52 years old, is married and has 6 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Basilisa has operated a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines for 10 years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store. In the future, Basilisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 27 years old, married to Osiaya and has three children. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the last three years and earns a monthly income of 6,200 KES. She is requesting her first loan of 25,000 KES from Kiva partner KADET. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of second-hand clothes for resale. With the anticipated profits she will expand her business to include new clothes.
Caroline's future dream is to grow her business into a large clothes boutique and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as honest and God-fearing.

For the past five years Margaret has operated a green grocery where she sells vegetables and fruit such as oranges, onions, kale, etc. Her business is located near a busy road where she attracts both repeat and new customers. The high cost of fruit and vegetables is her biggest business challenge.

Margaret will use her 20,000 KES loan from SMEP to buy more vegetables and fruit to sell. Her goal is to venture into a new retail shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice wants to build 3 rental rooms

loans.name: Delcho

texts.en: Delcho M. is a taxi driver for 10 years and works for one of the largest taxi companies in Kardjali. He drives his own car and during these years has earned a good reputation and lots of regular customers despite the great competition in this kind of business. Delcho is married and has two children. Now he needs some financial help to make repairs on his taxi. The loan amount is $ 1200.

loans.use: To make repairs on his taxi

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is originally from the city of Victoria, Tamaulipas. He used to work in a clothing factory, where he got the experience needed to start his own business and become independent. Four years ago, he got a loan from one of his brothers to buy a sewing machine and he started to make clothing. His business bloomed and now he has 4 employees that help him to fulfill customer orders

In order to continue growing, Antonio is requesting a loan of $550 that he will use to buy a collarette sewing machine. This will allow him to increase his production and make better quality products for his customers. He commits to pay back the loan over 6 to 12 months.

You can play an important role in Antonio's accomplishments. He sincerely thanks you for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonio es originario de la ciudad de Victoria, Tamaulipas, anteriormente él trabajaba en una maquiladora de ropa, de donde adquirió experiencia para iniciar su propio negocio e independizarse, recibió un préstamo de unos de sus hermanos hace cuatro años, con el que compró una máquina de cocer y comenzó a confeccionar ropa, su negocio ha prosperado y ahora tiene a cuatro empleados que le ayudan a poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes.

Para continuar creciendo, Antonio solicita un crédito por $ 550 dólares que utilizará en la compra de una máquina collarete, con esta incrementará su producción y ofrecerá un trabajo de mayor calida a sus clientes, el se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Antonio, él agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy a collarette sewing machine

loans.name: Adelio

texts.es:
Mr. Adelio C. is 44 years old. He is married to Mrs. Julia Bordón, 43, and they have 5 children. The oldest daughter, age 20, lives and works in Asunción; one of their children, age 18, lives with his parents and works in a workshop plating and painting cars. The youngest of their children is 3 years old, and the rest are adolescents who live with their parents and attend public schools. Mr. Adelio is a construction worker, but because he is not finding much work, right now he is working as a vendor selling notions like fashion accessories, scarves, handkerchiefs, and gloves, which he buys in Encarnación in order to get a better price. This loan will be used to diversify his merchandise and in that way increase his income and improve the quality of life for his family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El Sr. Adelio C. de 44 años de edad está casado con la Sra. Julia Bordón de 43 y tienen 5 hijos. La hija mayor, de 20 años, vive y trabaja en Asunción; uno de sus hijos, de 18 años, vive con sus padres y trabaja en un taller de chapería y pintura de automóviles. El más pequeño de los hijos tiene 3 años y los dos restantes son adolescentes que viven con sus padres y estudian en colegios públicos. El Sr. Adelio es constructor de obras, pero como no consigue mucho trabajo en ese ramo se dedica a la venta ambulante de artículos de mercería como bijouterie, bufandas, pañuelos, guantes que los compra en Encarnación porque obtiene a mejor precio. El crédito destinará a diversificar sus mercaderías y así aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To buy fashion accessories, scarves, handkerchiefs, and gloves

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan is 42 years old, married and has 2 children. He lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. Elshan has been running his own farm for 15 years.He is applying for a loan of $475 to buy pesticides to improve his farming business.

loans.use: He would like to buy  pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en: Aynur M. lives in Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan. She is 36 years old, married and has 2 children. She and her husband engage in cattle-breeding. They started their business 3 years ago. Aynur requests $900 to buy one cow.

loans.use: To purchase one cow

loans.name: Raya

texts.en: Raya is a widow with 5 children.  She lives in the Salyan region in the Yenikand village.  20 years ago, she started her farming business.  This woman was born in 1949.  Now, Raya needs a loan of $1200 to buy a plot of land to get a rich yield and to be able to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Jalgash

texts.ru:
Jalgash S. is 45 years old, he has a high school diploma with specialization in machinery, he is a photograph by profession, he has a wife and 8 children. Jalgash has been in agriculture for the past 5 years. He plans to use this credit to purchase fertilizer and wheat seeds for sowing. Jalgash plans to leave part of his crop for personal use and the other half to sell on a market to local people. This way, the locals will have an opportunity to purchase cheaper product because it comes directly from the producer. Here, wheat is used to produce flour and then to bake bread. Flour that is sold in stores is much more expensive than flour produced by Jalgash' method.

The client plans to bay back the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Сафаров Джалгаш, возраст – 45 лет, образование среднее-техническое, по специальности – фотограф, женат, имеет 8-х детей. Джалгаш занимается земледелием уже в течение 5 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение удобрений, семян пшеницы для засева земли. Собранный урожай он планирует часть оставить себе на личные нужды, а часть продать на базареместному населению. Таким образом местные жители получат возможность приобрести зерно по более низким ценам, так как прямо из рук производителя. Пшеницу здесь используют для производстива муки и дальнейшей выпечки хлеба. Готовая мука реализуемая в магазинах стоит намного дороже, по сравнению с мукой произведенной по этому методу. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of wheat seeds and fertilizer for sowing

loans.name: Nangwe Madibira (Iv) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Teopista D.. She is currently in the business of selling dry fish and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Teopista is 37 years old and married. She has 2 children aged 17 and 20, and both of them go to school. Each week, Teopista makes approximately UGX 200000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children . Teopista previously received a loan from BRAC Uganda in the amount of UGX 400000 to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Teopista is joined in her group by Aida N., Veronica N. and Madina S.. Aida N. has a hardware shop and wants to increase stock. Veronica N. operates a business selling hardware equipment and wants a loan to purchase additional stock. Madina S. operates a business selling clothes and wants to purchase more clothing for sale.

loans.use: To expand hardware business

loans.name: Kiyinki B1 East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah Musimbi. She is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan to purchase in bulk. Sarah is 32 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 2 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start a retail shop business.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Harriet M., Wakibi N., Hadijah B., and Hanifa M.. Harriet M. has a business running a supermarket and wants to add more stock. Wakibi N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge. Hadijah B. operates a matooke selling business and wants to purchase more matooke from the surrounding villages. Hanifa M. is currently in the business of paraffin sales and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To purchase more bunches of matooke from the surrounding villages

loans.name: Nkeruka

texts.en: Nkeruka U. is a married woman with 3 children. She is 38 years of age and comes from Lagos State,Nigeria. She sells frozen food, food stuffs and provisions. She has been with LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years and need the sum of $1200 to enable her to buy a refrigerator and more frozen food. This will help her improve her business. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food and a deep freezer

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with 5 children, ages 13 to 26 years old. Judith owns a small general store, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8 am to 9 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline O. lives in Adeloko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been selling fresh fish since 1999. Roseline is 52 years old and is married with 6 children. She has been a LAPO member for the past 3 years. Now she needs a loan of $600 to purchase a deep freezer so that she can meet the demand of her customers and thereby increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy one deep freezer

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mariama G. is 52 years old, married, has 5 children with her grandsons in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Boucotte Peyrissac for 5 years. She would like to buy dried fish and vegetables (carrots, cabbage, turnips, peppers, and others) to re-sell at the market in Ziguinchor. The income drawn from her business allows her to participate in her family's expenses and medical costs. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mariama G., 52 ans, mariée, 05 enfants dont des petits fils en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Peyrissac depuis 5 ans. Elle veut acheter des poissons séchés et des légumes (carottes, choux, navets, piments et autres) et revendre au marché de Ziguinchor. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer à la dépense familiale et aux soins médicaux. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and dried fish for resale

loans.name: Thi Thoa Chu Group

texts.vi:
Ms. C. Thi Thoa is 30 years old. She is a very dynamic and responsible woman. Her family has several businesses: selling coal, selling pork, raising pigs, and farming. She has borrowed before and has repaid the loans. This time she would like to borrow 240.00 USD to buy feed for pigs. In her group there are the following members: Ms. C. thị Lâm, loan amount 140.00 USD to invest in retail shop; Ms. C. thị Huế, loan amount 205.00 USD to buy pigs; Ms. Ngô thị Tý, loan amount 210.00 USD to raise pigs and buy feed for pigs; Ms. Nguyễn thị Duyên, loan amount 240.00 USD to raise pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

Chị C. thị Thoa năm nay 30 tuổi MS 09050066 chị là một phụ nữ rất năng động, đảm đang, gia đình chị có khá nhiều hoạt động tạo thu nhập: bán than, bán thịt lợn, chăn nuôi lợn, ttrồng trọt...Chị đã tham gia vay vốn và trả rất tốt, lần này chị đăng ký tham gia vay ở mức 3.808.000 VND để bổ sung vốn mua cám lợn. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên

  • Chị C. thị Lâm MS 09050015 vay mức 2.242.000 VND để thêm vốn bán hàng
  • Chị C. thị Huế MS 09050065 vay mức 3.360.000 VND để mua lợn giống
  • Chị Ngô thị Tý MS 09050045 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để chăn nuôi và mua cám lợn
  • Chị Nguyễn thị Duyên MS 09050043 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn

loans.use: retail

loans.name: Sedina

texts.en: Sedina is a divorced woman from a place called Čubrić, near the town Banovići. She receives support for her two sons, 12 and 19, in the amount of 280 KM. Sedina will use this first loan at Women for Women International, in the amount of 1400 KM, to buy up more used clothes and to expand her clothing fund. Her wish is to maintain her selling and her income, because this is the only secure source of income for her family.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Tedy

texts.es: Tedy de 54 años de edad, es padre soltero, a pesar de cargar con la responsabilidad que tiene con sus 2 hijos lo hace con alegría, trabaja duro por darles lo necesario, los cuales son su razón de seguir adelante.Él es un hombre muy activo pues, aparte de tener su negocio de venta de productos naturales, lleva a vender “Juanes” (potaje típico de la selva, a base de arroz) por diferentes lugares de su zona, y cuando termina, continua con sus productos naturales, pues se considera un hombre activo y trabajador.Tedy quiere crecer en su negocio y con el tiempo llegar a tener una  tienda de sus productos naturales, para esto requiere de un capital que lo incentivará a lograr sus metas en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Tedy is 54 years old and he is a single father. He works hard to provide for his two sons, who are his motivation to keep moving forward. He is a very active man: not only does he sell a variety of natural products; he also sells "Juanes," a typical vetegable stew made out of rice. When he finishes selling this product to people near his area, he keeps working hard and continues selling his other natural products. Tedy wants his business to grow, and he wants to have a store where he can actually sell his products. A short term loan will help him achieve his goals in a short time span.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of natural products that he sells

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
L. señora Rosario pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en el Jr. Guillermo Sisley Nº 372, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 32 años D. edad, es madre D. 2 hijos menores D. edad que aún dependen D. elL., es casada y su esposo trabaja en L. atención D. su negocio “Venta D. repuestos”. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. ManueL. Ramos D. S/. 300 decidió invertir en L. venta D. golosinas. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.

En L. actualidad se dedica a L. venta D. repuestos en casa. Se levanta temprano para atender a sus menores hijos y luego se dedica a L. atención D. su negocio. 

Con este préstamo D. S/1,200 el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará 12 llantas, 20 unidades D. catalinas, 6 cajas D. aceite para motos, 20 cajas D. cadena, etc. 

Rosario manifiesta que ManueL. Ramos es una ayuda para su familia. Se siente feliz porque se relaciona con mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Rosario belongs to the "Vecinas Unidas" ("Neighbors United") Communal Bank located at Jr. Guillermo Sisley Nº 372, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 32 years old, the mother of tow young children, married, and her husband works selling spare auto parts. With her first loan from ManueL. Ramos, she invested in selling candy. She has been working with the communal bank for four years. Currently, she sells spare parts from her home. With this loan of $400 dollars, which she will repay in four months, she will buy 12 tires, 20 units of bearings, six boxes of motor oil, 20 boxes of chains, etc. Rosario says that ManueL. Ramos is a help for her family. She is happy because she connects with other working women.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires, bearings, motor oil, chains, etc.

loans.name: Hae

texts.en: Mrs. Hae M. is 29 years old and lives in Trapaing Trapaing village in the Kampong Cham Province. Hae is a duck breeder. Her business is doing well and she would like to buy more ducks and duck feed with the requested loan. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Tan Chep, is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. Mrs. Hae M. has two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and duck feed to expand her breeding business.

loans.name: Yett

texts.en:
Mr. Yett Y. is a villager in Krodas Kor village in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. He is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so he decided to ask for a loan to buy two more piglets for breeding. In addition, he would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to support his wife’s field and improve the soil.

Mr. Yett Y. is 45-years-old and the father of a child who is attending the local school. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy two more piglets for breeding and fertilizers to improve the soil.

loans.name: Abuah

texts.en:
Abuah H. sells groceries and fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale at Elmina. Abuah has received no formal education. She is married and has 5 dependents. Her husband is a motor mechanic.

Abuah has been selling groceries and fish since 2004. She is responsible for helping her husband pay rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her large family.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Moven Pick Group

texts.en:
Happy H., age 32, is married with two children, ages 5 and 15. She sells clothes. She started this business in 2008. She takes the clothing and sells it upcountry. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 89.

This will be Happy’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first two to increase her stock by buying more clothes to sell and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to open a beauty salon.

Happy will share this loan with subgroup C of the "Maven Pick" group. The subgroup has 7 members who run cafes and salons, sell clothes and vegetables. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Happy is second from the right.

loans.use: To open a salon

loans.name: Khalida Parveen M. Munir Group

texts.en:
Khalida parveen baji is a 35 year old married lady and a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 30 years. Khalida baji married a man whose name is M. M. and he is a driver by profession, something he has done for the past 10 years. Khalida baji is the mother of six children: one son and five daughters. Her son runs a workshop where he repairs different kinds of vehicles, e.g. motorbikes, rickshaws. All of her daughters are getting an education from a local school near their house. Khalida baji performs her duties as a wife, a mother and a seamstress also. She sews clothes to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy repair tools for her son. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Rakhshanda yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones to sell. Parveen baji and Jamila khatoon baji each want a loan to buy fruit for their fruit selling businesses. Shakeela naz baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy repair tools for motor workshop

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Felista S. from Mwanza. She is divorced with three children between the ages of 13 and 18. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two other dependents because they are orphans.

Felista has been running a bar for selling local beer since 2002. Her business is selling different types of beers and she works at the business for 16 hours per day, seven days per week. Felista currently earns about $150 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy beers like Serengeti castle lager, Kilimanjaro, ndovu, balimi and konyagi, and soda and water for resale. In the future, she plans to innovate and build her business. Felista thanks you for the support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy beer, soda and water for resale

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
Houssein is a 32-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife. Houssein has been working as an electrical and home repairman. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Houssein has requested a loan.

Houssein is special in his field because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Houssein decided on doing this business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his shop.

loans.use: Purchase tools for work

loans.name: Djatougbé Améyo

texts.fr: Madame zougbédé a appris la couture, n’ayant pas assez de moyens pour ouvrir un atelier de couture, elle s’est lancée en 2007 dans le commerce  de produits d’alimentation générale, elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de Vogan et de tsévie. Elle veut ajouter à son commerce la vente de Gari qui est faite à base de farine de manioc et  qui se mange avec de la sauce. Elle  sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 sacs et pouvoir assurer des frais de  transport. Elle est mariée et à 01 enfant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zougbédé learned sewing, however, not having sufficient means to open a sewing workshop, she began selling groceries in 2007. She buys her merchandise in the markets of Vogan and Tsévie. She wants to begin selling "gari" as well; "gari" is made of manioc flour and is eaten with stew. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 20 sacks and pay for transporting them. She is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of manioc flour for re-sale

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 32 years old Nelly M. from Tukuyu. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 3 and 13. Nelly has been running a clothes business since 2006. Her business is purchasing and selling clothes.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Nelly currently earns about US $90 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Nelly thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk for her business

loans.name: Maria Selene

texts.es: Maria Selene B. T. tiene 44 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de edades adolescentes y 1 de un año de edad, ella se dedica desde muy joven a la costura la que fue una actividad que su propia madre le enseño, y aunque ella tiene otro oficio decidió quedarse trabajando en este desde que su esposo quedo desempleado, sin embargo de sus malos momentos sacaron buenos frutos ya que de la liquidación que se le dio a su esposo decidieron comprar telas para empezar a vender ropa hecha por ella misma, de esta manera ella cosía y confeccionaba estilos de ropas y su esposo le ayudaba en ir a venderlas, hoy en día esta es la fuente de ingresos para su familia, Maria Selene elabora: sacos de vestir, vestidos de novia, trajes, pantalones, y muchas mas prendas, sin embargo Maria necesita un financiamiento que le permita invertir en este negocio para comprar telas, agujas, botones, broches además darle mantenimiento a sus maquinas de coser y mejorar unos estantes de muestra para exhibir sus atuendos.
texts.en:
Maria Selene B. T., 44, has 2 older children and 1 one-year old baby. She has earned money as a dressmaker since she was very young, work that she learned from her mother, and though she has another trade, she decided to dedicate herself to this line of work when her husband became unemployed. Her husband's bad luck had a silver lining, though, because they decided to buy material and sell the clothes that she makes. She sews and makes clothes and her husband helps her to sell them. The business is now the main source of income for the family. Maria Selene makes jackets, bridal gowns, suits, pants and many other clothing pieces. Maria Selene needs a loan that will allow her to invest in the business. She will buy material, needles, buttons, etc., and service her sewing machines. She also wants to improve the display shelves where she exhibits her outfits.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Honeylyn

texts.en: Honeylyn P. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 37 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Honeylyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, primarily selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Honeylyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Honeylyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Yene

texts.es:
Yene es socia del Banco Comunal Kutimuy que significa Regresa en quechua.
Yene es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Yene vende vino, caña, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, sus productos los comercializa en la feria de San Felipe donde también vende verduras y frutas. Además Yene vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Yene necesita un préstamo de 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas variadas.
Los sueños de Yene son tener una casa propia y tener un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Yene is a member of the Kutimuy community bank, which means "Return" in quechua. Yene lives with a partner. She is 28 years old and has two children. She sells wine, cane, products that she acquires in the city of Lima. She sells her products in the San Felipe fair where she also sells fruit and vegetables. In addition, Yene sells catalog cosmetics. Yene needs a loan of 450 soles which will be invested in the purchase of a variety of fruit. Yene's dreams are to have her own home and a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of a variety of fruit.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie S. is from the village of Danao. She is 26 years old. Elsie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 13,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
la sra. MARIA MAGDALENA C. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia la cual esta ubicada en el Benque, Jamastran, la pulperia opera bajo el nombre de pulperia "GINA".
este negocio le ha permitido generar capital para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Doña C. es madre casada, tiene 1 hijo el cual lo mantiene de las entradas que le genera su negocio, para que el pueda salir adelante con sus deberes.- 
Doña Magdalena tiene 3 años de estar al frente de este tipo de negocio en el cual cuenta con una buena clientela por la calidad de mercaderia y sus precios que son bajos.
sra. Maria compra para tener buena apariencia de su local y asi poder generar mas ganancias.
necesita el credito para comprar al por mayor.
texts.en:
Señora MARIA MAGDALENA C. is dedicated to selling products for personal consumption. She has a small grocery store, which is located in el Benque in Jamastran. Her store is called, "Gina." This business has allowed her to generate capital to improve her quality of life. Doña C. is a mother and is married. She has one son, who has a play area in front of her store, so she can get her work done. Doña Magdalena has had this business for three years, and she has a good clientele due to her quality of merchandise and her low prices. Maria buys things that will give her store a good appearance so she can generate more profits. She needs a credit to be able to buy things wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy churros, drinks, soup, margarine, oil, salt, beans, bread, rice, milk, coffee, cookies, candy, cereal, tortillas, wheat flour, and juice.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Sr. Félix está casado con la Sra. Segunda hace varios años, tienen 4 hijos mayores todos casado e independientes de ellos.-
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que esta ubicado  en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizaron anteriormente como asalariados.-
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando han  educando a sus hijos y comprado todas las necesidades de su hogar.-
El Sr. Félix además de la despensa trabaja como empaquetador de carbón en su domicilio
El ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
El ya tuvo otros créditos con nosotros y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones,-
texts.en:
Sr. Félix has been married to Sra. Segunda for several years. They have 4 grown children who are all married and living independently.

Together they run a small grocery store in their home, which is located in a very crowded neighborhood of the district. They began with a little capital that they got from other jobs they had carried out previously as wage earners. Thanks to the work they are accomplishing they have educated their children and purchased all the necessities of their household.

Aside from the grocery, Sr. Félix works at packaging charcoal in his house. He has shown himself to be a very responsible and honest person in keeping his commitments. He has already had other loans with us and fulfilled his obligations in excellent fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of varied merchandise:  sugar, rice noodles, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Lesley

texts.en:
Lesley is married to Benny. They live in the village of Labni, Mabuslo in Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. They are blessed with three children: Benedick, Rhyzlyn and Clarissa Mae. Their eldest is now a first year high school student and the other two are in the elementary level.

Lesley sells vegetables and her husband operates a tricycle transport service. She and her husband work together to support the needs of their family, especially the education of their children.  

Her dream of a sustainable business gave her the idea of requesting a loan from Kiva lenders. She is requesting PHP 5,000 to use as additional capital to improve her business and to maintain their tricycle transport business. She is hoping that the lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Maria Pascuala

texts.es: Doña Maria Pascuala es originaria de la zona 3 del municipio de Totonicapan  es casada con tres hijo, ella inicia su propio negocio en el año dos mil  en la venta de verduras y pollo pero en el puesto donde ella vendia el negocio no hera rentable por lo que decide cambiar su negocio en el dos mil seis  en la venta de productos de plasticos desde esa fecha sus ingresos han mejorado por lo tanto necesita incrementar su producto  ya que se aproxima las fiesta de fin de año como el dia de los difuntos, como la manifiesta que es favorable compra por mayor en la ciudad de Guatemal.
texts.en:
Maria Pascuala is from the Zona 3 in the Totonicapán municipality. She is married and has three children. She started her own business in 2000. She sold vegetables and chicken. However, the place where she sold was not profitable. She decided to change her business. In 2006 she started selling plastic products. Since that time her income has improved. She needs to increase her product because the end of the year holidays like the Day of the Dead are approaching. She says that it is favorable to buy wholesale in the city of Guatemal.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Ablawa Antoinette

texts.fr: K. Ablawa Antoinette est née en 1955 et vit depuis trente sept ans à Cadjehoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Ablawa Antoinette est mariée à ADJAMAYISSO Athanas, un menuisier. Le couple a cinq enfants dont trois sont à leurs charges. Ablawa Antoinette vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par les deux conjoints. Ablawa Antoinette a arrêté les classes au primaire et depuis dix ans, elle s'est mise dans la vente de farine de manioc, de l'arachide grillé ainsi que d’huile d’arachide et d’huile de palme à son domicile. Ablawa Antoinette s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits et qui a bien remboursé son crédit. Ablawa Antoinette sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour accroître son fonds de roulement et augmenter son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Ablawa Antoinette K. was born in 1955 and has lived for thirty seven years in Cadjehoun à Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Ablawa Antoinette is married to Athanas Adjamayisso, a carpenter. The couple has five children of which three are still in their care. Ablawa Antoinette lives together with her spouse and her children that all attend school. The family expenses are borne by the two spouses. Ablawa Antoinette quit primary school and, for ten years, she has dedicated herself to the sale of manioc flour, roasted groundnuts as well as groundnut oil and palm oil from her residence. Ablawa Antoinette supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market of the Benin. She is a former customer of ALIDé that already has benefited from three loans, which she repaid well. Ablawa Antoinette requests a fourth loan from ALIDé, to increase her working capital and increase her sales.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manioc flour, and cans of palm oil and groundnut oil for resale

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: El joven Marlon Antonio A. J. , tiene la edad de 26 años , habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como despachadora de una tienda , para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen un hijo de dos años a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es poder construir su vivienda , ya que actualmente habita en un cuarto que le dio su mamá , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su salario no le ajusta para realizar la compra de materiales de construcción de una sola vez , el joven Marlon desde hace tres años labora como bombero en el municipio de Ticuantepe , agradece a Afodenic por la confianza y el apoyo con su primer aprobación de su préstamo . El cual va a invertir en materiales de construcción como: piedra, cemento, arena, hierro, zinc y poder comenzar a construir.
texts.en:
The young man Marlon Antonio A. J. is 26 years old and lives in the town of Juan Ramon Padilla with his wife. He works as a dispatcher for a store in order to support their household expenses. They have a two-year-old son, and their plan is to build a house, because right now they live in a room that his mom gave them. The biggest challenge is that his salary has not been raised in order to purchase construction materials this one time. Marlon also works as a firefighter in the town of Ticuantepe for the past 3 years. He thanks Afodenic for the trust and support given with his first approved loan. He will use it to invest in building materials such as stone, cement, sand, iron, zinc and will be able to start building their home.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc and other materials to begin building his house

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en: Simeon, a resident of Ughelli, Delta State, Nigeria, is 38 years old and married with three children. His youngest child is just two weeks old and he is very happy about his new baby.  Simeon sells electrical materials at retail prices to his customers and one day hopes to own a big electrical shop.  He is requesting a loan of 65,000 NGN to purchase more electrical materials to sell. Simeon says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Morrison

texts.en:
Morrison K. is 52 years old and has one child with his wife Joyce K.. He has been in the clothing business for the last four years. Morrison has just applied for a loan from KADET, the only micro-finance institution he has ever done business with. He learned about KADET through various marketing and promotion activities carried out by people in Naivasha town, where he lives.

Morrison will use this loan to increase his stock of items, such as pants and shirts, in order to meet high demand during the Christmas season. His future goal is to own his own boutique.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell to customers during the holidays season

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen, 43 years old, is married and has three children who are all currently in school. Ellen lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a touristy coastal community in the central region of Ghana. The major occupation of the local people is fishing.

Ellen is a merchant. She runs a provisions store by the roadside in the community. She procures her goods from Accra. According to Ellen, she has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn M. is a villager in Mreah Prov village in Takeo province. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is a laborer. Her husband, Mr. Nop Puoy, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He is shown on the left of the photo.
Mrs. Yorn M. is a silk weaver who makes a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it and has asked for a loan to buy more silk and another raw material to weave.

loans.use: To buy more silk and another raw material to weave

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy G. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PALENE de 3 ans et demi. l'objectif de son crédit est de renforcer sa boutique en marchandises diverses tel que du riz, du sucre, de l'huile etc.. afin de réaliser des bénéfices qui lui permettront de contribuer à la prise en charge de sa famille
texts.en:
Amy G. is a 48-year-old married mother of 4 children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) of Palene for 3 and a half years. The goal of this loan is to increase her store's stock of various merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, etc. in order to realize a profit that will allow her to contribute to taking care of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and develop her commercial activity

loans.name: Mrs. Shinang Uom Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group loan, which consists of 17 people, is located in Akreiy Ksat village in Kandal province. Mrs. Shinang U. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. They all will use the loan for different purposes. She is a vegetable seller in the local market and her husband, Mr. Poura Mum, is a construction laborer. They can earn less money; however, this family tries to work hard with their careers. So in order to improve their family's living condition, Mrs. Shinang U. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell to expand her business. She is a mother of three children. Two of her children are enrolled in local public school and the other one helps the parents. Mrs. Sovana Oruch is the group guarantor.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to re-sell

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina is married and has two grown-up children. She sells clothing - mainly women's hats and scarves - at Krytiy market in Zaporozhye city. There is very little competition for the type of clothing she sells. Galina attracts her clients with the variety and good quality of her inventory. Galina would like to receive a loan of 12,100 hyrvnia to purchase spring inventory. She loves her business and gets help from her son, who makes trips to the Kharkov bulk market to purchase goods.

loans.use: To purchase spring inventory

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is a 35-year-old man, married and blessed with two children. He distributes bread to retail shops in his residential area.  He has been operating this business for three years and he has one employee.  He has managed to build rental houses to rent in order to increase his income. Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money. He hopes to expand his business and to sell poultry products. He dreams of starting a bakery and building a house for his family in the future.  He has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 to start a bakery and buy bakery equipment.  He describes himself as ambitious and hardworking.

loans.use: To start a bakery

loans.name: Twegate B Kayesu Annet Group

texts.en:
Annet K. is a 22-year-old business lady. She is married with two children, of whom one is going to school, and she has two other dependents schooling too. She has been dealing in the clothing business for five years so far. 

She is using the loan to purchase clothes from different towns to bring to Kisekende for sale. She is adding stock, which is improving her business. Her future hope is to work very hard for the welfare of her family, especially the children.

loans.use: To purchase clothes from different towns to bring to Kisekende trading center for sale

loans.name: Marilyn's Group

texts.en:
Marilyn D. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Alicia, Isabela. She is 41 years old. Marilyn is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marilyn is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2005, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov C., 37, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. 

She buys lotus seeds for sale for an income of about $7 per day. Her husband sells sugarcane juice, earning an income of $3.50 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

C. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more lotus seeds for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s studies. This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy more lotus seeds for resale

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza Sambuunyam is 58 years old and lives with her husband in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her husband live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). All of her children are grown up and live separately from them. 

Liza operates a dairy product trading business in her town. She has been successfully operating her business since 2004. Liza started her business with 90,000 MNT working capital, and after years of successful operation, today her working capital exceeds 800,000 MNT. Since she started her business, her family's standard of living has improved.  

She is an industrious person who has very good communication skills. She says, “My dream is one day to have my own plot of land with a house and yard.” Liza is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products to resell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more diary products

loans.name: Good Sisters Group

texts.en:
Oneikeh F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Good Sisters. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children who range from 9 to 20 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulties. All of her children are attending school.

For 5 years, she has been selling cooking oil on a table in the Congo Town Community, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollars portion of this 38,000 Liberian dollars group loan to buy more cooking oil.

Her dream is to grow her business, make more profit, move from selling on a table to a shop, and continue to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. L., 53 years old, lives in the province of Kompong Tom, Cambodia, where she owns and farms a plot of land next to her house, raising pigs and crops to earn a living. She crops twice a year, and she was taught how to raise pigs and farm by her grandfather. She is a good mother and has four children. Two children are now married and live away from home, while the other two are single. Her husband works on the farm with her. L. doesn’t have enough supplies to use on the field during this coming rainfall season. So, L. has requested a loan to hire a laborer to plow the farmland and then to buy fertilizer and seed to grow. Note: Mrs. L. was busy at her business activity when the photo taken so her married son is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to grow.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: Gregoria, de 52 años, es viuda y tiene tres hijos; Juan, Bertha y Wilder de 16, 13 y 11 años respectivamente. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva cusqueña, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa. Todo inició cuando desde muy joven empezó a trabajar para un agricultor, en ese entonces cultivaba y cosechaba cacao, ella sentía que no tenia posibilidades de crecimiento y que solo con el sueldo que recibía procuraba ahorrarlo con la finalidad de tener su propio negocio. Actualmente cultiva y comercializa frutas, específicamente piña, y gracias a las enseñanzas de cultivo que le dieron sus padres, puede ahora obtener productos de alta calidad, por las cuales sus compradores más potenciales se sienten satisfechos, de esta manera este negocio le está dando buenos resultados económicos. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, en temporada de cosecha contrata personal para que le faciliten la extracción y traslado de sus productos hacia los centros de acopio de su comunidad, con la finalidad de poder venderlo a un precio justo. Sus planes a futuro es abrir su propia tienda con la finalidad de poder tener más ingresos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además agradece a su grupo comunal por la solidaridad que se dan entre cada uno de los compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir para darle un adecuado cuidado a sus plantaciones, comprando insumos y abono, para prevenir las plagas u otras afecciones que atacan a las piñas.
texts.en:
Gregoria, age 52, is a widow. She has three children, Juan, Bertha, and Wilder, ages 16, 13, and 11, respectively. They live together in the beautiful jungle of Cusco province, located in the town of Quimbiri, where they have their own house.

When she was very young, she began working for a farmer who was then growing and harvesting cacao. She felt that she didn’t have any chance of progressing, and, only with the salary that she was receiving, she took pains to save money with the goal of having her own business.

Currently, she grows and sells fruit, specifically pineapples. Thanks to the education in farming given to her by her parents she now obtains high quality products with which potential purchasers are satisfied. Because of this the business is giving her good economic results.

In general, she works by herself, but occasionally she receives help from her children, and during the harvest season she hires people to assist her in picking and transferring her products to collection centers in her community with the goal of being able to sell them for a fair price. Her plan for the future is to open her own shop in order to be able to have greater income

This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she has promised to continue making all her payments. She is thankful to her communal group for the solidarity shown to each one of her colleagues. She plans to invest the loan she is applying for in giving adequate care to her crops by purchasing supplies and fertilizer in order to prevent disease and other infections that attack pineapples.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and supplies in order to care for her pineapple crop.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine J. is currently in the business of selling bedsheets, dresses and headdresses at the market and is requesting a loan to stock trousers and shoes to sell.

Josephine is 41 years old and is married to a head teacher. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: To stock trousers and shoes to sell
